The Buddha’s physical forms are equal to sentient beings— He causes them to see him according to their inclinations; Flame Banner Clearly Showing understands this in his heart And practices this technique, producing joy.
Buddha cultivated an ocean of myriad blessings— Pure, vast, without any bounds: Light of Virtue Banner, taking this approach, Contemplates, comprehends, and is happy in mind.
Sentient beings ignorantly wander through various states of existence; Like people born blind, after all they cannot see. Buddha appears in the world to help them: Pure Light enters this door.
The Buddha’s powers are boundless, Like clouds covering all the world; He appears even in dreams to teach: This is what Fragrant Banner perceives.
Sentient beings are foolish and ignorant, as though blind and deaf, They are shrouded by all kinds of obstructing veils; Buddha’s light penetrates them, making them open up: Such is the entry way of Mountain of Jewels.

de la snying po byang chub kyi lha dge ba dri ma med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas mang po mchod pa yang dag par 'byung zhing sngon gyi smon lam gyi rgyan ston pa zhes bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha ri rab spo'i rin po che'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ 'gro ba thams cad dang mngon sum du byang chub kyi spyod pa yang dag par sgrub cing 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha dbyangs kyi 'brug sgra sgrog pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa la sangs rgyas ston cing / rmi lam gyi mthar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'brug sgra sgrog pa zhes bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha me tog gi char sna tshogs 'bab pa'i mig gi rnam par thar pa ni/ dka' ba thams cad yongs su gtong zhing / rin po che'i char 'bebs pa'i rgyan ces bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha 'od 'phro mang po shin tu dri ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa ni/ 'dul ba'i sems can yongs su smin par byed cing / snying po byang chub phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa zhes bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha me tog gi phreng ba 'od kyi gtsug phud kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sems can thams cad kyi dbang po bzhin du chos tshul zab mo dran pa ston pa 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha rin po che'i rgyan gyi char rab tu 'bebs pa'i rnam par thar pa ni/ dga' ba yang dag par myong ba mtha' yas pa la yang dag par 'jug pa zhes bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha mthu dam pa spos kyi mig gi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang legs pa rab tu brjod pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha rdo rje sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ snying po byang chub kyi lha rnam pa mtha' yas pa yang dag par ston pa'i rgyan ces bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha pad+mo'i shing snang ba'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ byang chub kyi shing yongs su zhi bas phyogs rgyas par byed pa zhes bya'o/ / snying po byang chub kyi lha dge ba'i lta ba sna tshogs rnam par ston pa'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs sna tshogs yang dag par rgyu ba zhes bya'o/ /

Furthermore, the sanctuary spirit Banner of Pure Adornments found the door of liberation of the power of commitment to produce vast adornments to offer to the Buddha. The sanctuary spirit Polar Mountain Jewel Light found the door of liberation appearing before all sentient beings perfecting the practice of great enlightenment. The sanctuary spirit Sign of the Thunder found the door of liberation causing all sentient beings to see the Buddha in dreams teaching them according to their mentalities and inclinations. The sanctuary spirit Wonderful Eyes Raining Flowers found the door of liberation able to rain all precious adornments that are hard to part with. The sanctuary spirit Form of Pure Flowers found the door of liberation able to manifest beautifully adorned sanctuaries, teach many beings, and cause them to develop to maturity. The sanctuary spirit Garland Light Topknot found the door of liberation teaching the truth according to beings’ faculties, causing them to develop right awareness. The sanctuary spirit Raining Jewel Arrays found the door of liberation able to eloquently rain everywhere boundless joyous truths. The sanctuary spirit Courageous Fragrant Eye found the door of liberation extensively praising the virtues of the Buddhas. The sanctuary spirit Diamond Colored Cloud found the door of liberation causing arrays of trees of boundless colors and forms to appear. The sanctuary spirit Lotus Light found the door of liberation being still and unmoving under the tree of enlightenment yet being present everywhere. The sanctuary spirit Radiance of Ineffable Light found the door of liberation demonstrating the various powers of a Buddha.

de nas snying po byang chub kyi lha dge ba dri ma med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus snying po byang chub kyi lha'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
At that time the sanctuary spirit Banner of Pure Adornments, imbued with power from the Buddha, looked over all the sanctuary spirits and said,

bskal pa mang po mtha' dang dbus med par/ / de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar sngon spyad dran/ / sangs rgyas thams cad mchod cing bsgrubs pas na/ / de phyir de yi bsod nams nam mkha'i tshad; ;
zhing rnams mtha' yas tshad med 'dra med par/ / mi zad gtong ba'i sgo nas sngon btang bas/ / ri bo'i spo yi 'od kyi lha de ni/ / bder gshegs dran zhing rab tu dga' bar 'gyur; ;
bder gshegs sprul pa rnam pa mtha' yas pa/ / de dag zhing rnams kun tu rab tu rgyu/ / 'gro bar sangs rgyas rmi lam bzhin ston cing / / sprin gyi sgra dbyangs lha de rab tu dga'/ /
mtha' yas bskal par dka' ba rab spyad de/ / dang ba'i spyan gyis 'gro la phan pa'i phyir/ / rgya mtsho'i spyan yang yongs su sngon btang ste/ / de la me tog mig gi lha dga' 'o/ /
yon tan rin chen 'od 'phro mtha' yas sprin/ / 'gro ba kun tu snying po byang chub nas/ / rab tu bkye ba'i sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul gyis/ / 'od 'phro 'gyed pa'i lus kyi lha yang dga'/ /
sems can rnams kyi spyod pa rgya mtsho ste/ / de la rgyal ba chos kyi char yang 'bebs/ / ji ltar mos par nem nur rnam par sel/ / de yis gtsug phud 'phyang ba dga' ba thob; ;
rgyan gyi char 'bebs mig bzang lha de ni/ / sems kyi skad cig gcig gis tshad med pa'o/ / chos don dbyings kyi bye brag mtha' yas pa/ / rgya mtshor tha dad yang dag shes pas 'jug /
zhing rnams brjod du med pa thams cad du/ / 'gro ba kun la sangs rgyas legs brjod pas/ / de phyir yon tan sangs rgyas zhing kun grags/ / de ni rjes su spos mig lha yang dran/ /
mtha' yas shing gi rnam pa sna tshogs gzugs/ / byang chub shing la kun kyang ma lus bstan/ / rdo rje sna tshogs sprin gyi lha de ni; ; byang chub shing la dga' bar rnam par lta/ /
sangs rgyas ye shes snying po byang chub la/ / phyogs rnams kun tu mtha' dang mu med de/ / pad+mo snang zhing gsal ba'i lha de ni; ; rnam thar rnam yangs 'di la rab dga' 'o/ /
sangs rgyas stobs rnams yongs dag bsam mi khyab/ / snying po byang chub 'dir ni kun kyang grag / yang dag bsgrubs pas byung ba de dag ni/ / thams cad sna tshogs snang ba'i 'od nyan to/ /

I recall the Buddha in former times, The practices he performed for countless eons, Making offerings to all the Buddhas who appeared— So he has virtues vast as all space.
The Buddha practiced unlimited generosity In infinite lands, numerous as all atoms; Thinking of the well-faring Buddha, Polar Mountain Light’s heart is glad.
The physical forms of Buddha have no end; His transformations pervade all lands, Always appearing, even in dreams: Thunder Banner, seeing this, gives rise to joy.
He practiced relinquishment for countless ages, Able to give up eyes, hard to part with, enough to fill a sea— This practice of relinquishment was for the sake of all beings: This Wonderful Eyes happily understands.
Boundless forms, like blazing clouds of jewels, Appear in sanctuaries throughout the world: The spirit Form of Pure Flames rejoices Upon seeing the mystical power of Buddha.
The ocean of sentient beings’ activities is shoreless; The Buddha fills it with the rain of truth, Removing doubt and confusion according to potential: Flower Garland, realizing this, is pleased.
The different meanings of innumerable teachings Are delved into by his oceanic eloquence: The spirit Raining Precious Adornments Is always thus in mind.
In unspeakably many lands He praised the Buddhas in all languages, And therefore has great fame and virtue: Courageous Eye can keep this in mind.
Infinite trees of various forms Appear beneath the king, tree of enlightenment: Diamond Colored Cloud realizes this, And always watches the tree with delight.
Bounds to the ten directions cannot be found— Likewise the knowledge of Buddha on the site of enlightenment: Lotus Light’s pure mind of faith Enters this liberation and profoundly rejoices.
Everything at the site of enlightenment produces exquisite sound Extolling the pure, inconceivable powers of the Buddha As well as the perfected causal practices: This can be heard by Ineffable Light.

de la rkang gis 'gro rin chen dpal gyi phyag rgya'i rnam par thar pa ni/ dga' ba yangs pa rin po che'i char gyis kun tu khyab pa zhes bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro pad+mo snang ba'i 'od zer gyi 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi sku 'od zer gyi kha dog pad+mo'i dra ba thams cad du ston pas dga' bar byed pa zhes bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro me tog gtsug phud kyi dpal dri ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa ni/ sems kyi skad cig thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs dang / rgyan 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro shin tu mdzes par gnon pa'i rnam par thar pa ni/ gom pa 'dor ba thams cad du sems can mtha' yas pa 'dul ba'i rgyan ces bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro rin chen dpal gyi rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ skad cig gcig gis pad+mo'i dra ba sna tshogs sprul pa byed cing rin po che'i char pa dang / dbyangs dang / snang ba kun tu 'gyed pa zhes bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro dga' ba'i dbyangs snyan pa'i rnam par thar pa ni/ dga' ba'i shugs dang nyams bde ba rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro shing tsan+dan gyi 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du spos kyi ngad sprin du ldang ba zhes bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro pad+mo yid du 'ong ba'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ pad+mo'i gseb thams cad nas yid du 'ong ba'i chos kyi dbyangs 'byung bas snang ba skyed pa zhes bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro rdul gyi shugs kyi 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ lus kyi 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyi dra bas snang ba 'byed pa zhes bya'o/ / rkang gis 'gro me tog mang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sems can thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya mtshos yang dag par bskul ba 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ /

Furthermore, the footstep-following spirit Precious Symbol found the door of liberation raining jewels all over, producing bountiful joy. The footstep-following spirit Lotus Light found the door of liberation showing the Buddha seated on a lotus throne of lights of all colors, causing delight to those who see. The footstep-following spirit Supreme Flower Topknot found the door of liberation setting up the sanctuaries and assemblies of all Buddhas in every moment of thought. The footstep-following spirit Embodying All Beautiful Visions found the door of liberation pacifying and harmonizing countless sentient beings at every step. The footstep-following spirit Exquisite Gem Star Banner found the door of liberation in every moment of thought magically producing various lotus-like webs of light, everywhere raining showers of jewels producing marvelous sounds. The footstep-following spirit Joyfully Uttering Sublime Sounds found the door of liberation producing boundless oceans of joy. The footstep-following spirit Sandalwood Tree Light found the door of liberation awakening the assemblies at all sites of enlightenment with a fragrant breeze. The footstep-following spirit Lotus Light found the door of liberation emanating light from every pore intoning the subtle sounds of truth. The footstep-following spirit Subtle Light found the door of liberation producing from the body webs of various lights illumining everywhere. The footstep-following spirit Collection of Fine Flowers found the door of liberation enlightening all beings and causing them to develop oceans of virtues.

de nas rkang gis 'gro rin chen dpal gyi phyag rgyas sangs rgyas kyi mthus rkang gis 'gro'i lha'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
At that time the footstep-following spirit Precious Symbol, imbued with the Buddha’s power, surveyed all the assembled footstep-following spirits and said in verse,

dga' ba rgya mtsho'i tshul gyi shugs bskyed cing / / bskal pa mtha' yas sngon chad spyod pa mdzad/ / zhing rnams kun rdul shin tu phra mnyam pa'i/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyang dgyes pa'i thugs kyis mchod/ /
skad cig sems la pad+mo brjod yongs pa/ / dri zhim sna tshogs mngon par sbrul mdzad nas; ; zhing rnams kun tu rgyal ba gshegs mdzad pa/ / snang ba'i 'od zer lha des rab tu mthong / /
'dren pa rnams kyi chos nyid bsam mi khyab/ / 'khor rnams kun tu 'byams klas mtha' yas pa'i/ / rnam par 'phrul pa mi zad rab tu ston/ / me tog gtsug phud lha des de mthong ngo/ /
phyogs bcu'i zhing gi dbyings rnams ma lus pa/ / thams cad kun tu gshegs shing bzhud pa yis/ / sems can mtha' yas yongs su smin par mdzad/ / shin tu mdzes pas dga' bar de mthong ngo/ /
sems can snyed kyi sprul pa kun 'phros pa/ / re re'i sku yis chos kyi dbyings kyang 'gengs/ / rin chen dri med 'od kyang rab tu gtong / / rkang 'gro dpal gyi mtshan gyis 'di mthong ngo/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul mtha' yas te/ / 'khor du rgyal ba chos kyi char yang 'bebs/ / bder gshegs de yi 'khor na dgar gnas shing / / dga' sgra dbyangs kyis rnam thar de mthong ngo/ /
sangs rgyas dbyangs ni mkha' dang mnyam pa ste/ / dbyangs kyi yan lag yon tan kun dang ldan/ / 'jig rten kun bkang sems can rnam par 'dul/ / tsan+dan shing gi 'od ni de la nyan/ /
spu rtse kun nas rgyal ba rnam 'phrul dang / / dus gsum gshegs pa'i rgyal ba'i mtshan gyi rnams/ / sgra bsgrags thos shing dga' ba skyer 'gyur te/ / de ni rdo rje 'od kyi lhas mthong ngo/ /
de bzhin gshegs sku bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / gom pa gom par yon tan rgya mtsho ston/ / de dag sems can ji ltar mos pas mthong / / rdul gyi 'od kyi lhas ni de mthong ngo/ /
'jig rten mgon po rnam 'phrul rnam mang gis/ / phyogs bcur sems can yang dag skul bar mdzad/ / me tog 'khor mang rkang pas 'gro ba'i lha; ; mthong zhing dga' ba yangs pa rab tu thob/ /

Buddha practiced for innumerable eons, Making offerings to all the Buddhas, His mind always joyful, never wearied, His joy as deep and vast as the sea.
His spiritual powers, active every moment, are immeasurable— He produces lotuses of various fragrances, With Buddhas sitting on them, traveling all over: Lotus Light sees it all.
The teaching of the Buddhas is thus: The vast assemblies fill all directions; They show mystic powers which can’t be assessed: This Supreme Flower clearly perceives.
In all places in the ten directions, With every step he takes He can develop all beings: This Beautiful Visions understands.
He manifests bodies numerous as beings; Each of these bodies fills the universe, All shedding pure light and showering jewels: This liberation Star Banner enters into.
The realm of the Buddha has no bounds; He showers the rain of truth, filling all— Seeing the Buddha, the masses rejoice: This is what’s seen by Sublime Sound.
The Buddha’s voice is equal in extent to space— All sounds and voices are contained therein; It tames sentient beings, extending to all: Thus can Sandalwood hear.
All his pores emit magical sounds Extolling the names of Buddhas of all times; All who hear these sounds are delighted: Thus does Lotus Light see.
The disguised appearances of the Buddha are inconceivable— His physical forms are like the ocean, Causing all to see according to mentality: This is what Suble Light apprehends.
Displaying great mystic powers everywhere, He enlightens all beings: Fine Flowers, seeing this truth, Becomes joyful at heart.

de la lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha khrel dang dge bas rgyas pa'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sngon gyi smon lam rjes su dran pas rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya'o/ / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha 'od zer phyogs su snang ba'i rnam par thar pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams mu med par sangs rgyas kyi 'od rnam par ston pa'i rgyan ces bya'o/ / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha sgras 'dul ba rgya mtsho'i dpal gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'dul ba'i sems can thams cad la brjod cing yang dag par bskul bas dga' ba 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha rgyan bzang po'i me tog gtsug phud kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs kun nas rab tu gnas pa 'byung ba zhes bya'o; ; lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha spyod yul mtha' yas dpal gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul 'gro ba rnams la yang dag par ston pa'i mthu zhes bya'o/ / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha snang ba'i phreng ba 'dzin pa'i dpal gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sems can thams cad gso ba dang 'dres pa'i mdangs kyis dga' ba zhes bya'o/ / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha spos dri ma med pa'i sprin las char 'bebs pa'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri ma mngon par sel ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o/ / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha srung 'dzin yongs su sdud pa'i rnam par thar pa ni/ sems can thams cad kyi bdud kyi las dang rmongs pa rnam par zlog pa zhes bya'o/ / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha sgo kun nas yongs su gnon pa la mngon du gyur pa'i mig gi rnam par thar pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyi gnas su rgyal ba rnam par dmigs par mngon du ston pa'i rgyan ces bya'o/ / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha khrel dang dpal mi g.yo ba'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni; sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i shugs thams cad yang dag par 'dzin cing yang dag par sbyong ba zhes bya'o/ /

Furthermore, the multiple-body spirit Realm of Pure Joy found the door of liberation remembering the ocean of Buddha’s ancient vows. The multiple-body spirit Light Illumining All Directions found the door of liberation of light shining everywhere on boundless worlds. The multiple-body spirit Oceanic Sound Conquering found the door of liberation of a great sound awakening all beings and causing them to be happy and harmoniously tranquil. The multiple-body spirit Pure Flower Adorned Topknot found the door of liberation of a body like space, omnipresent. The multiple-body spirit Infinite Dignified Postures found the door of liberation showing all sentient beings the realm of the Buddhas. The multiple-body spirit Array of Supreme Light found the door of liberation causing all famished sentient beings to be physically healthy and strong. The multiple-body spirit Fragrant Clouds of Pure Light found the door of liberation clearing away all sentient beings’ defiling afflictions. The multiple-body spirit Guardian Sustainer found the door of liberation overturning all sentient beings’ ignorant, foolish, maniacal actions. The multiple-body spirit Ubiquitous Shepherd found the door of liberation manifesting adornments in the palaces of all world leaders. The multiple-body spirit Immutable Light found the door of liberation embracing all sentient beings and causing them to produce pure roots of goodness.

de nas lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha khrel dang dge bas rgyas pa'i 'od kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
At that time the multiple-body spirit Realm of Pure Joy, empowered by the Buddha, looked over all the multiple-body spirits and said,

ri rab rdul phran shin tu phra snyed kyi/ / bskal pa de dag pha snga'i bskal pa ni/ / rdul ces bya bar 'od mdzes 'od zer rgyal/ / mchod de smon lam btab pa bdag gis dran/ /
sangs rgyas sku las 'od 'phro rab bkye ba/ / de yi 'od zer chos kyi dbyings su rgyu/ / rgyal ba'i 'od zer dra ba sems can 'dul/ / 'od 'phro 'od zer lha yis de mthong ngo/ /
dbyangs kyi yan lag yon tan kun rgyas pa'i/ / sangs rgyas gsung ni zhing rnams kun tu sgrog/ / 'gro ba ma lus thams cad yang dag skul/ / dbyangs kyis 'dul ba de la dga' bar nyan/ /
rgyal ba'i sku ni rab tu zhi la ltos/ / sku gzugs du ma'ang mtshan nyid mi mnga' ste/ / 'gro ba kun na'ang bzhugs par rab tu snang / / me tog gtsug gis ji bzhin nyid du mthong / /
'dren pa'i chos nyid bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / sems can de dag dad pa ji bzhin du/ / la la bzhugs dang bzhengs dang gshegs par mthong / / de yang spyod lam 'byung ba'i lhas mthong ngo/ /
rgyal ba'i tshems kyi mtshams rnams thams cad nas/ / dri zhim 'od 'phro sgron ma'i sprin bkye bas; ; 'gro ba kun gyi nyon mongs zhi bar 'gyur/ / dri med spos kyi sprin gyis de mthong ngo/ /
sangs rgyas mgon po 'gro ba'i skyabs su byung / / nyon mongs rmongs shing sdug bsngal gzir ba rnams/ / mgu bar mdzad cing nyon mongs thams cad bcil, / snang ba'i phreng ba 'chang bas 'di mthong ngo/ /
'dren pa bskal pa brgyar yang shin tu dkon/ / rang byung 'jig rten don mdzad skyes pa ni/ / 'jig rten kun gyi dbul ba rnam par sel/ / khrel yod dpal gyi 'od snang de skad smra/ /
sems can nyon mongs sgrib pas nyon mongs shing / / bdud kyi las kyis dkrugs te 'phyan pa'i rnams/ / de dag rgyal ba rnam thar lam ston te/ / srung zhing skyong ba'i dpal gyis de mthong ngo/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba ltos/ / sangs rgyas sprin gyis chos kyi dbyings mnan cing / / 'jig rten dbang po gnas su sems can 'dul/ / kun sgo'i mig gi dpal gyi spyod yul lo; ;

I remember, countless eons ago, A Buddha, Sublime Light, appeared in the world; This World Honored One, in the presence of that Buddha, Vowed to attain enlightenment, and served all Buddhas.
Buddha’s body emits great light, Which fills the entire cosmos; When beings encounter it, their minds are subdued: This is seen by Illumining All Directions.
Buddha’s voice makes all countries tremble; Every sphere of sound Awakes all beings without exception: Conqueror, hearing, rejoices at heart.
The Buddha body is pure, ever calm, Manifesting all forms, yet without any signs, Abiding this way everywhere in the world: This is the approach of Pure Flowers.
The Guide is so inconceivable, Causing all to see according to their minds— Sometimes sitting, or walking, or standing: Infinite Dignified Postures understands this.
A Buddha is hard to meet even in a million eons— He appears in the world to give help freely, Causing beings to be free from the pains of destitution: Here is where Supreme Light Array enters.
Each of the Buddha’s teeth Emits blazing clouds of light, as from a fragrant lamp Destroying the illusions of all sentient beings: Undefiled Clouds sees in this way.
Beings’ attachments and delusions are multiple barriers— They follow demons in their ways, always involved in routines; Buddha shows them the way to liberation: Guardian Sustainer can understand this.
I see the independent power of Buddha, His light filling the universe; In royal palaces he edifies beings: This is the realm of the Ubiquitous One.
Beings are deluded, full of miseries— Buddha is in their midst, always saving, Causing delusions to vanish and joy to abound: This is what’s seen by Immutable Light.

de la lag na rdo rje mthu chen kha dog bzang po'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ yon tan mtha' yas pa dang gzugs kyi sku rnam par dpyod pa yang dag par ston pa zhes bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje nyi ma'i shugs kyi rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ba spu las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi sprin sna tshogs kyi rgyan 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje ri rab me tog 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ rnam par 'phrul ba rgya chen po bstan pas yon tan mtha' yas pa'i lus su 'phrul ba zhes bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje rnam dag sprin gyi dbyangs kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs mtha' yas tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba zhes bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje dbang po shin tu mang ba'i rnam par thar pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa ston cing / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yang dag par bskul ba zhes bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje rdo rje'i 'od yid du 'ong ba'i rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dbyings rab tu phye ba thams cad ma lus pa la yang dag par spyod pa zhes bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje shing gi sgra dbyangs kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ shing gi lha thams cad 'dren pa'i rgyan yid du 'ong bas brgyan pa zhes bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje seng+ge'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i rnam par thar pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams kyi dkyil 'khor yangs pa'i tshogs kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i 'od ces bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje 'od 'phro stug po dpal gyi mig gi rnam par thar pa ni/ sems can mi rungs pa'i rgyud la lus 'jigs 'jigs ltar rab tu ston cing kun tu rnam par lta ba zhes bya'o/ / lag na rdo rje rin chen gtsug phud pad+mo 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i gtsug gi nor bu rin po che thams cad kyi char mngon par 'bebs pa zhes bya'o/ /

Furthermore, the thunderbolt-bearing spirit Demigod of Wonderful Form found the door of liberation seeing the Buddha manifest a body of infinite physical forms. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Banner of Swiftness of the Sun found the door of liberation of each hair of the buddha-body radiating clouds of various light beams, like the sun. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Light of the Flowers of the Polar Mountain found the door of liberation of great mystic powers manifesting innumerable bodies. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Pure Sound of Clouds found the door of liberation of infinite sounds corresponding to all species. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Great-Armed God found the door of liberation appearing as the leader in all worlds and awakening sentient beings. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Delightful Light found the door of liberation revealing all the different aspects of the Buddha’s teachings. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Sound of Thunder in Great Trees found the door of liberation bringing together all the tree spirits with delightful ornaments. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Lion King Light found the door of liberation fulfilling and clearly understanding the Buddha’s vast array of blessings. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Auspicious Eye of Intense Flames found the door of liberation observing the minds of sentient beings on dangerous paths and manifesting a magnificently adorned body for them. The thunderbolt-bearing spirit Lotus Jewel Topknot found the door of liberation showering everywhere the jewel topknots adorning all enlightening beings.

de nas lag na rdo rje mthu chen kha dog bzang po'i 'od kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus lag na rdo rje'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
At that time the thunderbolt-bearing spirit Demigod of Wonderful Form, empowered by the Buddha, said in verse,

chos rgyal chos kyis mdzes pa yi/ / chos nyid de la rnam par ltos/ / yon tan mtha' yas sku gzugs kyis/ / 'jig rten kun tu rnam par mdzes/ /
sangs rgyas ba spu thams cad nas; ; 'od zer dra ba bsam mi khyab/ / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra ba ste/ / phyogs bcu kun tu rnam par mdzes/ /
sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul de dag gis/ / chos kyi dbyings su khyab byas shing / / 'gro ba kun gyi mngon sum du/ / mi zad sku ni shin tu ston/ /
sangs rgyas gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni/ / zhing rnams kun tu rab tu sgrog / gsung gi sems can thams cad kyi; ; bsam pa thams cad rab tu 'gengs/ /
'jig rten dbang po kun gnas na/ / thub pa rab tu bzhugs par snang / / de dag thams cad 'khor rnams la/ / 'dren pa dag ni chos ston mdzad; ;
rgya mtsho chos kyi sgo bskul bas/ / gzhan dang gzhan gyi tshul dag gis/ / thams cad chos kyi bye brag don/ / rgyal ba zad med rab tu ston/ /
rgya chen mtha' med tshul dag la/ / rgya mtsho 'khor rnams rab tu 'jug / sangs rgyas 'od zer rab 'dres pas/ / kun gyis 'dren pa mthong bar 'gyur/ /
zhing rnams bye ba'i rdul snyed du/ / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun mchod pas/ / bsod nams rgya chen nam mkha' bzhin/ / kun gyis 'dren pa rab tu mthong / /
sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul ma 'dres pa/ / thams cad zhing du ston pa mdzad/ / 'gro la sangs rgyas mngon sum du/ / byang chub snying por rnam par mdzes/ /
'od zer sna tshogs dkyil 'khor gyi/ / 'od 'phro sprin ni kun tu snang / / chos dbyings kun tu khyab byas shing / / sangs rgyas spyod yul rab tu ston/ /

Observe the King of Truth— The teaching of the King of Truth is thus. His physical forms have no bounds, Manifesting throughout the world.
Each of the Buddha’s hairs Is an inconceivable act of light, Like the clear orb of the sun Illuminating all lands.
The spiritual powers of the Buddha Pervade the entire cosmos— In the presence of all sentient beings, He manifests infinite bodies.
The sound of the Buddha’s teaching Is heard in all quarters; According to the type of being, He satisfies all their minds.
The masses see the honored sage In the palace in the world For the sake of all the living Expounding the great teaching.
In the whirlpool of the ocean of truth, With all kinds of different doctrines, Various appropriate techniques, He teaches without end.
Those boundless great techniques Respond to all the lands; Those who meet the Buddha’s light All see the Buddha-body.
Having served all the Buddhas, Many as atoms in a billion lands, His virtue is as vast as space, Looked up to by all.
His mystical power is impartial, Appearing in all lands; While sitting at rest in the sublime enlightenment site He appears before all sentient beings.
Blazing clouds illumining all With various spheres of light Extending throughout the universe, Showing where the Buddha acts.
bam po lnga pa/

de la byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i rnam par thar pa ni/ tshul gyi rgya mtsho bsam gyis mi khyab pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho la 'jug ste; 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba dang / 'gro ba 'dul ba la mthar thug par mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung du phyin pas yon tan gyi tshogs thams cad kyi yul zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sa nas sar smon lam rgya mtshos rab tu gnas pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / sgo thams cad nas chos kyi dbyings su bdag gi lus kyi sprin rdul snyed mtha' yas pas rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / zhing thams cad du rang gi ming bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'khor lo sgrog pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad kyi sbubs su byang chub sems dpa'i yul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa mtha' dang dbus med pa yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / dus gsum gyi bskal pa skad cig gcig tu ston pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbang po rgya mtsho'i yul phan tshun du 'jug pa yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / gang 'di chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med par rang gi lus kyi sprul pas rgyas par rnam par 'phrul pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / gang 'di byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad kyi tshul phan tshun du ston pa rgya chen pos thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa bdag go /

Furthermore, the enlightening being Universally Good entered into the ocean of techniques of inconceivable doors of liberation, and entered into the ocean of virtues of the Buddha. That is to say, there was a door of liberation called purifying all buddha-lands, pacifying the sentient beings and causing them all to be ultimately emancipated. There was a door of liberation called going to all realms of complete virtues cultivated by all the Buddhas. There was a door of liberation called the great ocean of vows defining the stages of all enlightening beings. There was a door of liberation called everywhere manifesting infinite bodies, numerous as atoms in the cosmos. There was a door of liberation called explaining an inconceivable number of different names throughout all lands. There was a door of liberation called showing all the boundless realms of enlightening beings’ psychic powers in all atoms. There was a door of liberation named showing the events of the formation and decay of the ages of past, present, and future, in the space of an instant. There was a door of liberation named showing the oceans of faculties of all enlightening beings, each entering their own spheres. There was a door of liberation named ability to make various bodies appear by mystic powers all throughout the boundless cosmos. There was a door of liberation called showing the processes of all enlightening beings’ practices, entering into the great techniques of universal knowledge.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po rnam par thar pa'i tshul rgya mtsho bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho la 'jug cing / sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor rgya mtsho yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

At that time, the enlightening being Universally Good, by virtue of his own accomplishment, and also receiving the spiritual power of the Buddha, having looked over the ocean of all the assemblies, spoke these verses,

zhing rnams rgyal bas dri med rnam par sbyangs/ / mkha' yangs rdul bzhin yon tan tshad kyang med/ / sngon gyi rgyal ba'i sras po dri med pa/ / de la bsam yas chos sprin char yang phab/ /
ji ltar rgyal ba gdan la bzhugs snang ba/ / de bzhin rdul sbubs ma lus kun na'ang ste/ / 'on kyang bder gshegs gshegs dang 'pho ba med/ / zhing rnams kun tu yul med rab tu ston/ /
sa yi tshul la 'jug pa tshad med de/ / spyod pa thub pas byang chub sems dpa' bstan/ / bsam gyis mi khyab tshul ni kun gsungs pas/ / rgyal sras rnams ni chos kyi dbyings la 'jug/ /
chos dbyings 'jug tshul rnam pa rgya che ste/ / mtha' yas phyogs su mtha' dang dbus med sgo/ / rdul phran sbubs su rgyal ba 'phrul ba spros/ / 'gro ba'i bsam pa kun kyang rab tu mkhyen/ /
phyogs rnams thams cad zhing rnams kun tu yang / / 'jig rten gtso mtshan 'gro dang mnyam par byung / / thams cad tshul sgor sangs rgyas don yod de/ / 'dul bas sems can thams cad rnam par sbyong / /
rdul sbubs kun tu mtha' dang dbus med pa'i/ / rnam 'phrul yangs pa rang byung shin tu ston/ / sngon chang thub pa'i byang chub spyod pa rnams/ / ji bzhin kun kyang snying po byang chub brjod/ /
yangs dus bskal pa ji snyed yod pa'i rnams/ / skad cig skad cig sangs rgyas ma lus ston/ / der ni sems can 'byung zhing 'jig pa'ang bstan/ / 'jig rten gtso bo'i ye shes bsam yas ltos/ /
'byams klas mi zad mtha' yas lo grangs pas/ / rgyal sras thams cad sangs rgyas sa lta ste; ; thams cad sgor yang sangs rgyas mtha' dbus med/ / rgyal sras kun gyis shes par smra ba min/ /
sangs rgyas mkhan 'dra rnam par mi rtog ste/ / chos nyid mi gnas chos kyi sprin dag gis/ / sprul pas spyod tshe kun tu rgyas mdzad cing / / shing mchog kun drung byang chub 'tshang rgya bstan/ /
sangs rgyas gsung de rab tu brjod pas na/ / chos gnas thams cad ma lus brjod pa yin/ / 'gro ba thams cad re re'i sgo dag nas/ / sangs rgyas chos rnams kun la rab tu 'jug /

The immense, vast fields adorned by the Buddha Are equal in number to all atoms; Pure children of Buddha fill them all, Raining the inconceivable, most sublime teaching.
As in this assembly we see the Buddha sitting, So it is also in every atom; The Buddha-body has no coming or going, And clearly appears in all the lands there are.
Demonstrating the practices cultivated by enlightening beings, The various techniques of innumerable approaches to their stages, Expounding as well the inconceivable truth, He causes the Buddha-children to enter the realm of reality.
Producing phantom buddhas numerous as atoms, Corresponding to the inclinations of all beings’ minds, The expedient doors into the profound realm of truth, Boundlessly vast, all he expounds.
The Buddha’s names are equal to the worlds, Filling all lands in the ten directions; None of his methods are employed in vain: He tames sentient beings and purifies all.
The Buddha, in every atom, Displays infinite great mystic powers— Sitting in each on the enlightenment site, He speaks of past Buddhas’ enlightening deeds.
All immense eons of past, present, and future, Buddha reveals in every instant— All the events of their formation and decay His inconceivable knowledge comprehends.
The congregation of Buddha’s children is endlessly vast; But though they try together to fathom Buddha’s state, The teachings of the Buddhas have no bounds— To thoroughly know them all is most difficult.
Buddhas like space, without discrimination, Equal to the real cosmos, with no resting place, Phantom manifestations circulate everywhere, All sitting on enlightenment sites attaining true awareness.
Buddha teaches widely, with wonderful voice— All stages of enlightenment are thoroughly clear. Appearing before each sentient being, He gives all the Buddha’s equal truth.

de la byang chub sems dpa' dge ba dri ma med pa'i gzi brjid kyi 'od yid du 'ong ba'i rnam par thar pa ni/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du mngon par byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'gro ba'i rgyan byed pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'ong mchog kun tu sgron ma'i rnam par thar pa ni/ sems skad cig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sgo zad mi shes pa ston cing chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pas yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par 'dul bar byed pa'i 'od ces bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu 'bar ba seng+ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / zhing yang dag par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi 'od zer kun tu 'od 'phro ba'i rnam par thar pa ni/ rdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyis rnam par spyod pa don yod pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' yon tan rgya mtsho kun tu sgra dbyangs rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan thams cad 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du yang dag par ston pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ye shes kun tu snang ba'i 'od kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su kun nas song zhing chos kyi dbyings la rnam par spyod pa'i sprin chen po'i snying po zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' gtsug na rin chen kun tu rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi spyod pa la rab tu zhugs shing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mtha' yas pa shin tu 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i gsung kun tu 'jam dbyangs kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad bsnyen bkur zhing mchod par nye bar 'gro ba'i snying po zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams mi zad dri med kun tu gzi brjid kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rgya chen po 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' mtshan gyi 'od zer kun tu snang ba'i rnam par thar pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa sku med pa las sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ /

Furthermore, the enlightening being Sublime Light of Pure Virtue, the great spiritual hero, found the door of liberation going to all assemblies of enlightening beings in the ten directions and adorning the sites of enlightenment. The enlightening being Light of the Supreme Lamp of Universal Virtue found the door of liberation in a single instant showing endless entrances to attainment of true awakening, teaching and developing inconceivable worlds of sentient beings. The enlightening being Lion Banner of Universal Light found the door of liberation cultivating the enlightening beings’ adornments of blessings and virtue, producing all buddha-lands. The enlightening being Subtle Light of Flames of Universal Jewels found the door of liberation observing the realms of the Buddha’s mystic powers, without confusion. The enlightening being Banner of Oceans of Qualities of Universal Sounds found the door of liberation showing the adornments of all buddha-fields in one congregation at a site of enlightenment. The enlightening being Light of Universal Knowledge Illumining the Realm of Buddha-hood found the door of liberation following the Buddha investigating the most profound and enormously vast matrix of the cosmos. The enlightening being Light of Inexhaustible Virtue of Universal Purity found the door of liberation entering into all mundane activities and producing the boundless practices of enlightening beings. The enlightening being Universal Supreme Light found the door of liberation able to manifest the spheres of all Buddhas within the formless realm of truth.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba dri ma med pa'i gzi brjid kyi 'od yid du 'ong bas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rgya mtsho'i phyogs thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

At that time the enlightening being Sublime Light of Pure Virtue, the spiritual hero, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ocean of liberation doors of all the enlightening beings and said in verse,

ji snyed gang dag phyogs rnams kun gyi zhing / / rgyal bas de kun skad cig dgongs pas sbyangs/ / 'gro bar kun tu zhi ba med pa'i gsung / / sangs rgyas chos kyi 'khor lo rgya chen bskor/ /
skad cig dgongs pas chos dbyings kun bkang ste/ / mtha' yas spyod yul dbyangs rnams rgyal ba ston/ / 'gro ba kun lam snying po byang chub tu/ / byang chub 'tshang rgya rnam par 'phrul ba mdzad/ /
bskal pa brgya phrag stong rnams tshad med du/ / de bzhin gshegs pas sngon chad spyod spyad de/ / nam mkha' 'dra bar byas nas rab bkye zhing / / sangs rgyas zhing 'di sngon tshe rab tu sbyangs/ /
mtha' dang dbus med bskal par la la yis/ / skyo ba med par rgyal ba'i yul bsam yang / / sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul stobs la mtha' dbus med/ / phyi ma'i mtha' yi bskal pa kun tu 'gengs/ /
rgyal ba'i rdzu 'phrul yul la rnam par ltos/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing rgyan de dag rnam dag pa/ / rgyal bas 'dir ni kun kyang rab tu bstan/ / skad cig skad cig sna tshogs gzugs kyang snang / /
bskal pa brgya stong tshad med pa dag tu/ / rgyal ba'i ba spu gcig mtha' shes par dka'; ; tshul rnams kun sgor sangs rgyas chags pa med/ / 'gro ba 'di na rgya chen bsam yas mdzes/ /
sngon tshe'i bskal par rgyal bas 'gro kun tu/ / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho rgya chen bsnyen bkur bas/ / de bas 'jig rten gtso la chos dbyings rnams/ / kun nas mchod pa mang po rgya chen 'byung / /
phyogs rnams bkang ste sangs rgyas byung ba dag / rdul gyi sbubs su tshad med zhing yang ston/ / de dag yul du mi zad mtha' yas pa'i/ / bskal pa rgya mtshor byin gyis rlob pa mdzad/ /
sngon tshe'i bskal par rgyal bas 'gro don spyad/ / thugs rje'i rgya mtsho tshad med rab bskyed cing / / 'gro ba rgya mtsho kun nas 'khor ba yi/ / 'khor rnams rgya mtsho mtha' yas kun kyang sbyangs/ /
sangs rgyas mtshan med sku med rdul dang bral/ / de bzhin nyid gnas chos dbyings snying po ste/ / 'gro ba kun na mtha' yas gzugs su snang / / 'gro ba kun gyi sdug bsngal kun zhi mdzad/ /

All lands there be in the ten directions Are beautified and purified, all in an instant, By the sublime voice turning the wheel of truth Throughout the world, without an equal.
The realm of the Buddha has no bounds— In an instant the cosmos is filled; In every atom he sets up an enlightenment site, Proving enlightenment in all, creating mystic displays.
Buddha cultivated practices in the past Extending through countless eons Adorning all buddha-fields, Appearing unhindered, like space.
The Buddha’s spiritual powers are unlimited, Filling the boundless reaches of all time— Even if one spent countless eons constantly Observing, one would never be wearied or jaded.
Observe the realms of Buddha’s mystic power— All lands in all quarters are beautifully pure: He appears therein, in every one, Instantaneously changing, in infinite forms.
If you observe the Buddha for countless ages You won’t apprehend even the extent of one hair— The Buddha’s boundless doors of techniques Illumine inconceivably many fields.
Buddha, in past ages in the world, Served an infinite ocean of Buddhas; Therefore all beings are like river rapids Coming to make offerings to the World Honored One.
The Buddha appears everywhere, In infinite lands in each atom, The realms therein being all infinite too; In all he abides for endless eons.
Buddha of yore for the sake of all beings Cultivated an ocean of boundless compassion, Entering birth and death along with all beings, Teaching the masses, making them pure.
Buddhas abide in the matrix of the cosmos of real thusness— Signless, formless, free from all taints. When beings observe Buddha’s various bodies, All their troubles and pains then dissolve.

de la byang chub sems dpa' 'od zer rgya mtsho 'od chen dpal gyi zla ba'i rnam par thar pa ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa dang sa'i shugs kyis sems can gyi khams kyi tshul dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag par 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' sprin gyi nga ro rgya mtsho dri med 'od kyi snying po'i rnam par thar pa ni /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sems skad cig la chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis khyim sna tshogs la rnam par lta ba zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' yon tan rin chen 'byung ba ye shes dpal gyi gtsug phud kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gro ba rnams la mngon sum du yon tan dri ma med pas yongs su dag pa sgrub pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' rgya chen 'od 'bar blo gros dbang phyug gi rnam par thar pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi snying po byang chub tu thog ma 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi phyogs yang dag par 'byung ba'i rgyan ces bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' pad+mo rnam par gnon pa 'od zer gtsug phud kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang tha mi dad par 'gro ba thams cad kyi dbang po dang mos pa rgya mtsho'i 'od ces bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu ye shes sprin gyi nyi ma'i rgyal mtshan snang ba'i rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes sgrub par bskal pa mtha' yas pa dag tu byin gyis rlob cing rnam par spyod pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' mthu stobs brtson 'grus rdo rje yangs pa'i snying po'i rnam par thar pa ni/ chos thams cad kyi phyag rgya mtha' dang dbus med pa la yang dag par 'jug pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' spos kyi 'od 'phro shin tu 'bar ba'i 'od kyi rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi thog ma'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa shes pa'i dkyil 'khor yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par snang mdzad yon tan yangs pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi rnam par thar pa ni/ rnam par snang mdzad kyi smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad kyi dbyings la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams yangs pa shin tu 'phags pa'i 'od mchog yon tan 'byung ba'i blo gros kyi rnam par thar pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi yul zab mo chos kyi dbyings thams cad la kun nas rab tu gnas par rnam par spyod pa zhes bya'o/ /

Furthermore, the enlightening being Great Brilliance of the Moon Reflected in the Ocean, the great spiritual hero, found the door of liberation producing the means of transcendence pertaining to each stage of enlightenment, thereby edifying sentient beings and purifying all buddha-lands. The enlightening being Undefiled Treasury of Light of Oceans of Cloudlike Sounds found the door of liberation in every instant of awareness entering into the various distinctions of all objective realms. The enlightening being Topknot Born of Wisdom found the door of liberation revealing pure great virtues to all sentient beings when they first arrive at the site of enlightenment. The enlightening being Brave Lotus Topknot found the door of liberation revealing all the Buddha teachings to sentient beings in accord with their infinite faculties and understandings. The enlightening being Sun Banner of Clouds of Universal Knowledge found the door of liberation developing the knowledge of buddhahood, abiding forever. The enlightening being Greatly Persevering with Indestructible Courage found the door of liberation of power to enter into all the boundless symbols of the teachings. The enlightening being Banner of Light of Fragrant Flames found the door of liberation showing how all the present Buddhas first began enlightening practice, and on through to their final consummation of the body of knowledge and wisdom. The enlightening being Deep Beautiful Sound of Great Enlightened Virtue found the door of liberation peacefully abiding in the ocean of all the great vows of Vairocana, the Illuminator. The enlightening being Born of Wisdom with the Light of Great Virtue found the door of liberation revealing the most profound realm of the Buddha, which pervades the cosmos.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od zer rgya mtsho 'od chen dpal gyi zla bas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

At that time the enlightening being Great Brilliance of the Moon Reflected in the Ocean, empowered by the Buddha, observed the ocean of arrays of all the hosts of enlightening beings and said in verse,

pha rol phyin pa rgya mtsho bsam yas dang / / sa yi dkyil 'khor rgya chen kun kyang yongs su rgyas/ / tshad med sems can rnam par 'dul ba'i tshe/ / sangs rgyas zhing yangs rnams kyang rnam par sbyangs/ /
phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhing kun rgyas byas te/ / sangs rgyas sems can khams sbyin 'dul mdzad pa/ / skad cig dgongs pas chos kyi 'khor lo dag / mtha' yas 'gro mnyam bsam pa tshim par gsungs/ /
bskal pa rgya che mi zad mu med par/ / rgyal ba 'gro la mngon sum kun nas bzhugs/ / mgon pos sngon chad ji ltar sbyangs tshul du/ / rgyal bas spyod yul rnam dag rab tu bstan/ /
chos rgyal de dag ji ltar rnam 'phrul ba/ / phyogs rnams rgya mtsho ma lus kun na snang / / snying po byang chub kun na'ang rgyal ba dag / 'khor gyis bskor cing chos rnams gsung ba snang / /
'gro ba'i bsam pa thams cad tshim mdzad cing / / 'jig rten dag na sangs rgyas tshul kun mdzes/ / dbang po ji bzhin chos kyi char pa 'bebs/ / sangs rgyas chos sku yangs pa rnam par mdzes/ /
de bzhin nyid ltar mtshan nyid lus med de/ / rgyal ba dri med 'od gsal chos kyi sku/ / ye shes zhi ba'i sku ni tshad med de/ / phyogs dbyings kun bkang chos kyi char yang 'bebs/ /
chos rje thams cad stobs kyis rnam par dag / bder gshegs ye shes mkha' 'dra mtha' yas te/ / rgya chen 'gro ba mtha' dbus med bkang zhing / / rgyal ba stobs la 'jug pa rab tu ston/ /
sangs rgyas 'od kyis chos dbyings kun bkang zhing / / sangs rgyas spyod pa thams cad rdzogs par bstan/ / rgyal bas sngon tshe ji ltar rnam sbyangs pa/ / de bzhin ye shes sa rnams rgyal bas bstan/ /
phyogs rnams kun tu rang byung rnam par mdzes/ / smon lam rnam par 'phrul pa ma lus ston/ / ji ltar sngon tshe rgyal bas yongs sbyangs pa/ / rgyal ba'i 'od zer dra ba kun nas sgrog /
sangs rgyas yul ni phyogs su zad pa med/ / dbus dang mtha' med gzhal med mtha' yas dbyings/ / chos dbyings kun tu chags med brnyas pa ni/ / sangs rgyas zhing rnams kun na shin tu mdzes/ /

The transcendent means and the stages of enlightenment, Vast, inconceivable, are all fulfilled: Infinite sentient beings subdued and harmonized, All buddha-lands are pure.
As Buddha teaches in the worlds of beings, All lands in the ten directions are filled: In an instant of thought he turns the wheel of truth, Accommodating it to all states of mind.
Buddha, over countless vast eons, Has appeared everywhere before sentient beings; According to his past cultivation, He shows his purified realm of action.
I see everywhere in all directions And see the Buddhas showing mystic powers, All sitting in sanctuaries realizing enlightenment, Surrounded by listening crowds.
The immense radiance of Buddha’s reality body Can appear in the world through expedient means, According with the inclinations of all beings’ minds, Raining the teachings to suit their faculties.
The impartial, signless body of true suchness, The pure reality-body of untainted light; With knowledge and calm, with innumerable bodies, He preaches the truth, adapting to all.
The powers of the King of Truth are all pure, His knowledge and wisdom like space, unbounded; He reveals all without any concealment, Causing all beings to be enlightened.
In accord with what Buddha cultivated Up to his perfection of all knowledge, Now he radiates light through the cosmos Showing it all therein.
Buddha shows mystic powers through his original vow, Illuminating all in the ten directions; What the Buddha practiced of yore, All is expounded in these networks of light.
There is no end of worlds in all directions— No equals, no bounds, each one distinct. Buddha’s unhindered power emits a great light Clearly revealing all of those lands.

de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi seng+ge'i khri dang / pad+mo'i ze ba'i dri thams cad dang / nor bu'i rgyal po thams cad kyi ngos dang / 'khor lo'i lte ba thams cad dang / me tog gi ze ba'i dri thams cad dang / stegs bu'i ngos thams cad dang / rta babs kyi sgo thams cad dang / nor bu'i gzugs kyi ngos thams cad dang / rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i sgo thams cad dang / 'od zer sgron ma'i sgo thams cad dang / seng+ge'i khri'i rgyan gyi sgo thams cad nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' mang po thon par gyur te/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho'i blo gros rnam par rol pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sgra dbyangs kun tu sgrog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gtsug phud dang / byang chub sems dpa' ye shes chen po'i nyi mas rab tu gnon pa'i blo gros dang / byang chub sems dpa' yon tan rin po che bsam gyis mi khyab pa ye shes rgya mtsho'i dpal dang / byang chub sems dpa' mig brgya pad+mo sna tshogs kyi gtsug phud dang / byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i tshul pad+mo sna tshogs kyi gtsug phud dang / byang chub sems dpa' gser gyi 'od 'phro gzi brjid dkyil 'khor gyi 'od dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu sgra chos kyi dbyings kyi dbyangs dang / byang chub sems dpa' sprin yid du 'ong ba dri ma med pa'i zla ba dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed

At that time the Buddha’s lion seat, its round platform of exquisite flowers of many jewels, its base, steps, doors, and all its embellishments, each produced as many great enlightening beings as there are atoms in a buddha-land. Their names were Oceanic Wisdom, Sovereign King of Occult Powers; Thunder Shaking All; Topknot of Lights of Many Jewels; Bold Intelligence of the Sun of Knowledge; Seal of Knowledge Made of Jewels of Inconceivable Qualities; Hundred Eye Lotus Topknot; Light Spheres of Golden Flames; Universal Sound of the Cosmos; Cloud Sound Pure Moon; Banner of Light of Benevolent Courage: these were the leaders, and there were as many of them as atoms in many buddha-lands.

mchod pa'i sprin rnam pa sna tshogs rab tu 'gyed cing 'di ltar nor bu rin po che'i me tog gi sprin thams cad ni/ rab tu 'byin/ spos kyi sprin thams cad ni/ shin tu 'gyed/ rin po che'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin thams cad ni/ mngon par 'byin/ yul mtha' yas pa'i spos kun tu 'phro ba'i bdug pa'i sprin ni; rnam par 'gyed cing / nor bu nyi ma'i snying po'i 'khor lo'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin ni/ rab tu gtong / sil snyan gyi sgra dbyangs yid du 'ong ba'i sprin ni/ rab tu sgrog/ rin po che'i 'od 'phro ba kha dog mtha' yas pa'i sgron ma'i sprin gyis ni/ rab tu snang bar byed/ nor bu sna tshogs kyi shing gi yal ga las me tog gi dog pa ni/ rnam par spyod/ rin po che'i 'od dri ma med pa zad mi shes pa'i nor bu'i rgyal po'i char ni/ rab tu 'bebs /rgyan mdzes pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa'i nor bu'i rgyal po'i sprin gyi char ni/ rab tu 'bebs shing / de lta bu dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' re re zhing yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi mchod pa'i sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs par byed cing lhags par gyur te/

At the same time as they appeared, these enlightening beings each produced clouds of various offerings: for example, clouds of flowers of all jewels, clouds of all subtle fragrances of lotus blossoms, clouds of orbs of jewel lights, clouds of fragrant flames of boundless realms, clouds of jewel-like light spheres from the treasury of the sun, clouds of all pleasing musical sounds, clouds of flames of light from all jewel lamps, with boundless colors and forms, clouds of branches, flowers, and fruits from trees of many jewels, clouds of regal jewels with inexhaustible pure radiance, clouds of all the finest decorative gems; there were as many such clouds of various offerings as there are atoms in a buddha-world. Each of those enlightening beings produced such clouds of offerings unceasingly, raining on the oceanic assemblies at all enlightenment sites.

bcom ldan 'das la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho yod pa thams cad du mchod pa'i sprin rgyun mi 'chad pa'i char mngon par phab nas gang nas 'ongs pa'i phyogs su brten te/ de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon du bltas nas seng+ge'i khri rin po che sna tshogs du ma'i pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod par gyur to/ /

Having manifested these clouds, they circled the Buddha to the right, circling him countless hundreds and thousands of times. In whatever direction they came from, there, not far from the Buddha, they magically produced innumerable lotus lion seats of various jewels, and each sat crosslegged thereon.

byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyang spyod yul rgya mtsho rgya chen po yongs su dag pa rnams so/ / sgo kun nas chos kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa rnams so/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul chags pa med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams so/ / so so yang dag par rig pa thams cad kyis chos rgya mtsho la zhugs pa rnams so/ / rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i snang ba rab tu thob pa rnams so; ; sgo kun nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i dbyings rab tu thob pa rnams so/ / gzungs kyi sgo rgya mtsho thams cad kyis chos rgya mtsho rab tu 'dzin pa rnams so/ / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sa la rab tu gnas pa rnams so/ / dga' ba'i shugs rgya chen po'i rab tu thob pa rnams so/ / bsod nams kyi dkyil 'khor mu med pa yongs su dag pa rnams te/ chos kyi dbyings dang nam mkha' la rnam par rgyu zhing / sangs rgyas thams cad mchod pa mngon par sgrub pa la rab tu brtson pa sha stag go /

The spheres of actions of these enlightening beings were pure and vast as the sea. They had attained the state of universality of illumination of knowledge and wisdom. Following the Buddhas, they were unhindered in their actions. They were able to enter the ocean of all principles of discernment and elucidation, and had mastered the teaching of inconceivable liberation. They dwelt in the state of all-sidedness of the Buddhas. They had already mastered all techniques of concentration formulae, and were able to contain the ocean of all the teachings. They dwelt in the stage of equanimous knowledge of past, present, and future. They had attained the immense joy of profound faith. Their boundless stores of blessings were most pure. They observed everywhere in space throughout the cosmos. They diligently made offerings to all Buddhas appearing in any land in all worlds.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho'i blo gros rnam par rol ba'i ye shes mngon par shes pa'i rgyal pos sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

At that time, the enlightening being Oceanic Wisdom, Sovereign King of Occult Powers, the great spiritual hero, empowered by the Buddha, surveyed the oceans of masses at the scene of enlightenment and said in verse,

sangs rgyas rnam par sangs rgyas mnyam nyid mkhyen/ / chags med brnyes pas nam mkha' lta bu ste/ / phyogs rnams zhing kun rab tu snang byas nas/ / 'byams klas 'khor na bzhugs pa rnam par mdzes/ /
bder gshegs rang byung mtha' dang dbus med de/ / thams cad phyogs kyi chos dbyings kun rgyas par/ / dbang phyug chen po kun gyis mchod bskor cing / / shing gi rgyal po kun gyi drung na bzhugs/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul stobs dag gis/ / skad cig sems la mi zad yon tan gzugs/ / rnam thar gzhan dang gzhan dag thob pas mthong / / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ni mtha' yas so/ /
bskal pa rgya mtshor sngon chad spyod pa'i tshe/ / de bzhin gshegs pas srid pa rgya mtsho 'dir/ / sna tshogs thabs kyis sems can smin byas pa/ / de dag rgyal ba de yi chos 'dzin to/ /
yongs dag dri med 'khor rnams 'khod pa dag / thams cad sangs rgyas lta zhing rnam par gnas/ / pad+mo'i snying po pad+mo'i gdan bzhugs pa/ / tshogs kyi nang na rgyal ba mngon par mdzes/ /
sangs rgyas gang la bzhugs pa'i seng+ge'i khri/ / rin chen nor bu'i rgyal po'i 'od 'phro zhing / / spos 'phro'i sprin rnams mtha' yas rab tu 'byung / / snying po du ma'i me tog phreng dpyangs pa'o/ /
rin chen 'od 'phro'i sprin ni rtag tu 'gyed/ / 'od zer sgron ma rgya chen rab tu 'bar/ / rta babs rnam pa sna tshogs rnams kyis brgyan/ / thub pa de bzhugs mngon par rab tu mdzes/ /
sgra dbyangs yid du 'ong ba rab tu 'gyed/ / rin chen tshon du sna tshogs pad+mo 'phyang / / nor bu'i rgyal pos skar khung kun nas brgyan/ / sangs rgyas de bzhugs rnam par rab tu mdzes/ /
zla gam rin chen mang pos yongs su bzung / / rdo rje 'od 'phro snang ba'i snying pos brgyan/ / gtsug na nor bu'i byang chub sems dpas bzung / / sangs rgyas de bzhugs rnam par shin tu mdzes/ /
phyogs bcur sprul pa'i dra ba rab bkye zhing / / de bzhin gshegs pa'i smon lam sgra yang sgrog / gzugs brnyan bzhin du zhing rnams kun na snang / / thub pa de 'dra'i seng+ge'i gdan la bzhugs/ /

Buddha knows what all Buddhas have realized— Unhindered as space, he illumines all, His light pervading countless lands everywhere. He sits amidst the hosts, all magnificently pure.
The Buddha’s virtues cannot be measured; They fill all the cosmos in every direction. Sitting under every enlightenment tree, All the great powers assemble like clouds.
Buddha has such spiritual powers, Manifesting infinite forms at once. The Buddha’s sphere is beyond bounds— Individuals see according to their liberation.
Buddha passed oceans of eons Working in all realms of being Teaching creatures by various means, Having them accept and practice enlightening ways.
Vairocana, replete with magnificent refinements, Sits on a lotus-bank lion seat. All the assembled hosts are pure; Silently all gaze in respect.
The banks of jewels radiate light, Emitting boundless clouds of fragrant flames; Countless flower garlands are draped around: On such a seat does the Buddha sit.
Various adornments decorate its glorious facades; Constantly emitting lamp-light clouds of fragrant flames, Immensely vast, blazing, illumining all: The Sage sits upon supreme embellishments.
Beautiful windows of various jewels, Draped with lotuses of exquisite gems, Always producing sublime sounds delighting all hearers: Thereon Buddha sits, most radiant of all.
A jewel crescent supports the seat, shaped like a half-moon; Diamond is its pedestal, its color blazing bright; Enlightening beings constantly circle it: Buddha is most radiant among them.
His various mystic displays fill the ten directions, Expounding the far-reaching vows of the Enlightened One: All reflected images appear therein; It is on such a seat the Buddha calmly sits.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sgra dbyangs kun tu sgrog pas sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
At that time the great enlightening being Thunder Shaking All, empowered by the Buddha, looked over all the assembled hosts and said,

'di ni bder gshegs sangs rgyas byin rlabs te/ / byang chub spyod pa sngon chad spyad pa dang / / sangs rgyas mchod pa'i mchod pa du ma dag / rgyal ba'i gdan las de dag thams cad snang / /
spos 'od snang ba nor bu'i rgyal po can/ / me tog snying po seng+ge'i gdan gyi 'khor/ / rgyan rnams thams cad gzugs brnyan gyur pa dang / / 'khor rnams de dag thams cad kun bkang ste/ /
skad cig skad cig rgyan gyi kha dog kun/ / rnam pa du mar sangs rgyas gdan las snang / / sems can ji ltar mos pa de dag kyang / / 'khod cing sangs rgyas tshad med gdon la lta/ /
rin chen lda ldi pad+mo mang btags pa/ / phye zhing byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnams; ; sgra dbyangs yid du 'ong ba rab 'byin cing / / sangs rgyas gdan la bzhugs la bstod pa byed/ /
sangs rgyas bsod nams tshad med nam mkha' bzhin/ / 'di dag rgyan kun de las rab tu byung / / sa rnams re re'i rgyan rnams gang yod pa/ / 'gro ba kun gyis de dag bsam mi nus/ /
mi phyed mtshams kyi rdo rje sna tshogs pa/ / 'khor yangs rnam dag shin tu mnyam pa ste/ / nor bu'i dra ba sna tshogs kun tu bkram/ / byang chub shing gi sa yi 'khor kun to/ /
sa phyogs gang na rgyal ba'i gdan yod pa/ / kha dog mtha' yas rgya chen sna tshogs te/ / me tog mngon gtor rin chen rnam par bkram/ / gser tshon mdzes pas de ni rab tu brgyan/ /
sa yi lha mo de dag rab dga' zhing / / skad cig sems kyis mi zad sa yang ston/ / kun kyang rgyal ba'i zhal du mngon lta zhing / / kha dog thams cad rgyan gyi sprin gtong ngo/ /
rin chen sgron ma mang po gsal bar 'bar/ / spos mang dri zhim mang po rtag tu 'byung / / dus dang tshod kyi rnam pa mang ston cing / / lha rnams kun kyang sangs rgyas mchod pa byed/ /
phyogs rnams bcu na zhing rnams ji snyed pa/ / de dag sa rgyan phun sum tshogs yod pa/ / de dag kun kyang sa dkyil 'di na snang / / sangs rgyas byin rlabs mnyam pa med pas byung / /

Buddha accumulated enlightenment practices, Making offerings to infinite Buddhas everywhere. Sustained by the power of the Enlightened One, None do not see him on his seat.
Jewels of fragrant flames, fulfilling all wishes, Encrust the Buddha’s flower lion throne; Various adornments, all appearing as reflections, Are clearly seen by all the hosts.
Buddha’s throne displays magnificent forms; Instant to instant their colors and types each differ. According to the differences in beings’ understandings Each sees the Buddha thereupon.
Jewel branches hanging down, webs of lotus flowers, As the flowers open, enlightening beings emerge, Each producing sublime, pleasing voices Praising the Buddha on his throne.
Buddha’s virtues are extensive as space— All adornments are born from them. The embellishing features of each particular state No sentient beings can comprehend.
Diamond is the ground, indestructible— Vast, pure, level, and even. Nets of pearls hang in the sky, All around the enlightenment tree.
The infinite colors of the ground are all distinct; Gold dust is spread all around, Flowers and jewels strewn about, All beautifying Buddha’s throne.
Earth spirits dance with joy, With infinite manifestations in an instant, Creating clouds of adornments everywhere, While remaining reverently gazing at Buddha.
Jewel lamps, immensely large, shining extremely bright, Fragrant flames and swirling light never ending, These manifestations differ according to the time; Earth spirits make offerings of these.
All the adornments existing In every single land Appear at this enlightenment scene By the mystic power of Buddha.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gtsug phud kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Jewel Light Topknot, empowered by the Buddha, surveyed the oceanic masses at the site of enlightenment and said,

sngon chad spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe dag tu/ / zhing kun phun sum tshogs pa mthong ba rnams/ / snying po byang chub 'khor gyi sa 'di la/ / mi zad sa dang de dag rab tu snang / /
rnam thar yangs pa gang na snang ba yi/ / sa la rin chen mdzes kun rnam par bkra ma/ / rin chen mang pos dkyil 'khor kun tu gtor/ / sangs rgyas 'od kyis sprin kyang rab tu snang / /
sa rnams kun brgyan shing gi dam pa'i drung / / kun nas nor bu'i rgyal pos brgyan byas las/ / bsod nams 'od kyi dbyangs kyi 'brug sgra 'byung / / sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul tshul yang rab tu brjod/ /
rin chen mang po sgron ma'i char phab cing / / rin chen mdzes par bkod pa rnam par mdzes/ / sgra dbyangs kun gyi 'brug sgra shin tu sgrog / sa yi lha rnams sa yang yang dag ston/ /
rin chen 'od 'phro sgron ma rnam par snang / / 'od zer sprin ni sa las rab tu 'byung / / nor bu dra ba sil ma kun nas bkram/ / rin chen sna tshogs rigs kyis yan lag brgyan/ /
sa rnams kun nas mdzes pa 'di dag ltos/ / rin chen mang po tshon bzang rgyan du bkye/ / 'gro pa dag la chos kyi rgya mtsho sgrog / de dag chos nyid rnam par dag pa mthong / /
ma lus phyogs na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi/ / byang chub shing gi phun sum tshogs pa dag / sa yi dkyil 'khor 'di na kun snang ste/ / de dag chos nyid rnam par dag pa brjod/ /
sangs rgyas gdan las chos rnams rgya mtsho yi/ / chos sgo bde bar gshegs pas gang gsungs pa/ / sems can kun gyi bsam pa ji bzhin du; ; sa 'khor rnams kyang kun nas rab tu 'byung / /
dri zhim 'od rnams rtag tu 'byung bas na/ / de dag ji bzhin snod kyi 'gro ba 'gengs/ / srog chags rnams kyi nyon mongs zhi bar byed/ / sa 'khor de nas de 'dra rab tu sgrog /
sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul phun sum gang dag dang / / dri med sa ni gang gis mdzes gyur pa'i/ / phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyan rnams re re zhing / / bskal pa bye ba dag tu'ang brjod mi nus/ /

When the Buddha was cultivating practice in the past, He saw the various buddha-lands, all fully complete. The lands he saw this way were endless: All of them appear at this enlightenment scene.
The Buddha’s enormous spiritual power Sheds light showering gems everywhere: This treasury of jewels is scattered over the site, Beautifying the ground all around.
Buddha’s blessings and mystical powers Adorn everywhere with precious gemstones; The ground and the enlightenment tree Alternately emit light and sound expressing the truth.
Precious lamps, infinite, rain from the sky, Studded with regal sapphires, All emitting subtle sounds speaking truth: This the earth spirits cause to appear.
The jewel ground manifests ubiquitous clouds of light, Jewel lamps blaze bright as lightning, Jewel nets hung afar cover above, Jewel boughs variously draped make decorations.
Look over the entire ground— Adorned with various beautiful jewels, It shows beings the ocean of actions, Causing them to comprehend the real nature of things.
The enlightenment trees in all the spheres Of all the Buddhas everywhere All appear at the enlightenment site, Expounding the Buddha’s pure teaching.
In accord with the inclinations of beings’ minds The ground produces wonderful sounds, Conforming to what the Buddha would preach at his seat, Each of the teachings fully explained.
The ground constantly produces subtle, fragrant light; In the light are chanted pure clear sounds: If any beings are able to receive the teaching, It causes them to hear, and their afflictions vanish.
Each adornment is fully complete And could not be described in a million years. The Buddha’s mystic power extends everywhere: That’s why the ground is beautifully pure.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' ye shes chen po'i nyi mas rab tu gnon pa'i blo gros kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Bold Intelligence of the Sun of Knowledge, empowered by the Buddha, looked over all the multitudes assembled on the scene and said in verse,

'jig rten kun gyi bsam pa tshim mdzad cing / / sangs rgyas chos kyi gzhal med khang na mdzes/ / 'byams klas phyogs rnams kun tu mngon sum du/ / sangs rgyas 'gro gtso gzhal med khang na snang / /
rin chen kun gyis snying po rab tu brgyan/ / rgyan rnams kun gyis de bzhin mdzes shing 'bar/ / sangs rgyas pho brang 'od ni bsam mi khyab/ / de na bzhugs shing sangs rgyas rab tu mdzes; ;
ka ba'i rgyan ni nor bu sna tshogs te/ / phyogs rnams kun sgor rta babs sprin kyang bres/ / stegs bu'i phreng ba kun nas rgyan du bkod/ / gser gyi dril bu'i sprin kyang rnam par brgyus/ /
me tog bla re rnam pa sna tshogs ltos/ / rin chen shing sdong dar gyi bla re bres/ / nor bu thams cad sgo nas phreng ba 'bul/ / de na ye shes rgya mtsho rab tu mdzes/ /
spos dri rgyal mtshan rin chen dra ba ste/ / 'od zer sgron ma'i sprin gyis kun tu g.yog / rgyan rnams sna tshogs kun nas shin tu bres/ / de na sangs rgyas rab tu 'phags pa bzhugs/ /
phyogs rnams kun sgo sprul pa'i sprin gyi rnams/ / dbyangs kyis 'jig rten khyab par grags byed cing / / 'byams klas phyogs kyi sems can rnams 'dul ba/ / sangs rgyas pho brang 'di na de dag grag /
me tog shing dang rin chen spungs spel ba/ / 'phags par phyogs rnams kun tu mngon par mdzes/ / de la dus gsum zhing rnams thams cad kyang / / gzugs brnyan gyur par de dag rab tu snang / /
phyogs rnams kun tu rin chen mang bkye ba/ / de dag sna tshogs mdzes par rnam par 'bar/ / phyogs rnams kun tu skar khung mdzes par brgyan/ / rta babs mda' yab sna tshogs mang pos brgyan/ /
de la dri med 'od zer kun nas snang ba yi/ / sangs rgyas pho brang rnam pa bsam yas te/ / gzhal med khang mang thams cad de la snang / / de dag kun na'ang rgyal ba bzhugs shing mdzes/ /
phyogs rnams kun na 'khor rnams ji snyed pa/ / rgyal ba'i pho brang 'dir ni kun zhugs kyang / / mtha' dang dbus med mu yang de bzhin med/ / rang byung sangs rgyas pho brang de na bzhugs/ /

Buddha sits in the hall of truth with steady gaze, Brilliantly lighting up the palace. In accordance with the dispositions of all beings His body appears throughout all lands.
The Buddha’s palace is beyond conception, Adorned with stores of precious jewels, Each decoration shining with light; Sitting there, the Buddha is most conspicuous of all.
With pillars of jewels of various hues, Chimes of real gold hanging like clouds, Jewel stairways in rows on four sides, The gates open in every direction.
Arrays of banners of flowery silk, Jewel trees with decorated branches and boughs, Garlands of pearls draped on all sides; The Ocean of Wisdom sits calmly therein.
Nets of jewels, exquisite fragrant banners, Brilliant lamps hung like clouds; Covered with various decorations, The world-transcending true knower sits within.
Everywhere he manifests clouds of mystic displays, Those clouds teaching throughout the world, Harmonizing and calming down all sentient beings: All this appears from the Buddha’s palace.
Trees of gems bloom with fine flowers Having no peer in all the world; The embellishments of the lands of all times Reveal their reflections therein.
Everywhere there are heaps of jewels; Their light blazes in countless hues. Gates and doors open at intervals all around; The beams and ceiling are especially beautiful.
The Buddha’s palace is inconceivable; Its pure radiance contains every form— In it appear all palaces, A Buddha sitting in each.
The Buddha’s palace is boundless; The Naturally Awakened One abides therein. All the masses from all ten directions Come gather around the Buddha.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' yon tan rin po che bsam gyis mi khyab pa ye shes rgya mtsho'i dpal gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho yod pa de dag thams cad la rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then the great enlightening being Seal of Knowledge Made of Jewels of Inconceivable Qualities, empowered by the Buddha, looked over all the oceans of beings gathered at the scene of enlightenment and said in verse,

sangs rgyas zhing rdul shin tu phra snyed kyi/ / bsod nams rgya mtsho rnam par rab sbyangs te/ / sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul smon lam yang dag byung / / snying po byang chub dri med rnam par mdzes/ /
spos zhim thams cad rtsa nas yang dag rgyu/ / yid bzhin nor mchog rgyal pos kun nas brgyan/ / rdo rje phye ma'i nor bu rgyal pos bris/ / shing sdong rtsa ba rin chen kun las byas/ /
rdo rje phye ma'i nor bu 'khor lo 'byung / / lhun rnams thams cad rin chen rgyan gyis brgyan/ / yal ga stug po sprin ltar kun nas 'khyil; ; snying po byang chub de na rgyal ba mdzes/ /
yal ga dog pa kun nas mngon pa ste/ / 'khor rnams snum 'jam phyogs rnams kun tu 'phags/ / me tog 'bras bu rgyun rnams kun kyang 'gyed/ / snying po byang chub rgya che bsam mi khyab/ /
'od rnams bkye ba phyogs su rnam par mdzes/ / dri ma med pa'i 'od 'bar zad mi shes/ / yal ga'i sgo nas sprin kun char yang 'bebs/ / snying po byang chub smon lam yangs pas byung / /
me tog nor dang rin chen mi zad nor/ / mu tig nor bu phyogs rnams kun nas brgyus/ / phye ma nor gyi gnas kyi sprin 'gyed de/ / snying po byang chub phyogs rnams kun tu 'byin/ /
bde gshegs snying po byang chub 'di la ltos/ / pad+mo'i dra ba nor bu dri med mang / / rin chen 'od zer dkyil 'khor kun nas 'phro/ / dril bu'i dra ba'i sprin gyi sgra dbyangs 'byin/ /
phyogs bcu'i shing bzang gzugs rnams gang yod pa/ / 'byams klas zhing gi ma lus thams cad dag / byang chub shing la de dag kun nas snang / / de drung sangs rgyas dri med rnam par mdzes/ /
yal ga kun nas rin chen mi zad nor/ / byang chub sems dpa' dag kyang rtag 'byung zhing / / bsod nams rgya chen dkyil 'khor char phab ste/ / phyogs bcur rgyal ba mchod phyir de dag 'dong / /
de bzhin gshegs pa sngon chad cir gyur dang / / byang chub spyod las byung ba 'di dag ltos/ / yal ga kun las rin chen nor mi zad/ / sangs rgyas yul kun bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /

The Buddha cultivated an ocean of blessings, Many as the atoms in all lands; Produced by the powers of his mind and will, The enlightenment site is pure, without any taint.
Wish-fulfilling jewels are the roots of the trees, Diamond are their trunks; Nets of jewels cover them And a rich fragrance surrounds.
The tree branches are adorned by all kinds of gems, The limbs are of precious stone, soaring high; The branches and twigs hang thickly, like heavy clouds: Underneath sits Buddha on the enlightenment site.
The site of enlightenment is unthinkably vast: The trees surround it, covering all; The dense foliage and luxurious flowers mutually cover and reflect, While in the flowers grow gemstone fruits.
From among all the branches emanate beautiful lights Illuminating the whole enlightenment scene; Pure, bright, inexhaustible, This appears by the power of Buddha’s vows.
Banks of precious stones are the flowers, Reflections shining like patterned clouds; The encircling trees perfume all around: The enlightenment site’s adorned everywhere.
See in the site of the Buddha’s enlightenment Lotuses and jewel nets, all pure; Flames of light in whorls appear from here, Music of bells and chimes comes from the clouds.
All the wonderfully adorned trees Existing in all lands Appear in the enlightenment tree; Buddha, beneath it, sheds all defilement.
The site of enlightenment is made of vast blessings; The tree branches rain jewels without end. In the jewels appear enlightening beings, Going everywhere to serve the Buddhas.
The realm of the Buddhas is inconceivable; They cause all the trees there to produce music— In accord with the enlightened way developed by Buddha, The hosts of beings, hearing the music, can see it all.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' mig brgya ba pad+mo sna tshogs kyi gtsug phud kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor rgya mtsho yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Hundred Eyes Lotus Topknot, empowered by the Buddha, surveyed all the assemblies at the scene of enlightenment and said,

dus gsum gshegs pa'i rgyal ba'i rnam 'phrul ba/ / de dag rin chen sgo nas kun kyang grag / de ni mtha' dang dbus kyang med pa ste/ / snying po byang chub 'di la kun snang ngo/ /
me tog mang po'i phreng ba dbyangs bkye zhing / / 'od zer sprin gyis phyogs rnams kun bkang ste/ / byang chub shing la gnas pa'i lha tshogs rnams/ / sangs rgyas lta zhing rtag tu mchod pa byed/ /
spos kyi rgyal mtshan nor bu sna tshogs 'bar/ / spos kyi 'od 'phro bdug spos rtag tu 'byung / / 'khor gyi rgya mtsho kun la khyab par zhim/ / shing gi rgyal po de phyir phyogs su mdzes/ /
