pad+mo 'phrul ba stug cing gser mdog 'dra/ / rgyal ba'i sprin sgra rtag par rab tu 'gyed/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams ma lus khyab byas shing / / sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs gdung ba sel/ /
rgyal ba'i 'khor ni tshad med rgya che ste/ / phyogs rnams kun nas snying po byang chub la/ / gzugs brnyan snang zhing dri med 'od mchog 'gyed/ / byang chub shing gi rnam 'phrul 'di dag ltos/ /
smon lam sgra dang dbyangs kyi mar me rnams/ / rin chen sna tshogs yal ga kun las 'bar/ / srid pa rgya mtsho kun na sngon chad du/ / rgyal ba'i spyod pa ji ltar byung ba ston/ /
byang chub lha rnams zhing gi rdul snyed do/ / de dag thams cad snying po byang chub gnas/ / thub pa'i byang chub shing la skad cig cing / / rnam thar gzhan dang gzhan mang de dag ston/ /
rang byung spyad pa thams cad spyod pa'i tshe/ / sngon chad de bzhin gshegs pa gang mchod pa/ / de dag mtshan bcas sngon gyi sbyor bcas pa/ / thams cad rin chen sgo nas rab tu snang / /
phyogs bcu'i sems can ji snyed snod gyur pa/ / de dag thams cad 'di las sgra 'byung ste/ / de dag cis 'dul rnam dag ci 'dra ba'ang / / snying po byang chub 'di las kun brjod do/ /
byang chub shing rnams mtha' yas phyogs kun na/ / bsam gyis mi khyab rgyan gyi sprin can dag / mtha' yas sna tshogs rgyan can thams cad kyang / / sngon chad de bzhin gshegs pas yongs sbyangs pa'o/ /

All the jewels emit wondrous sounds Extolling the names of Buddhas of all times. The deeds of those Buddhas’ mystical powers Can all be viewed in this enlightenment scene.
Flowers bloom in profusion, like parti-colored cloth; Clouds of light flow in all directions: The spirits of enlightenment trees bring these to the Buddha, With single-minded devotion making offerings of them.
Flames of jewel light all form banners; From the banners burst forth sublime fragrances, The fragrances perfuming all the congregations— Therefore the place is all beautifully pure.
Lotuses hang down, with light of golden hue, The light intoning clouds of Buddha’s wondrous voice, Covering all the lands in all directions, Extinguishing the fires of sentient beings’ torments.
The independent power of Enlightenment Tree King Constantly radiates light extremely pure; The assembled masses in the ten directions have no bounds, Yet all of them appear reflected in the enlightenment scene.
The light flames of the jewel branches are like bright lamps; Their light emanates sound declaring the great vow— What the Buddha practiced of yore in all states of being Is fully expounded therein.
Under the tree are spirits, as many as atoms in the land, All staying together at this enlightenment site, Each before the Buddha’s enlightenment tree Continuously expounding the liberation doors.
Buddha practiced many deeds of yore, Making offerings to all the enlightened: His practices as well as his fame All appear within the jewels.
Everything in the scene produces wonderful sound— The sound is vast, pervading the ten directions; If any beings can hear the teaching, It civilizes them and makes them pure.
The Buddha in the past cultivated Infinite embellishments, all; All the adornments, innumerable kinds, Of every enlightenment tree.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' gser gyi 'od 'phro gzi brjid dkyil 'khor gyi 'od kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Light Spheres of Golden Flames, empowered by the Buddha, looked over all the assemblies at the scene of enlightenment and said,

srid pa'i rgya mtshor byang chub spyod mdzad tshe/ / mos pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su smon dag cing / / gnas dang gnas min stobs rnams thugs chud pa'i/ / bder gshegs sa stobs rnam par dag pa mthong / /
bskal pa kun tu rgya mtsho las sbyangs te/ / mnyam nyid chos bsgoms ji ltar bsgrubs pa'i rnams/ / sangs rgyas 'od las de bzhin phyogs bkang zhing / / las rnams rgya mtsho de bzhin rab tu brjod/ /
sna tshogs thabs kyis 'byams klas stobs spyod tshe/ / bskal pa snga mar 'gro ba'i dbang po bzhin/ / yongs su smin byas de bas 'khor kun kyang / / sems dag sangs rgyas dbang po'i stobs la 'jug /
'jig rten kun gyi mos pa sna tshogs dang / / bsam pa ji bzhin sbyor ba rnam spyod pa; ; de dag ji bzhin rgyal pa chos ston te/ / rang byung mos pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ston to/ /
phyogs rnams ma lus zhing rnams rgya mtsho dang / / 'byams klas sems can khams dang chos kyi khams/ / nam mkha'i khams rnams mnyam nyid mkhyen mi rtog / rang byung spu rtser khams mkhyen stobs kyang ston/ /
bder gshegs ye shes rgya chen kun tu 'gro/ / skad cig gcig gis dus gsum ma lus 'gengs/ / phyogs dang zhing dang bskal pa 'gro bkang zhing / / sems can kun la stobs 'jug mngon par bstan/ /
bsam gtan rnam thar stobs mtha' dbus med pa/ / ting 'dzin rgya mtsho'i tshul ni 'gro kun snyed/ / thams cad rgyal ba'i sku la bstan pas na; ; sems can bsam pa'i gnas kyi nyon mongs sel/ /
sangs rgyas ye shes dus gsum bsgribs pa med/ / skad cig kun la dus gsum spu rtser ston/ / zhing dang sems can sangs rgyas de bzhin chos/ / de ltar rgyal bas rjes su dran stobs bstan/ /
thub pa'i spyan ni nam mkha' mnyam pa ste/ / des ni chos dbyings ma lus gsal bar gzigs/ / thams cad tshul gyis chags med gzhal yas sa/ / brnyes pas ye shes spyan ni rnam mang bstan/ /
'jig rten kun gyi sbyor mang ji snyed dang / / 'gro ba'i bag chags bag nyal ma lus par/ / thabs sgo kun nas nyon mongs zhi mdzad cing / / rgyal ba 'jig rten gang bar kun nas byung / /

Buddha cultivated enlightening practices, Comprehending all things, Clarifying the true and the false; This is the Buddha’s first power of knowledge.
As in the past he observed the nature of all things equally, He clarified the ocean of all doings: Thus now in the nets of light He can tell it all, throughout all quarters.
In past eons he developed great techniques For guiding beings according to their faculties, Causing all their minds to be pure; Thus was Buddha able to perfect the knowledge of potentials.
As the understanding of sentient beings is not the same, And their inclinations and actions are different, He teaches them according to their needs: Buddha can do this by his powers of knowledge.
Comprehending the oceans of lands in all directions, All the worlds of beings they contain, Buddha’s knowledge is equanimous, like space: All he can show within a pore.
Buddha knows the outcome of all acts, Comprehending past, present, and future instantly; The lands, ages, beings, and times of all regions: All he can reveal and make clear.
Meditation states, liberations, and powers are boundless, And so are trances and other techniques: Buddha shows them all to beings, gladdening them, Causing all to wash away the darkness of afflictions.
Buddha’s knowledge is unhindered, comprehending all times; All he shows in an instant, in his hair pores: The Buddhas’ teachings, lands, and sentient beings: All these appear from his recollective power.
Buddha’s eye is as vast as space; He sees the entire cosmos. In the unimpeded state, with unequalled function, All Buddhas can tell of this eye.
All sentient beings are totally bound; All their intoxications and habits Buddha causes to be removed by his methods, Appearing throughout the world.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings kun nas sgrog pas sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor rgya mtsho yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Universal Sound of the Cosmos, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the assembled beings at the site of enlightenment and said,

rgya chen sangs rgyas byin rlabs phyogs kun tu/ / sangs rgyas ston kyang rtog pa mi mnga' ste/ / pha rol phyin pa rgya chen yongs bkang ba/ / byang chub spyod pa rgya chen de dag snang / /
'gro ba rnams la thugs rje che bskyed cing / / sbyin pa'i mthar phyin sngon chad spyad pas na/ / de phyir thub pa'i sku ni mtshan gyis brgyan/ / 'gro ba kun gyis blta zhing dga' ba skye/ /
bskal pa rgya mtsho mang po mtha' yas sngon/ / tshul khrims pha rol phyin pa yongs sbyangs pas/ / de phyir bskal pa phyogs su dri med cing / / shin tu 'phags par 'jig rten sdug bsngal sel/ /
ma log mnyam pa nyid la dad bskyed de/ / sngon chad bzod pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam sbyangs pas/ / 'gro dang mtshungs mnyam yon tan kun ston te/ / de bas phyogs su 'od rnams shin tu 'phro/ /
bskal pa rgya mtsho mang por sngon spyod tshe/ / 'gro ba rnams kyi bsgribs pa thibs po bsal/ / de phyir phyogs bcu'i 'gro ba kun bkang ste/ / zhing rab drung na rgyal ba mngon par mdzes/ /
bsam gtan yan lag rgya mtsho sbyong ba'i tshe/ / bskal pa yangs par rgyal bas rab tu sbyangs/ / de bas 'gro ba'i gzhal med dga' ba skyed/ / nyon mongs dri ma 'grib pa kun kyang sel/ /
sangs rgyas rgya mtsho'i drung du sngon spyod cing / / shes rab mthar phyin rgyal bas sngon bkang ste/ / 'gro ba'i gti mug mun pa yongs su bsal/ / de bas rgyal ba kun tu rnam par mdzes/ /
'gro ba kun mnyam thabs sgo thams cad kyis/ / yang dag byung zhing 'gro ba rnam sbyangs pas/ / phyogs rnams kun na kun la mngon par bzhugs/ / phyi ma'i bskal bar 'gro ba mngon du lta/ /
smon lam pha rol phyin pa rab sbyong tshe/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho shin tu rgya che zhing / / phyi mtha'i bskal par 'gro ba'i sprin mnyam par/ / spyad pas de phyir 'gro ba kun na mdzes/ /
rgyal bas chos kun stobs kyi mthar phyin pa/ / bskal pa gzhal yas mang por yongs su sbyangs/ / de phyir rang byung stobs kyi pha rol phyin/ / phyogs kyi zhing rnams kun na de phyir 'phags/ /
thams cad mkhyen nyid nam mkha' mtshungs mnyam pa'i/ / ye shes kun gyi sgo nas sngon sbyangs pas; ; de phyir chags med ye shes pha rol phyin/ / phyogs bcu kun na rgyal ba mngon par mdzes/ /

The Buddha’s awesome spiritual powers pervade the ten directions, Their grandiose displays making no discrimination; The transcendent means, enlightening practices Fulfilled in the past—all they show.
Of old he conceived compassion for beings And practiced transcendent generosity, Wherefore his body is most sublime, Gladdening all who see.
In boundless eons past He cultivated transcendent self-control, So acquired a pure body all-pervading, Extinguishing the various torments of the world.
He cultivated patience and tolerance, pure, Faithful to truth, without discrimination; So his physical form is perfect, Shedding light in all directions.
He strove for boundless eons past, Able to overthrow the barriers of sentient beings; Therefore he can emanate bodies in all directions, All appearing under enlightenment trees.
Buddha practiced, for long, long eons, Oceans of meditations, all of them pure: Thus he delights his beholders, Removing all taint of afflictions.
Buddha mastered the ocean of practices, Fulfilling transcendent wisdom; Therefore he sheds light illumining all, Destroying the darkness of ignorance.
Edifying beings by various means, He causes their practice to succeed; Traveling everywhere in the ten directions For endless eons, he never rests.
Buddha practiced for boundless eons Purifying and mastering transcendent vows; Therefore he appears throughout the world Saving beings forever and ever.
Buddha cultivated extensively for countless eons Transcendent power to deal with all truths; Thus he has perfected natural power, Appearing throughout all lands.
Buddha cultivated all-sided knowledge; The nature of his omniscience is like space: Therefore he has unhindered power Illuminating all lands in the ten directions.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sprin yid du 'ong ba dri ma med pa'i zla bas sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor rgya mtsho yod pa thams cad la rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Cloud Sound Pure Moon, empowered by the Buddha, looked over all the beings gathered at the enlightenment site and said,

sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul yul ni phyogs rnams kyi/ / 'gro ba'i rgyud dbyings nam mkha' mnyam par snang / / sa rnams yangs pa ji ltar sngon bskyed pa/ / de bzhin kun kyang rin chen sgo nas brjod/ /
dang po'i sa ni dga' ba'i shugs kyi yul/ / phyogs dbyings kun gyi bder gshegs rnams mthong zhing / / gzhal med bskal par dri med yongs sbyangs pas/ / chos dbyings yangs la ye shes rab tu byung / /
thams cad chos la dri med sa gnyis te/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho mang por rnam spyad cing / / rgyal ba tshad med rgya mtsho mchod byas nas/ / 'gro ba tshad med dri med sbyangs pas byung / /
bsod nams dkyil 'khor 'od ni sa gsum ste; ; snying po bzod pa'i dkyil 'khor lhag mthong brtan/ / gang du de skyes rin chen sgo dag nas/ / chos kyi sprin ni rgya chen rab tu thos/ /
'od 'phro rgya mtsho ldan pa gzhal med sa/ / mthu yi 'khor 'od snying po snying rje ste/ / zhing rnams kun tu sgrib dang mnyam pa'i lus/ / 'gro ba'i nyon mongs kun nas rnam sbyangs pa'o/ /
dka' rgyal snying po mnyam dbyings mnyam nyid de/ / zhing rnams kun tu 'gro zhing zhi la gzhol/ / sa rnams chos yul kun nas rab tu skyes/ / de yang rnam dag ji bzhin rgyal bas bstan/ /
shes rab rgya mtsho yangs pa'i sprin la spyod/ / 'byams klas chos kyi mthar thug rnam pa kun/ / zhing rnams kun la mngon sum nam mkha' 'dra/ / de 'byung byang chub shing chen 'di las grag /
chos dbyings mkha' dang 'dra ba'i lus can te/ / 'gro ba kun 'gengs 'gro ba kun snang byed/ / 'byams klas thabs kyi sgo nas rnam par dag / ring du song mchog de ni rgyal bas bstan; ;
thams cad chos dang smon lam spyod mang dang / / zhing rnams rgya mtsho'i dbyings kyang mnyam rtogs pas/ / bskal ba kun tu 'gro mchog mi g.yo ste/ / gzhal med sa de'i sprin kyang rab tu sgrog /
tshad med yul can stobs kyis rab tu snang / / rdzu 'phrul stobs kyis 'gro zhing stobs la 'jug / 'di ni rdul med dge ba'i blo gros sa/ / bskal pa rgya mtshor byang chub shing las brjod/ /
chos kyi sprin ni rgya chen sa bcu ste/ / dus rnams kun 'gengs nam mkha'i rang bzhin 'dra/ / sangs rgyas yul gyi sgra dang dbyangs kun tu/ / rgyal ba'i byin gyis 'di las rab tu grag /

The realm of his spiritual powers is equal to space— No beings do not perceive them. The stages he perfected in his past practice Are fully explained in the jewels.
Striving purely for countless eons, He entered the first stage, that of extreme joy; Producing the vast knowledge of the cosmos, He saw countless Buddhas of the ten directions.
In the stage of purity amidst all things He observed standards of purity numerous as beings; Having practiced extensively for many eons, He served the boundless ocean of Buddhas.
Accumulating virtue in the stage of radiance, His store of calm was firm and enduring; The vast cloud of teachings he had already learned: So it is told in the gemstone fruits.
The incomparable stage of clear intellect like an ocean of flames— Comprehending situations, he gave rise to compassion, With an equal physical presence in all lands: These accomplishments of the Buddha are all expounded.
Universal store of equanimity—the difficult to conquer stage; According with action and stillness, without contradiction, The realm of the Buddhist teaching is completely impartial; How the Buddha purified it, the jewels can tell.
Far-reaching practice—the stage of oceanic wisdom, Totally comprehending all aspects of the teachings, Appearing in all lands like space: The voice of these teachings comes from the trees.
The body of space, pervading the cosmos, The lamp of wisdom, shining on all beings, All practical methods completely purified: His past long journey he causes to be told.
Adorned by execution of all vows, Infinite oceans of lands are all pure; Undisturbed by any discrimination, This peerless stage is fully explained.
Mystic powers of infinite scope Enter the illumining power of the teachings; This pure stage of beneficent wisdom And its eons of practice are fully revealed.
The far-reaching tenth stage of clouds of teaching Engulfs everything, pervading all space; The realm of the Buddha is told in the voice, This voice is the Buddha’s spiritual power.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par gnon pa gti mug med pa'i 'od zer gyi rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus phyogs bcur rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Banner of Light of Benevolent Courage, empowered by the Buddha, surveyed the ten directions and said,

rnam pa du mar 'khor rnams gnas pa ni/ / dad pa sna tshogs yongs su dag pa'i sems/ / rgyan dang yul rnams kun la rab tu zhugs/ / de dag sangs rgyas ye shes 'jug par 'gyur/ /
phan tshun smon lam rnam dag spyod yul te/ / dag pa mtha' yas bya ba rab tu byas/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam 'phrul thams cad kyang / / gzhan dang gzhan gyi sgo nas rab tu mthong / /
bder gshegs chos kyi sku la zhugs pa dag / la las rgyal ba'i chos sku de nyid la/ / kun tu sprin 'dra gzhal med chags med pa'i/ / mtha' yas chos kyi rang bzhin chos nyid mthong / /
la las rgyal ba'i gzugs sku de nyid la/ / phyogs bcu kun tu rnam par 'phrul mdzad cing / / yon tan mtha' yas 'od sprin rab 'bar ba/ / 'gro ba dang tshul sprin du gyur par mthong / /
la la rgyal ba'i ye shes chags med 'jug / dus gsum mnyam nyid mkha' dang 'dra ba'i sku/ / 'gro ba kun gyi bsam pa'i tshul 'byung ba'i/ / sangs rgyas stobs la rab tu 'jug par mthong / /
sangs rgyas gsung ni thogs pa med 'byung ste/ / phyogs kun zhing rnams ma lus rgyas 'gyur zhing / / 'gro ba snod yin skul bar byed pa yi/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la la la 'jug /
la la sangs rgyas snang ba sna tshogs 'jug / sna tshogs snang bas 'gro ba kun bkang zhing / / rgyal ba'i rdzu 'phrul kun tu snang mdzad pa'i/ / sangs rgyas 'od ni la las der yang mthong / /
ba spu'i sgo nas 'od zer rab bkye ba'i/ / 'od zer rgya mtsho'i sprin la la la 'jug / sngon chad rgyal ba'i spyod pa bstan pa la/ / la la dga' zhing rgyal ba shes par byed/ /
la las bsod nams sna tshogs mtshan gyi rnams/ / bder gshegs bsod nams 'byung ba ji bzhin mthong / / pha rol phyin pa rgya mtsho sbyong ba'i tshe/ / ji ltar dag gyur mtshan kyang la las mthong / /
sgo rnams kun nas rgyal ba tshad med de; ; mtha' dang dbus med chos kyi dbyings bkang zhing / / sangs rgyas byin rlabs rab tu brjod pa kun/ / rnam 'phrul sangs rgyas yul ni la las mthong / /

Innumerable sentient beings are in the congregation; Their various minds of faith are all pure; All can enter into understanding of Buddha’s wisdom, And understand all states which adorn it.
Each initiates pure vows and puts them into practice; All have made offerings to innumerable beings. They are able to see the real true body of Buddha As well as all his mystical displays.
Some can see the Buddha’s reality-body, Incomparable, unhindered, pervading everywhere: The nature of all the infinity of things Is in that body completely.
Some see the Buddha’s sublime body of form, Its boundless physical characteristics blazing with light; According to the different understandings of various beings, It transforms into various appearances, everywhere.
Some see the body of unobstructed knowledge, Equal in all times, like space; According to the changes in beings’ inclinations, It causes them to see all kinds of differences.
Some can understand the Buddha’s voice Pervading all lands in the ten directions; According to sentient beings’ abilities to understand, It produces verbal sounds for them, without any hindrance.
Some see the Buddha’s various lights, Variously shining throughout the world; And some see too, in the Buddha’s light, Buddhas displaying their mystic powers.
Some see Buddha’s oceans of clouds of light Issuing from his pores, of radiant hues, Showing the paths he practiced of yore, Causing beings to deeply believe and enter Buddha’s knowledge.
Some see the Buddha’s adorning marks and blessings And see where the blessings come from— The oceans of transcendent means he practiced of old Are clearly seen in the Buddha’s marks.
Buddha’s qualities cannot be measured; They fill the cosmos, without any bounds. These and the ranges of psychic powers These beings can expound through Buddha’s power.

de nas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i gzhi dang snying po rgya mtsho thams cad rnam pa drug tu g.yos so/ /rab tu g.yos so/ /kun tu g.yos so; ;'gul to/ /rab tu 'gul to/ /kun tu 'gul to/ /ldeg go /rab tu ldeg go /kun tu ldeg go /chem chem/ rab tu chem chem/ kun tu chem chem mo/ /'ur 'ur/ rab tu 'ur 'ur/ kun tu 'ur 'ur ro/ /shig shig /rab tu shig shig /kun tu shig shig go /

Then the ocean of worlds of arrays of flower banks, by the power of the Buddha, all shook in six ways, in eighteen manners: that is, they trembled, trembled all over, trembled all over in all directions; they welled up, welled up all over, welled up all over in all directions; they surged, surged all over, surged all over in all directions; they quaked, quaked all over, quaked all over in all directions; they roared, roared all over, roared all over in all directions; they crashed, crashed all over, crashed all over in all directions.

'jig rten gyi dbang po de dag thams cad re res kyang mchod pa mngon par sgrub pa'i sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i char de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du mngon par rab tu phab bo/ / 'di ltar spos kyi me tog sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char thams cad rab tu phab bo/ /rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyi sprin dang rin po che'i 'od 'phro ba'i pad+mo'i dra ba thams cad kyi sprin dang / nor bu rin po che'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor kha dog mtha' yas pa'i sprin dang / rin po che kha dog sna tshogs dang / mu tig thams cad kyi sprin dang / spos dang / tsan+dan rin po che thams cad kyi sprin dang / rin po che'i gdugs thams cad kyi sprin dang / nor bu'i rgyal po sgra dbyangs bzang po yid du 'ong ba'i sprin dang / nor bu nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba mang po'i sprin dang / rin po che'i 'od zer gyi mdzod thams cad kyi sprin dang / rang rang gi lus las rgyan thams cad 'phyang ba'i sprin dang / de lta bu dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi dbang po re res kyang mchod pa mngon par sgrub pa'i sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i char de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho thams cad du mngon par phab bo/ /

These various world leaders each caused clouds of inconceivable offerings to appear, raining on the ocean of beings at the site of enlightenment: clouds of ornaments of all fragrant flowers; clouds of decorations of all precious stones; clouds of flower nets of all jewel flames; clouds of spheres of light of jewels of boundless varieties; clouds of treasuries of pearls of all colors; clouds of all precious sandalwood scents; clouds of umbrellas made of all kinds of precious substances; clouds of diamonds with pure resonance; clouds of necklaces of jewels shining like the sun; clouds of banks of lights of all gemstones; clouds of all sorts of decorations. These clouds of adornments were infinite, inconceivably numerous. These world leaders each produced such clouds of offerings, showering upon the ocean of beings at the Buddha’s site of enlightenment, all reaching everywhere.

ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir 'jig rten gyi dbang po rnams rab tu dga' bar gyur pa de bzhin du gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i 'jig rten gyi dbang po re res kyang mchod pa mngon par sgrub pa'i sprin gyi char de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho dag tu rab tu phab par gyur to/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yang 'jig rten gyi dbang po rnams mos pa gzhan dang gzhan dang / dmigs pa gzhan dang gzhan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul gyi sgo rgya mtsho gzhan dang gzhan dang / tshogs gzhan dang gzhan dang / yang dag par sgrub pa gzhan dang gzhan dang / dga' ba'i shugs kyis spyod pa gzhan dang gzhan dang / phyogs kyi tshul gzhan dang gzhan dang / chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa gzhan dang gzhan dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang byin gyi rlabs la 'jug pa gzhan dang gzhan dang / yul dang stobs la 'jug pa gzhan dang gzhan dang / rnam par thar pa'i tshul rgya mtsho'i sgo gzhan dang gzhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po byang chub la bzhugs pa khong du chud par byed do/ / 'di na ji lta ba bzhin phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgya mtsho'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas klas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad na yang de bzhin no/ /

As in this world the world leaders joyfully produced such offerings, so did all the world leaders in all worlds of the ocean of worlds of arrays of flower banks make such offerings. In each of their worlds there was a Buddha sitting on the site of enlightenment. The individual world leaders’ various resolutions of faith, foci of concentration, methods of meditation, practice of methods assisting enlightenment, accomplishments, joys, approaches, understandings of the teachings, access to the realm of Buddha’s spiritual powers, access to the realms of Buddha’s abilities, entryways into the Buddha’s liberation, were the same as in the flower bank ocean of worlds in all the oceans of worlds in the entire space of the whole cosmos.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyi rgyan gyi tshul rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba ste/ le'u dang po'o;; //
[2. de bzhin gshegs pa'i le'u]
BOOK TWO. Appearance of the Buddha
bam po drug pa/

de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang po de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi sa ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi yul ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la byin gyi rlabs ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi stobs ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mi bsnyengs pa ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen po ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mi 'phrog pa ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi snyan ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi shangs ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi ljags ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi sku ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'od ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'od zer ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni/ ji lta bu zhig mnga'/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa rgya mtsho thams cad ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la tshogs rgya mtsho thams cad ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la theg pa rgya mtsho rnams ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la rab tu gnas pa rgya mtsho thams cad ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la spyod pa rgya mtsho rnams ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la 'byung ba rgya mtsho rnams ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mngon par shes pa rgya mtsho rnams ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho rnams ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sa rgya mtsho rnams ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la smon lam rgya mtsho rnams ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ye shes rgya mtsho rnams ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu yongs su ston/ bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag la yang thugs brtse ba nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang / sems can rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang / sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang / sangs rgyas kyi shin tu bstan pa rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan par mdzad grang / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang / sangs rgyas kyi sku tshe'i tshad rgya mtsho rnams kyang bstan pa mdzad grang snyam pa dang /

AT THAT TIME the enlightening beings and the leaders of all the worlds formed these thoughts: “What are the stages of the Buddha? What are the vistas of the Buddha? What are the empowerments of the Buddha? What are the acts of the Buddha? What are the powers of the Buddha? What are the fearlessnesses of the Buddha? What are the meditations of the Buddha? What are the invincibilities of the Buddha? What are the sense organs of the Buddha? What are the minds of the Buddha? What are the lights of the Buddha’s body? What are the halos of the Buddha? What are the voices of the Buddha? What are the knowledges of the Buddha? O please, World Honored One, pity us and explain to us. Also, all the Buddhas of all oceans of worlds in the ten directions explain to the enlightening beings the oceans of worlds, the oceans of sentient beings, the oceans of Buddhas’ liberations, the oceans of Buddhas’ mystical displays, the oceans of Buddhas’ teachings, the oceans of Buddhas’ names, the oceans of Buddhas’ life spans, as well as the oceans of vows of all enlightening beings, the oceans of approaches of all enlightening beings, the oceans of aids to the Way of all enlightening beings, the oceans of all vehicles of enlightening beings, the oceans of activities of all enlightening beings, the oceans of emancipations of all enlightening beings, the oceans of psychic powers of all enlightening beings, the oceans of ways of transcendence of all enlightening beings, the oceans of stages of all enlightening beings, and the oceans of knowledge of all enlightening beings—please, O Buddha, Enlightened One, World Honored One, explain these for us too.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyis mchod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sprin de dag las tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag byung ngo/ /
Then the enlightening beings, by mystical power, produced sound issuing spontaneously from the clouds of offerings, speaking verses:

mtha' yas rgya chen bskal par rab spyad de/ / byang chub shing drung rang byung yang dag skyes/ / phyi mtha'i bskal par 'gro ba'i sprin gyur pa/ / de bzhin gshegs pas sku ni byin gyis brlabs/ /
'gro ba ma lus kun gyi the tshom gcod/ / mos pa'i stobs ni yangs pa rab tu skyed/ / sems can sdug bsngal mtha' yas zhi bar mdzad/ / sangs rgyas bde la 'gro ba thams cad 'god/ /
byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas zhing rdul snyed/ / de bzhin gshegs la lta zhing kun nas gnas/ / de dag bsam pa spyod yul ji bzhin du/ / the tshom bsal bar chos rnams rab bstan gsol/ /
rgyal ba kun gyi sa ni ji lta bu/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gyi rgyud rnams dang / / sangs rgyas byin rlabs mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / de dag tshul ni rnam dag bstan du gsol/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ci yis 'jug / rgyal ba'i mkhyen la ji ltar 'jug pa dang / / rgya chen mtha' yas stobs rnams rnam sbyang ba/ / rgyal sras kun la yang dag bstan du gsol/ /
sangs rgyas ting 'dzin ji ltar mtha' yas dang / / mi bsnyengs chos nyid ji ltar rnam sbyangs dang / / rdzu 'phrul mthu yang mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / 'gro ba'i bsam pa rnams la bsgrag tu gsol/ /
ji ltar chos rgyal pho brang mnga' mdzad cing / / rgyal ba'i spyod yul ji ltar mi 'phrog dang / / sangs rgyas chos gzhan rgya chen de dag kyang / / thugs brtse'i slad du yang dag bstan du gsol/ /
rgyal ba'i spyan ni ji ltar tshad med cing / / snyan dang shangs dang de bzhin ljags dang sku/ / sangs rgyas thugs kyang ji ltar mtha' yas pa/ / 'di dag tshul la 'jug pa bstan du gsol/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho ji ltar sems can khams/ / chos dbyings tshul rnams rgya mtsho de dag dang / / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / 'di dag rgyal ba'i sras la bstan du gsol; ;
pha rol phyin pa rgya mtsho bsam yas dang / / rnam par thar la 'jug tshul rgya mtsho dang / / chos rnams kun gyi tshul rnams rgya mtsho dag / byang chub snying por thams cad bstan du gsol/ /

Countless eons of practice complete, You’ve become truly awake under the enlightenment tree: You appear universally to liberate beings, Like clouds filling all to the end of time.
When beings have doubts, you put an end to them, Causing all to develop great faith and resolution; Everywhere removing unlimited suffering, You make all experience the peace of the Buddhas.
An infinite number of enlightening beings Have all come here to behold you: Please explain the truth, eliminate doubt, According to our capacities to receive.
How can we know the stages of the Buddhas? How can we observe the Buddha’s sphere? The empowerment of the Buddha has no bounds: Please show us this truth and purify us.
What is the Buddha’s realm of action That can be entered by wisdom? Buddha’s power is pure and unlimited: Please show it to us enlightening beings.
What are your vast meditation states? How do you purify fearlessness? Your mystic powers cannot be measured: Please explain in accord with beings’ dispositions.
The Buddhas, kings of truth, are like the world leaders— Free wherever they go, none can constrain them: This and other great teachings Please expound for the benefit of all.
How are the Buddha’s eyes innumerable, As also are the other organs of sense? And how are the minds also countless? Please show us a way to know about this.
As are the oceans of worlds and oceans of beings, All oceans of arrangements in the cosmos, So are the oceans of Buddhas—unbounded: Please tell all to the children of Buddha.
The ocean of transcendent ways, forever beyond conception, The ocean of techniques for universal liberation, The ocean of all the aspects of the teaching, Please expound at this enlightenment site.

de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rnam par rtog pa thugs kyis thugs su chud nas zhal gyi sgo tshams kyi mtshams kyi gseb nas 'od zer sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu bkye ba 'di lta ste/ rin po che'i ze ba rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ chos kyi dbyings su dbyangs sna tshogs kyis rgyan byed pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ 'od shin tu phra ba'i sprin kun nas lding ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / snying po byang chub kyi 'od ces bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ rin po che thams cad 'od 'phro ba'i gdugs kyi sprin ces bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ rnam par snang bas chos kyi dbyings rab tu snang ba'i 'od ces bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'byung zhing 'khyil ba'i rgyan ces bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ rin po che'i rdo rje dri ma med pa mang po'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du nye bar 'gro ba'i rgyan ces bya ba'i 'od zer dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mtshan gyi 'khor lo'i sgra rab tu sgrog pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer dang / de dag la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'od zer rab tu bkye ste/ 'od zer de dag re re zhing yang 'khor gyi 'od zer sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do/ / 'od zer de dag re re zhing yang rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog shin tu ston pa dag ste/ de dag rab tu 'phros nas phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rab tu snang bar byas te/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho nas 'od zer gyi sgo de dag thams cad kyi mthus gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad mthong bar gyur to/ /'od zer de dag thams cad kyi sgo nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag byung bar gyur to/ /

At that point the Buddha, knowing what the enlightening beings were thinking, emitted a multitude of light rays from his teeth. Those light rays were as numerous as atoms in a buddha-field: they included, for example, light rays of flowers of jewels illumining everywhere; light rays producing various sounds adorning the universe; light rays draping subtle clouds; light rays showing the Buddhas of the ten directions sitting on their sites of enlightenment making mystical displays; light rays of umbrellas of clouds of flames of all jewels; light rays filling the universe without impediment; light rays adorning all buddha-fields; light rays setting up banners of pure diamonds; light rays adorning the scenes of enlightenment where hosts of enlightening beings were assembled; light rays with subtle vibrations intoning the names and epithets of all the Buddhas. There were as many such light rays as there are atoms in a buddha-field, and each individual ray had as many light beams accompanying it. Those lights all contained all exquisite jewellike hues, and they each illumined oceans of worlds as numerous as atoms in a billion buddha-lands. The congregations of enlightening beings in all the other oceans of worlds could see this Lotus Bank Array ocean of worlds within those lights. By the spiritual power of the Buddha, those lights, in the presence of all those enlightening beings, intoned these verses:

bskal pa rgya mtsho mtha' yas spyod spyad de/ / phyogs rnams rgya mtshor sangs rgyas kun kyang mchod/ / sems can rgya mtsho rnam par dag byas nas/ / rnam par snang mdzad byang chub mngon sangs rgyas/ /
phyogs rnams kun tu snang zhing mngon par mdzes/ / spu rnams kun nas sprul pa'i sprin rnams 'gyed/ / des ni sems can snod bzhin bskul byas nas/ / byang chub sbyor ba chags med rnam par dag /
srid pa'i rgyud na sngon chad 'khor ba'i tshe; ; rgyal bas sems can yongs su smin mdzad pa/ / de dag skad cig gcig gis rab tu bkrol/ / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul 'di dag mtha' yas so/ /
rgyan rnams sna tshogs kun tu 'od kyang snang / / byang chub shing ni yal ga rin chen 'phyang / / 'od rnams bkye ba kun tu rnam par brgyan/ / byang chub bsam gyis mi khyab der sangs rgyas; ;
phyogs rnams kun tu sgra ni rab tu sgrog / sems can kun gyi sems bzhin tshim byas te/ / sna tshogs thabs kyi sgo nas rnam par 'dul/ / de las chos nyid zhi sgra rab tu 'byung / /
zhing rnams stong gi rdul snyed sngon chad du/ / spyod tshe pha rol phyin kun rgyas par mdzad/ / stobs rnams kun la sangs rgyas rab bzhugs kyi/ / rgyal ba de yi zhal bltar kun kyang deng / /
zhing gi rdul snyed phyogs rnams thams cad nas/ / rgyal sras mang po rab tu dga' ste lhags/ / mchod pa sna tshogs char pa rab 'bebs shing / / thams cad 'khod de rgyal ba mngon sum lta/ /
gsung dbyangs gcig las mtha' yas mdo yi rnams/ / rgya mtsho dag kyang sangs rgyas shin tu ston/ / 'gro kun yid bzhin chos kyi char 'bebs kyi/ / rkang gnyis gtso bo de la bltar yang deng / /
dus gsum rgyal ba'i smon lam gang yod pa/ / skad cig thugs la de dag mngon sum ste/ / rgyal ba byang chub shing drung ston mdzad kyi/ / rgyal ba'i drung du smyur te 'dod bar gyis/ /
sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad ye shes mtsho/ / 'od zer kun gyi sgo nas rab tu snang / / de yi chos nyid ji ltar ji 'dra de dag ltos/ / sangs rgyas 'gro kun mngon sum chos ston to/ /

Cultivating oceans of practices over countless eons, Making offerings to oceans of Buddhas everywhere, Teaching and liberating the oceans of all beings, Now fulfilling sublime enlightenment—The Universal Illuminator.
From his pores come magic clouds With light shining through all quarters, Awakening those able to receive the teaching, Causing them to approach enlightenment, pure, unhindered.
Buddha traversed all paths of existence, Teaching and developing the living beings; The mystic powers at his command are infinite: Instantly he causes all to be freed.
The enlightenment tree of precious gems Is embellished with the finest adornments; Buddha truly awakes under it, Emanating light, majestically shining.
The roar of his great voice fills all quarters, Preaching for all the way to great peace. According to the mental dispositions of beings, He wakes them by various means.
He practiced transcendent ways and fulfilled them, As many as atoms in a thousand lands. All the powers he has already attained; You all should go and pay him respect.
Buddha-children of all quarters, as many as atoms of lands, All come together, with joy; Having showered clouds of offerings, Now they stand before Buddha with single-minded gaze.
One tone of the Buddha contains an infinity, Able to expound the deep ocean of scriptures, Raining the sublime teaching in accord with all minds; That most honored human you all should go see.
The vows of Buddhas of all times Are told under the enlightenment tree; All appear in an instant: Hurry to the Buddha’s spot.
Vairocana’s great ocean of knowledge Shines from his face for all to see. Now, awaiting the gathering of the masses, he’s about to speak: Go see him and hear what he says.

de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho de dag nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyis yang dag par bskul ba'i rnams byang chub sems dpa' rang rang gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho dang lhan cig tu 'phags te/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su shar phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho pad+mo'i dpal dri ma med par snang ba'i rgyan ces bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams bar ma'i rgyud de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i phreng ba rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya ba na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi chu bo rnam par sangs rgyas pa/ nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i rgyal po bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dpal pad+mo rnam par lta ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho de nas 'phags te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ong bar gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing rin po che'i char gyi 'od zer pad+mo'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i ri bo'i zom gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nyi ma'i 'khor lo'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i me tog gi phreng ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sil snyan sgra thams cad 'byin pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phye ma'i shing gi mdzod kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / spos dang / bdug spos gzugs thams cad yongs su ston pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / spos thams cad kyi shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa mchod pa'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der phyin te bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas shar phyogs su brten te me tog snang ba sna tshogs kyi snying po can gyi seng+ge'i khri mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod par gyur to/ /

At that time, all the masses in the oceans of worlds in the ten directions, awakened by the Buddha’s light, all went to Vairocana Buddha’s place and made offerings. For example, to the east of this Flower Bank Array ocean of worlds there is an ocean of worlds called Array of Lotuses of Pure Light: among its world systems is a land called Diamond Mine of Jewel Necklaces; the Buddha there was called Infinite King Awakening Space with the Water of Truth; among that Buddha’s vast congregation was a great enlightening being named Lotus Banner Contemplating the Supreme Teaching who came to the Buddha with a group of enlightening beings as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds; each produced ten kinds of clouds of forms of enlightening beings, filling space and not dissolving. They also manifested ten kinds of clouds of jewel mountains, ten kinds of clouds of spheres of sunlight, ten kinds of clouds of jewel flower ornaments, ten kinds of clouds of music containing all tones, ten kinds of clouds of powder incense trees, ten kinds of clouds of myriad forms of perfume and incense, and ten kinds of clouds of trees of all kinds of fragrances. Clouds of offerings such as these, as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds, filled all of space, not dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and offered them to him. They then magically produced in the eastern quarter lion seats of banks of lights of various flowers and sat crosslegged on those seats.

de nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di dang 'dabs chags su lho phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rin po che thams cad snang bas rnam par brgyan pa'i snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams bar ma'i rgyud de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams 'od mtha' yas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan na de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mkhyen pa'i 'od dpal gyi ri'i rgyal po bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' chos rgya mtsho rnam par snang ba'i blo gros zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de nas 'phags te/ bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ong bar 'gyur te/ nor bu'i rgyal po rgyan gyi yul thams cad kyis rnam par gsal bar byas pa'i snying po'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing / nor bu'i rgyal po kun nas snang ba rin po che'i rgyan gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po rin po che 'od 'phro ba rab tu 'bar zhing / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan shin tu sgrog pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po kun nas sgra 'byin cing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad sgrog pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po shing gi yal ga sna tshogs kyis snying po byang chub kyi rgyan byed pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po sgo kun nas rin po che'i 'od zer dang / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas snang bar byed pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po rgyan thams cad dang ma 'dres par 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du gzugs brnyan ston pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po 'od 'phro shin tu sdug pa'i sgron mas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul rjes su sgrog pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzhal med khang gi gzugs brnyan yang dag par ston pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po rin po che sna tshogs kyi tshon gyi dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan rnam par snang ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa nor bu'i rgyal po'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul phra mo snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der phyin te bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas lho phyogs su brten te in+d+ra nI la dang / 'dzam bu nA da dang / pad+ma rA ga sna tshogs kyi snying po can gyi seng+ge'i khri mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod par gyur to/ /

South of this Flower Bank ocean of worlds is an ocean of worlds called Mine of Ornaments of Radiance of Moons Made of All Jewels. Among its world systems is a land called Array of Boundless Light Spheres. The Buddha there was named Polar Mountain King with the Virtues of the Light of Universal Knowledge. Among that Buddha’s immense congregation was an enlightening being named Wisdom Universally Illumining the Ocean of Truths, who came to the Buddha along with a group of enlightening beings as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds; each produced ten kinds of clouds of jewels from mines of lights of all adornments, filling space without dispersing. They also manifested ten kinds of clouds of all-illumining regal jewels, raining all kinds of ornaments, ten kinds of clouds of blazing jewels intoning the names and epithets of the Buddhas, ten kinds of clouds of jewels expounding all the Buddhas’ teachings, ten kinds of clouds of jewel trees adorning the scene of enlightenment, ten kinds of jewel clouds of precious light projecting myriad phantom buddhas, ten kinds of jewel clouds displaying the forms of the adornments of all sites of enlightenment, ten kinds of jewel clouds of lamps of intense flames expounding the realm of the Buddhas, ten kinds of jewel clouds of forms of the palaces of infinite lands, and ten kinds of jewel clouds showing images of the Buddhas of past, present, and future. Jewel clouds such as these, as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds, all pervaded space without dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and offered them to him; then each produced in the southern quarter lotus bank lion seats of sapphires and rose gold, then sat crosslegged on the seats.

de nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di dang 'dabs chags su nub phyogs na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rin po che'i 'od yid du 'ong bar snang ba zhes bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams gos kyi stan yongs su 'byung ba na de bzhin gshegs pa spos mngon du snang ba'i yon tan rin po ches brgyan pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' spos 'od 'phro ba'i rgyan zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te/ rin po che dang / spos dang / me tog sna tshogs thams cad kyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin gyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing / nor bu'i rgyal po kha dog mtha' yas pas brgyan par khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i sgron ma dang / spos 'od 'phro ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / mu tig thams cad kyi khang ba brtsegs pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che thams cad kyi me tog gi ze ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i phreng bas yongs su brgyan pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / 'od zer gyi snang ba phyogs kun tu 'phro ba'i snying po dang ldan pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa rgyan thams cad 'byung ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i tshon thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan cing rgyan du ma yang dag par ston pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phyogs thams cad rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan par kun tu rgyas par 'gengs pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sgo kun tu me tog gi rta babs dang / dril bu'i dra ba bres pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na pa der phyin te bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas nub phyogs su brten te seng+ge'i khri rin po che'i pad+mo chen po lo ma sna tshogs gser las byas pa'i snying po can mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod par gyur to/ /

To the west of this Flower Bank ocean of worlds there is an ocean of worlds named Pleasant Jewel Light. Among the world systems therein is a land called Producing the Best Life-Supports. The Buddha there was named Array of Quality Jewels of Fragrant Flowers. Among the vast congregation of that Buddha was a great enlightening being called Universal Arrays of Moonlight’s Fragrant Flames, who, together with as many enlightening beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds, came to the Buddha, each producing ten kinds of clouds of mansions of all kinds of precious fragrant flowers, filling all space without dispersing. They also produced ten kinds of clouds of mansions of precious stones of boundless colors and forms, ten kinds of clouds of mansions of fragrant flames from precious lamps, ten kinds of clouds of mansions of all pearls, ten kinds of clouds of mansions of all precious flowers, ten kinds of clouds of mansions decorated with jewel ornaments, ten kinds of clouds of mansions manifesting the treasuries of lights of all adornments in the ten directions, ten kinds of clouds of mansions of all kinds of embellishments from throughout the ten directions, ten kinds of clouds of mansions studded with all kinds of precious stones, and ten kinds of clouds of mansions with gates of flowers and networks of chimes. These mansion clouds, as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, all filled space without dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and presented them as offerings; then they produced in the western quarter lion seats of great treasuries of gold leaves, and then sat crosslegged on these seats.

de nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di dang 'dabs chags su byang phyogs na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bai DUr+ya pad+mo'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams me tog ut+pa la'i rgyan na de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes kyi dpal kun tu dbyangs kyi rgyal po bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' seng+ge'i 'od zer snang bas mthu 'byin pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'phags nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te/ spos dang nor bu sna tshogs thams cad kyi shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing / sgo thams cad nas lo ma'i dog pa'i sprin 'byung ba'i spos kyi shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / shing gi gzugs thams cad las rgyan mtha' yas pa yongs su ston pa'i shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / me tog thams cad kyi sprin rab tu nar pa'i me tog gi shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i 'od 'phro ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyis rnam par snang bar byas pa'i shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / tsan+dan gyi phye ma thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lus phyed yang dag par ston pa'i shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sngon gyi snying po byang chub kyi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu ston pa'i shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa'i gos kyi mdzod kyi nyi mas rnam par snang bar byas pa'i shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sgra dbyangs thams cad rab tu sgrog cing yid du 'ong ba'i sgra kun tu gtong ba'i shing gi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa shing gi sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der phyin te bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas byang phyogs su brten te seng+ge'i khri nor bu sgron ma'i pad+mo'i snying po can mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod par gyur to/ /

To the north of this Flower Bank ocean of worlds there is an ocean of worlds called Treasuries of Light Spheres of Lapis Lazuli Lotuses. Among the world systems therein is a land called Array of Blue Lotuses. The Buddha’s name was King of Sound of the Banner of Universal Knowledge. Among that Buddha’s vast congregation was a great enlightening being named Lion Stretch Light, who, with a group of enlightening beings as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, came to the Buddha, each manifesting ten kinds of clouds of beautiful trees of all kinds of fragrant jewels, which filled space without dispersing. They also produced ten kinds of clouds of trees displaying arrays of all trees of infinite colors and forms, ten kinds of clouds of trees adorned with all flowers, ten kinds of clouds of trees adorned with spheres of light of the radiance of all jewels, ten kinds of clouds of trees adorned with physical forms of enlightening beings, perfumed with all kinds of sandalwood, ten kinds of clouds of trees inconceivably adorned with scenes of past sites of enlightenment, ten kinds of clouds of trees of sunlike light from treasuries of clothes made of all kinds of jewels, and ten kinds of clouds of trees emanating all kinds of pleasing sounds. Clouds such as these, numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, extended throughout space without dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and presented them as offerings; then they each magically produced in the northern quarter lion seats of banks of lotuses with jewel lamps, and sat crosslegged on those seats.

de nas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di dang 'dabs chags su byang dang / shar gyi phyogs mtshams na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'dzam bu chu klung dang / shel gyi kha dog tshon gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams bar ma'i rgyud de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs kyi snying po na de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i sgron ma bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi yon tan gyi mdzod mi zad pa'i dpal gyi gzi brjid mar me zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'phags nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te/ seng+ge'i khri rin po che kha dog mtha' yas pa'i pad+mo'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing / seng+ge'i khri nor bu'i rgyal po kun tu mngon pas rnam par snang bar byas pa'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / seng+ge'i khri rgyan mang po thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / seng+ge'i khri rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i sgro na ma sna tshogs kyi phreng ba'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / seng+ge'i khri phyogs kun nas phreng ba rin po che'i char 'bebs pa'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / seng+ge'i khri spos kyi me tog pad+mo'i phreng ba rin po che thams cad kyi snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / seng+ge'i khri sangs rgyas kyi gdan thams cad kyi rgyan yang dag par ston pa'i nor bu'i rgyal po'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / seng+ge'i khri rgyan dang phreng ba thams cad 'phyang zhing rta babs dang stegs bus rab tu brgyan pa'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / seng+ge'i khri shing thams cad kyi yal ga las nor bu rin po che dang phye ma 'byung ba'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / seng+ge'i khri spos dang rin po che'i tshogs sna tshogs kyis kun nas brgyan pa'i nyi mas rnam par snang bar byas pa'i snying po can gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa seng+ge'i khri'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der phyin te bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas byang dang / shar gyi phyogs mtshams su brten te seng+ge'i khri nor bu rin po che snang ba'i rgyal mtshan gyi pad+mo sna tshogs kyi snying po can mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod par gyur to/ /

Northeast of this Flower Bank ocean of worlds there is an ocean of worlds called Rose Gold and Lapis Lazuli Banner. Among the world systems there is a land called Array of Jewels. The Buddha there was called Fearless Lamp of All Truths. Among that Buddha’s vast congregation was a great enlightening being called Inexhaustible Mine of Virtues of the Lamp of Supreme Light, who came, with as many enlightening beings as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds, to the Buddha, each producing ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones of stores of jewel lotuses of boundless forms, which filled space without dispersing. They also produced ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones of stores of lights of diamonds, ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones adorned with all kinds of decorations, ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones of banks of flames of lamps ringed with jewels, ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones showering jewel ornaments all over, ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones of treasuries of precious ornaments of all fragrant flowers, ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones of mines of regal jewels showing the adornments of the seats of all Buddhas, ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones of treasuries of jewel branches and stems of trees of all kinds of precious stones, ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones of all arrays of ornaments, steps, and doors, and ten kinds of clouds of lion thrones of banks of lights adorned with gems and perfumes. Such clouds as these, as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds, all filled space without dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and presented them to him as offerings. Then, in the northeast direction each magically produced a lion seat of jewel lotuses with banners of lights of precious stones and sat crosslegged thereon.

de nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di dang 'dabs chags su shar dang / lho'i phyogs mtshams na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho baiDUr+ya'i 'od zer kun tu snang ba gser gyi rgyan ces bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams spos kyi dpal dri ma med par snang ba na de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu dga' ba'i shugs dpal gyi rgyal po bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' ye shes kyi 'od zer shes rab kun nas sgron ma'i blo gros zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'phags te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te/ nor bu yid bzhin gyi rgyal po thams cad kyi bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che in+d+ra nI la'i ze ba can gyi me tog thams cad kyi rgyan gyi bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / spos rin po che'i bla re thams cad kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che 'od 'phro ba sgron ma'i gzugs kyi bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / 'od dang / sgra dbyangs rab tu ston pa'i bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu dang / gos dang / rgyan thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan yang dag par ston pa'i bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / me tog thams cad kyi dog pa lta bu rin po che'i bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / dril bu sna tshogs kun tu sgras khyab par byed pa'i dra ba'i bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / pad+mo'i dra ba mtha' yas pa sna tshogs rin po che'i snying po can gyi bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / gser gyi ze ba 'od 'phro zhing snang ba'i rgyal mtshan gyi bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzugs brnyan rab tu ston pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i bla re'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa bla re'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha'kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ shar dang / lho'i phyogs mtshams su brten te seng+ge'i khri pad+mo sna tshogs rin po ches rab tu brgyan pa'i snying po can mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod do/ /

Southeast of this Flower Bank ocean of worlds is an ocean of worlds called Gold Embellished Lapis Lazuli Light Shining Everywhere. Among its world systems is a land called Pure Fragrant Light. The Buddha there was named King of Profound Faith and Universal Joy. Among the Buddha’s vast congregation was a great enlightening being called Universal Light of the Lamp of Wisdom, who came to the Buddha along with a group of enlightening beings as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, each producing ten kinds of clouds of drapes of all kinds of wish-fulfilling jewels, which filled all of space without dispersing. They also caused to appear ten kinds of clouds of drapes adorned with all flowers of sapphires, ten kinds of clouds of drapes of all fragrant jewels, ten kinds of clouds of drapes of lamps with jewel flames, ten kinds of clouds of drapes of regal jewels displaying the Buddhas’ spiritual powers expounding the teachings, ten kinds of clouds of drapes of gems in the forms of all clothing adornments, ten kinds of clouds of drapes of lights of masses of all jewels, ten kinds of clouds of drapes of sounds of chimes on jewel nets, ten kinds of clouds of drapes on jewel pedestals with lotus nets, and ten kinds of clouds of drapes displaying the forms of all inconceivable adornments. Clouds of drapes of jewels such as these, as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds, all filled space without dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and presented them as offerings. Then, to the southeast, each magically produced a lion seat of banks of jewel lotuses and sat crosslegged thereon.

de nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di dang 'dabs chags su lho dang / nub kyi phyogs mtshams na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho nyi ma'i 'od zer rab tu 'bar bas kun tu snang ba'i snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams bar ma'i rgyud de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams nyi ma dang seng+ge ltar snang ba na de bzhin gshegs pa sgo kun nas ye shes rnam par snang ba'i dbyangs bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' me tog kun nas 'od 'phro gtsug phud rab tu 'phyang ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'phags te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te sna tshogs thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i rin po che'i gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing / 'od zer snang ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i me tog gi gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / mu tig mang po kha dog mtha' yas pa thams cad kyi gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi snying rje'i sgo nas rab tu sgrog pa'i gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i 'od 'phro ba sna tshogs kyi phreng ba'i gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i tshon rnams pa sna tshogs kyi 'od kyis rab tu brgyan cing dril bu'i dra ba bres pa'i gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i shing gi yal ga thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i gzugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po nyi ma rnam par snang ba'i lte ba'i gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / spos dang bdug pa thams cad kyi gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / tsan+dan gyi phye ma mang pos kun tu rgyas par 'gengs pa'i gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po rnam par bstan pas kun tu rgyan gyis khyab par byed pa'i gdugs kyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa gdugs kyi sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der phyin te bcom ldan'das la phyag 'tshal nas lho dang / nub kyi phyogs mtshams su brten te seng+ge'i khri in+d+ra nI la yid du 'ong bar 'bar ba'i 'od zer gyi snying po can dag mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod do/ /

Southwest of this Flower Bank ocean of worlds is an ocean of worlds called Sunlight Shining Everywhere; among its world systems is a land called Lion Sunlight. The Buddha there was called Sound of Light of Universal Knowledge. Among that Buddha’s vast congregation was a great enlightening being named Topknot of Flames of Radiant Flower Lights, who came to the Buddha with a group of enlightening beings, as many as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds, each manifesting ten kinds of clouds of parasols of beautiful ornamental jewels, filling space without dispersing. They also produced ten kinds of clouds of parasols of flowers of arrays of light beams, ten kinds of clouds of parasols of treasures of pearls of boundless colors, ten kinds of clouds of parasols of diamonds emanating the sounds of compassion of all enlightening beings, ten kinds of clouds of parasols of blazing garlands of jewels, ten kinds of clouds of parasols draped with nets of chimes embellished with precious stones, ten kinds of clouds of parasols decorated with branches of jewel trees, ten kinds of clouds of parasols of diamonds like the sun shining everywhere, ten kinds of clouds of parasols of all kinds of perfume and incense, ten kinds of clouds of parasols of stores of sandalwood, and ten kinds of clouds of parasols of arrays of universal lights of the vast sphere of buddhahood. Such clouds of parasols of precious substances, numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, all filled space without dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and presented them as offerings. Then, to the southwest, they each magically produced a lion seat of banks of adornments of flames of sapphire light and sat crosslegged thereon.

de nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di dang 'dabs chags su nub dang / byang gi phyogs mtshams na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rin po che'i 'od zer 'bar ba'i skar mda' 'od kyi snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams par ma'i rgyud de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams spos kyi rgyan yid du 'ong ba'i snying po na de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan rgya mtsho tshad med pa'i 'od bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od zer dang / gzi brjid mi zad pa'i rgyal po'i blo gros zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'phags te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te/ rin po che thams cad du snang ba'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing / rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i gzugs kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / me tog gi sprin gyis rnam par snang bar byas pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / 'od zer gyi sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzugs brnyan gyi khongs su chud pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i yal ga'i sgo kun nas sangs rgyas kyi yul rab tu sgrog pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po rin po che baiDUr+ya'i rigs kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sems skad cig gis sems can mtha' yas pa'i gzugs yongs su ston pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sems skad cig gcig gis sems can mtha' yas pa'i gzugs yongs su ston pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam 'byung ba'i sgra yid du 'ong ba rab tu gtong ba'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du sems can 'dul ba'i sgra sgrog pa nor bu'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der phyin te bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas nub dang / byang gi phyogs mtshams su brten te seng+ge'i khri 'od zer 'bar ba mi zad pa'i gzi brjid kyi snying po can dag mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod do/ /

Northwest of this Flower Bank ocean of worlds is an ocean of worlds called Precious Light Radiance. Among its world systems is a land called Array of Myriad Fragrances. The Buddha there was called Light of the Ocean of Infinite Virtues. Among that Buddha’s congregation was a great enlightening being called Jewel King of Inexhaustible Light, who, together with as many enlightening beings as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds, came to the Buddha, each producing ten kinds of clouds of light spheres of radiance of all jewels, filling space without dispersing. They also produced ten kinds of clouds of light spheres of all beautiful flowers, ten kinds of clouds of light spheres of all phantom buddhas, ten kinds of clouds of light spheres of the buddha-lands of the ten directions, ten kinds of clouds of light spheres of the jewel trees and thunderous sound of the realm of the Buddhas, ten kinds of clouds of light spheres of all regal gems, ten kinds of clouds of light spheres instantaneously displaying the forms of infinite beings, ten kinds of clouds of light spheres of the voice of the Buddha’s great vow, and ten kinds of clouds of light spheres of diamonds emanating sounds edifying all sentient beings. Such clouds of light spheres, numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, all filled space without dispersing. Having produced these clouds, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and presented them as offerings. Then, to the northwest, they each produced a lion seat of treasuries of awesome qualities of infinite light and sat crosslegged thereon.

de nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di dang 'dabs chags su 'og gi phyogs na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho pad+mo dri zhim dpal gyi snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams bar ma'i rgyud de las 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i seng+ge snang zhing 'bar ba na de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings snang bar mdzad pa'i 'od zer bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings su 'od 'phro ba rnam par snang ba 'byung ba'i blo gros zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'phags nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te/ rin po che thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing / spos thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che'i 'od 'phro ba thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad brjed pas khyab par byed pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rgyan gyis rnam par snang bar byas pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / bskal pa thams cad gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par sangs rgyas yang dag par 'byung zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya bar brjod pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rin po che zad mi shes pa thams cad dang / me tog thams cad kyi ze ba'i 'od zer gyi sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa 'od zer gyi sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te 'og gi phyogs su brten nas seng+ge'i khri rin po che'i sgron ma rab tu 'bar ba 'byung ba'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod do/ /

Below this Flower Bank ocean of worlds there is an ocean of worlds called Treasury of Exquisite Qualities of Lotus Blossom Fragrance. Among its world systems is a land called Radiance of Light of a Jewel Lion. The Buddha there was named Light of the Cosmos. In the vast congregation of that Buddha was a great enlightening being named Wisdom Flaming with the Light of the Universe, who, together with as many enlightening beings as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds, came to the Buddha, each producing ten kinds of clouds of light beams of mines of all jewels, filling space without dispersing. They also produced ten kinds of clouds of light beams of all fragrances, ten kinds of clouds of light beams producing the sounds of all Buddhas explaining the truth, ten kinds of clouds of light beams revealing the arrays of all buddha-lands, ten kinds of clouds of light beams of palaces of all beautiful flowers, ten kinds of clouds of light beams displaying the work of the Buddhas of all ages teaching sentient beings, ten kinds of clouds of light beams of flower buds of all inexhaustible treasures, and ten kinds of clouds of light beams of all kinds of decorated thrones. Clouds of light beams such as these, numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, filled all space without dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and presented them as offerings. Then each created, in the nadir, a lion seat of lotuses with lamps with jewel flames, and sat crosslegged thereon.

de nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su steng gi phyogs na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'od rgya mtsho'i rgyan ces bya ba yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams bar ma'i rgyud de dag las 'jig rten gyi khams mtshan yid du 'ong ba rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba na de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan dang grags pa thogs pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa rab tu snang ba'i rgyal po bzhugs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho nas byang chub sems dpa' stobs dang / brtson 'grus chags pa med pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba/
