byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu 'phags nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs par gyur te/ rin po che kha dog mtha' yas par 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlob cing / nor bu rin po che kun nas 'od kyi dra ba 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rgya chen pos rnam par snang bar 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / spos thams cad 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rgyan thams cad 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdzu 'phrul 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / shing dang za ba rnam pa sna tshogs su 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / rdo rje sna tshogs 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / nor bu'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mtha' yas pa brjod cing 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / mu tig gi sgron ma 'od 'phro ba'i sprin bcus nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa 'od 'phro ba'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs par byed cing / bcom ldan 'das gang na pa der phyin te bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas steng gi phyogs su brten te seng+ge'i khri sangs rgyas kyi gsung sgrog pa'i 'od zer 'byung ba'i pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod do/ /

Above this Flower Bank ocean of worlds is an ocean of worlds called Radiant Arrays of Precious Stones. Among the world systems there is a land called Formless Subtle Light. The Buddha there was called Unimpeded Light of Virtue. Among that Buddha’s vast congregation was a great enlightening being called Vigorous Intellect with Unhindered Power, who, along with as many enlightening beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds, came to the Buddha, each producing ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of jewels of boundless physical forms, filling space without dispersing. They also produced ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of webs of precious stones, ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of the ornaments of all the vast buddha-lands, ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of all exquisite fragrances, ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of all adornments, ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of the mystical displays of the Buddhas, ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of all beautiful tree-flowers, ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of all diamonds, ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of jewels bespeaking the practices of infinite enlightening beings, and ten kinds of clouds of light-flames of lamps of all pearls. Clouds of light flames like these, as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, all filled space without dispersing. Having caused these clouds to appear, the enlightening beings bowed to the Buddha and presented them as offerings. Then, at the zenith, they each produced a lion seat of lotus banks of light intoning the voices of the Buddhas and sat crosslegged thereon.

de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byang chub sems dpa' re re zhing yang byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te byang chub sems dpa' re re zhing yang rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mchod pa'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par byin gyis rlob cing 'ongs par gyur te gang nas 'ongs pa'i phyogs su brten te seng+ge'i khri rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyan gyi snying po can dag mngon par sprul cing skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod par gyur to/ /

In this way, in as many oceans of worlds as there are atoms in ten billion buddha-fields, there were as many great enlightening beings, each surrounded by a group of enlightening beings as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, who came to the gathering. These enlightening beings each produced clouds of offerings of various adornments, as numerous as atomic particles in an ocean of worlds, which all filled space without dispersing. And having produced these clouds, they bowed to the Buddha and presented them as offerings; then, in the direction from which they had come, all magically produced lion seats with various precious adornments and sat crosslegged on them.

'khod pa'i rjes la byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad re re nas 'od zer gyi sprin rin po che thams cad ltar kha dog sna tshogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu byung bar gyur to/ / rin po che re re'i sgo nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can la 'khod pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu byung bar gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' re res kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho'i khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thams cad kyi sbubs gang bar byas nas rdul shin tu phra ba re re la yang zhing 'byams klas pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du rab tu 'jug par gyur to/ / zhing re rer yang dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mthong zhing shes par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la yang rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag par bstan pa'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed re re'i lha'i gnas thams cad du skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba yang dag par bstan pa'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la yang 'jig rten gyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad shin tu bstan pa'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi zhing 'byams klas pa thams cad rab tu bskyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rab tu brjod cing rnam par 'phrul ba'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba dang / smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad rab tu bsgrags pa'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'gro ba thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi yan lag rnam par bstan cing brjod pa'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sprin thams cad kyi char dbab pa'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su chos kyi dbyings snang bas rgyas par rnam par 'phrul pa'i mthu'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi skus chos kyi dbyings gang bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa dang / 'od thams cad kyi sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ / sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho thams cad na byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po rab tu gnas pa'i sgo dag nas yang dag par bskul ba byed par gyur to/ /

After having thus seated themselves, those enlightening beings each produced, from the hair pores of their bodies, light rays of the various colors of all jewels, as many as atoms in ten oceans of worlds; in each light ray there appeared as many enlightening beings as there are atoms in ten oceans of worlds, all sitting on lion seats of banks of lotuses. These enlightening beings all could enter into every atom of the oceans of structures in all universes. In each individual atom were vast fields, as many as atoms in ten buddha-worlds; in each field were all the past, present, and future Buddhas. These enlightening beings were all able to go to all these Buddhas, associate with them, and provide them with offerings, and in each and every thought-instant, by means of mastery of dream-power, demonstrated teachings enlightening as many sentient beings as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by the teaching showing how celestial beings die and are born, they enlightened as many sentient beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by explaining the teaching of the acts and practices of enlightening beings, they enlightened as many sentient beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by the teaching of the Buddha’s virtues and mystical displays which stir all lands, they enlightened as many sentient beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by the teaching of beautifying and purifying all buddha-lands, revealing the ocean of all great vows, they enlightened as many sentient beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by the teaching of the Buddha’s voice which contains the languages of all sentient beings, they enlightened as many sentient beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by the teaching which can shower the rain of all Buddha teachings, they enlightened as many sentient beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by the teaching of light illuminating everywhere in the ten directions, pervading the cosmos and showing mystical demonstrations, they enlightened as many beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by the teaching of all Buddhas’ power of liberation manifesting the body of Buddha everywhere, filling the cosmos, they enlightened as many sentient beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds; in every instant, by the teaching of the universally good enlightening being setting up the ocean of all sites of enlightenment with all assemblies of beings, they enlightened as many sentient beings as atoms in an ocean of worlds.

de lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par bkang ste sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par bskul ba byed cing / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dag tu rab tu bdal te zhing re re yang sems kyi skad cig re re la sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi ngan song gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad ni/ rab tu zhi bar byed do/ / sems can phyin ci log la nges pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed ni/ yang dag par nges pa'i phung po rab tu 'god do/ / sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed ni/ dge ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mtho ris su skye ba la rab tu 'god de/ / sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed ni/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la rab tu 'god do/ / sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed ni/ dge ba'i bshes bsnyen bkur ba'i bsod nams kyi tshigs la rab tu 'god do/ / zhing de dag re rer yang sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed ni/ sngon chad ma bskyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye bar byed do/ / zhing de dag re rer yang sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa phyir mi ldog pa yang dag par thob pa la yang dag par skul lo/ / zhing de dag re rer yang sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyan chos thams cad kun nas snang zhing gzigs pa la yongs su sbyangs te rab tu 'god do/ / zhing de dag re rer yang sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed stobs thams cad kyis rab tu gnas pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs zad mi shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam rgya mtsho la rab tu 'god do/ / zhing de dag re rer yang sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi gdung dang rgyud yang dag par 'byung ba'i gnas rgya mtsho rnam par spyod pa la rab tu 'god do/ /

In this way, throughout all universes, adapting to the mentalities of sentient beings, they caused them all to awaken. In every instant they each caused as many sentient beings as atoms in a polar mountain who had fallen into miserable states to be forever relieved of their sufferings; each caused that many sentient beings stuck in wrong concentrations to enter right concentration; each caused that many sentient beings to be born in celestial spheres according to their inclinations; each caused that many sentient beings to rest secure in the states of Buddhas’ disciples or self-enlightened ones; each caused that many sentient beings to serve good teachers and act virtuously; each caused that many sentient beings to set their minds on supreme enlightenment; each caused that many sentient beings to head for the enlightening being’s stage of nonregression; each caused that many sentient beings to attain the eye of pure wisdom and see all things impartially, as does the Buddha; each caused that many sentient beings to abide securely in the powers and the oceans of vows, and to purify the buddha-lands by means of inexhaustible knowledge; each caused that many sentient beings to dwell in the vast ocean of Vairocana’s vows and be born in the family of the Buddhas.
byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi 'od zer gyi sgo thams cad nas kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di lta bu dag byung bar gyur to/ /
At that time the enlightening beings simultaneously raised their voices within the lights and spoke in verse, saying,

'od zer thams cad sgo nas sgra 'byung ste/ / ji snyed byang chub spyod par 'jug pa dang / / rgyal sras yon tan phun sum gang yod pa'i/ / dbyangs kyis phyogs rnams kun tu bkang zhing sgrog /
bskal pa rgya mtshor skye med spyad pa spyod/ / sdug bsngal kun las 'gro ba kun 'grol kyang / / yid la skye med zhum pa gang yang med/ / 'di yi tshul la rgyal sra rab tu zhugs/ /
chos kyi sgo rnams kun la rab spyod cing / / tshul 'dir bskal pa rgya mtsho zad par byed/ / mtha' med dbus med lhag ma gang yang med/ / de dag chos nyid zhi ba rab tu sgrog /
dus gsum rgyal ba'i smon lam gang yod pa/ / rgyal sras de dag 'gro la phan dog tu/ / de dag thams cad ma lus yongs su spyod/ / de dag spyod pa'i rgyan ni 'di 'dra 'o/ /
rgyal ba kun gyi 'khor du nyer phyin te/ / phyogs rnams kun na gzugs brnyan lus 'chang zhing / / rgyal sras ye shes rgya mtsho'i blo gros can/ / de dag chos nyid zhir 'jug 'di 'dra'o/ /
'od zer sgo rnams re rer mtha' pa'i/ / bsam yas zhing rnams de dag rab tu 'jug / spyod pas mig ni kun nas yongs dag ste/ / rgyal sras de dag spyod yul 'di yin no/ /
skra rtse gcig tu de dag rab gnas shing / / zhing rnams dbyings kun kun nas bskyod byas kyang / / sems can rnams la 'jigs pa mi byed do/ / sa 'di rnam dag tshul 'chang dag gi 'o/ /
tshul rnams kun la bsam gyis mi khyab lus/ / de dag kun tu zhing rnams sna tshogs sprul/ / skad cig sems la 'chi 'pho skye ba snang / / rgyan 'di sems la chags med rnams kyi 'o/ /
dus gsum bskal pa gang yong ma lus par/ / skad cig gcig gis thams cad rab tu ston/ / sgyu ma lta bu lus med dngos kyang med/ / de 'dra'i chos nyid chags med blos rtogs so; ;
bzang po'i spyod pa mchog la zhugs pa rnams/ / 'gro ba kun la yid du 'ong ba'i lus/ / rgyal sras de dag chos nyid 'di yin te/ / 'od zer kun gyi sgo nas dbyangs kyang sgrog/

In the light rays wondrous sounds are produced, Pervading all lands in the ten directions, Expounding the virtues of the Buddha’s children, Able to enter the wondrous path of enlightenment.
Cultivating practices for oceans of eons, never wearied, Enabling suffering beings to realize liberation, Spirits never downcast, never worn out: Buddha children can well enter these techniques.
Cultivating appropriate means for oceans of eons, Infinite, boundless, leaving out none, Entering into all the aspects of the teachings, They constantly teach, yet their essence is silent and tranquil.
The vows of the Buddhas of past, present, and future, All have they mastered, all consummated; Then do they thereby benefit all beings As their own pure practical work.
In the congregations of all the Buddhas, Going everywhere throughout the ten directions, All, by the ocean of profound knowledge and wisdom, Enter the Buddha’s way of ultimate peace.
Each of the light rays, boundless, Enters inconceivable lands; The eye of pure knowledge can see it all: This is enlightening beings’ sphere of action.
Enlightening beings can, resting on a single hairtip, Stir all lands in the ten directions Without causing fear in the beings there: This is their stage of pure skill in means.
Infinite bodies in each individual atom Furthermore manifest lands variously arrayed; Instantaneous death and birth, all do they show: Those who’ve attained the unhindered mind.
All ages in the past, present, and future They can show in a single instant; Knowing the body is illusory, without substance or sign Are those who realize the nature of things unimpeded.
They’re all able to enter the supreme practice of the universally good, So all sentient beings like to see them, Buddha children can abide by this teaching, With a great sound roaring within their lights.

de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' mtha' dang dbus med pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la rnam par spyod pas rnam par 'phrul ba thob par bya ba'i phyir smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer chen po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ye shes kyi snang ba phyogs rnam par ston pa'i snying po zhes bya ba rab tu bkye'o/ / 'od zer rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog sgron ma'i sprin du brdal ba/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rab tu snang ba de byung nas tshul thams cad kyi phyogs 'byams klas pa rab tu snang bar byas te phyogs thams cad kyi dbyings rgya mtsho rnams rab tu snang bar byas nas sems can rgya mtsho rnams rab tu snang bar byas te/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad rab tu bstan nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po thams cad rab tu bskyod pa'i rgyan gyi tshul thams cad kyis rab tu bskyod nas sangs rgyas kyi sprin 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad dang mnyam pa dag tu rab tu spros nas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang mos pa ji lta ba rgya mtsho dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i sprin gyi char dus gsum gyi rdul shin tu phra ba dang mnyam pa phab ste/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho rab tu bstan nas sems can thams cad ma lus par 'khor ba thams cad las rab tu gdon par bya ba'i phyir mos pa ji bzhin du 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i sprin gyi char rab tu dbab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi smon lam ma lus pa'i sprin gyi char rab tu dbab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i 'khor dag tu dga' bar phrad par byas nas bcom ldan 'das la g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te

Then the Buddha, wishing to enable all the enlightening beings to realize the spiritual power of the boundless realm of the Enlightened One, emitted a light from between his brows. That light was called Treasury of the Light of Knowledge of All Enlightening Beings Illumining the Ten Directions. Its form was like a cloud of lamps with jewellike light. It shone throughout all buddha-fields in the ten directions, revealing all the lands and beings therein. It also caused all networks of worlds to tremble. In every single atom it revealed innumerable Buddhas showering the teachings of all the Buddhas of all times, in accord with the differences in character and inclination of the various sentient beings. It clearly showed the Buddha’s ocean of transcendent ways, and also rained infinite clouds of various emancipations, causing the sentient beings to forever cross over birth and death. It also showered clouds of the great vows of the Buddhas, and clearly showed, in all worlds in the ten directions, the universally good enlightening beings’ congregations at the sites of enlightenment. Having done all this, the light swirled around the Buddha, circling to the right, then went in under his feet.

bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar pad+mo chen po chu ba rin po che thams cad las bsgrubs pa/ nang rim nor bu'i rgyal po'i mdzod sna tshogs las byas pa/ lo ma rin po che thams cad kyi rigs kyi char 'bebs pa/ ze ba'i phreng ba'i rgyan spos rin po che thams cad las byas pa/ snying po 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi tshon gyis rab tu mdzes par bris pa/ 'od kyi 'khor rnam par dag cing 'od zer gyi dra bas rnam par snang bas byas pa'i sprin dang ldan pa/ rgyan thams cad rab tu 'byung ba/ sems kyi skad cig la sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba mtha' yas pa ston pa'i sgra rab tu 'byung ba/ nor bu'i rgyal po mtha' yas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan gyi sprin gyis thams cad du gang bar byed pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam thams cad rab tu ston pa'i dbyangs 'byin par gyur te byung ngo/ /

Then an immense lotus blossom suddenly appeared before the Buddha. That lotus had ten kinds of adornments, unmatched by any other lotuses. That is to say, its stem was a mixture of various gems; its bud was of diamond; its petals were all the jewels in the universe; its pistils were of fragrant gems; rose gold adorned its base; exquisite nets covered it above; its radiant color was pure; it instantaneously displayed the boundless miracles of the Buddhas; it could produce all kinds of sounds; its diamonds reflected the body of Buddha. In its sounds it could expound all the practical undertakings cultivated by enlightening beings.

pad+mo chen po de byung ba'i rjes la byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la pham pa med pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzod spu de nyid nas byung ba ste bcom ldan 'das la lan du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te pad+mo chen po de'i snying po la 'dug go /byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gya [*gyi?] khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag kyang ze ba'i phreng ba de dag la 'khod do/ /

When this flower had sprung up, in an instant there was, in the curl of white hair on the Buddha’s brow, a great enlightening being named Supreme Sound of All Truths, together with a group of enlightening beings, as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds: they all came forth together and circled the Buddha to the right innumerable times; then, having bowed to the Buddha, Supreme Sound of All Truths sat on the flower dais, while the other enlightening beings sat on the pistils.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la pham pa med pa'i dbyangs chos kyi dbyings rgya che zhing tshad med pas rab tu dga' ba'i shugs shin tu skyes pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul gyi rjes su song ba'i ye shes can/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku rgya mtsho bsam gyis mi khyab pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i mthu dang ldan pa/ zhing 'byams klas pa thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhabs kyi drung du phyin pa dang ba spu thams cad las sprul pa'i sprin zad mi shes pas kun tu khebs par byed pa/ sems kyi skad cig thams cad la dmigs pa thams cad chos kyi dbyings kun tu sgyur ba/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad la dus gsum khyab par byed pa'i spyod yul gyis rnam par spyod pa/ phyogs thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis rlabs 'chang ba/ ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rab tu 'jog cing phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa la rnam par spyod pa/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa thams cad dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi lus dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa mtha' dang dbus med pa la rnam par bltas te de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

This enlightening being Supreme Sound of All Truths comprehended the profound realm of reality, gave rise to great joy, and entered the sphere of action of the Buddha, his knowledge unobstructed. He entered the unfathomable ocean of the Buddha’s reality-body, and went to where the Buddhas were in all lands. In each hair pore of his body he showed mystical powers. In every moment of thought he contemplated the entire cosmos. The Buddhas of the ten directions all bestowed their power on him, causing him to rest in all meditation states, forever seeing the Buddhas’ body of the ocean of qualities of the boundless cosmos, including all meditations and liberations, mystic powers and miraculous displays. Then, in the midst of the assembly, empowered by the Buddha, he looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

sangs rgyas sku ni chos kyi dbyings kyis gsal/ / 'gro ba kun la rgyal ba mngon sum ste/ / ji ltar mos pa'i sems can rgyas bkang nas/ / snying po byang chub de la rgyal ba bzhugs/ /
zhing rnams kun gyi rdul phran mchog snyed kyi/ / rgyal ba spu rtse kun la rab bzhugs te/ / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyis kun nas bskor/ / kun kyang bzang po'i spyod pa mchog ston to/ /
spu gcig rtse la zhing mang rgya mtsho ste/ / byang chub snying por pad+mo'i gdan la bzhugs/ / chos dbyings rgya chen thams cad kun bkang ste/ / spu rnams kun la rnam par 'phrul pa ston/ /
zhing rnams re re dag na rab bzhugs shing / / zhing rnams 'byams klas kun tu rgyas mdzad pas/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa'i sprin gyi rnams/ / kun kyang snying po byang chub drung du 'dod/ /
zhing rnams kun gyi rdul phran mchog snyed kyi/ / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rgya mtsho'i 'od/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi 'khor du nye bar 'dod/ / chos dbyings 'byams klas rtag tu rgyas par 'gengs/ /
zhing rnams thams cad gzugs brnyan rab tu ston/ / chos dbyings rdul rnams ye shes spyod yul can/ / kun kyang bzang po'i spyod la rab tu gnas/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi 'khor du yang dag byung / /
byang chub sems dpa' ye shes mchog yul can/ / sangs rgyas chos sprin nyan cing rab tu mkhas/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi 'khor rnams kun na gnas/ / zhing rnams kun tu bskal pa rgya mtshor spyod/ /
rgya mtsho'i chos la rnam par snang bar spyod/ / de dag rgyal ba'i sa rnams rgya mtsho zhugs/ / sangs rgyas chos rnams gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba/ / de dag smon lam rgya mtshor rab tu 'jug/ /
sangs rgyas yon tan legs pa rgya mtsho dang / / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa de dag shes/ / sangs rgyas chos kyi dbyings rnams kun bkang zhing / / de dag rnam 'phrul rgya chen kun la zhugs/ /
zhing rnams kun gyi rdul phran mang snyed kyi/ / lus kyi sprin ni rtag par rab tu ston/ / sems can kun bkang 'od kyis kun la skyob/ / bsam pa yid bzhin chos kyi char yang 'bebs/ /

The Buddha’s body fills the cosmos, Appearing before all beings everywhere— In all conditions, wherever sensed, reaching everywhere, Yet always on this seat of enlightenment.
In each of the Buddha’s pores Sit Buddhas many as atoms in all lands, Surrounded by masses of enlightening beings Expounding the supreme practice of the universally good.
Buddha, sitting at rest on the enlightenment seat, Displays in one hair oceans of fields; The same is true of every single hair, Thus pervading the cosmos.
He sits in each and every land, Pervading the lands one and all; Enlightening beings from everywhere gather, All coming to the enlightenment scene.
Oceans of enlightening beings with virtues and lights Numerous as atoms in all lands All are in the congregation of the Buddha, Filling the entire cosmos.
In lands numerous as atoms in the cosmos He appears in every congregation; This realm of knowledge of body-distribution Can be established in the practice of universal goodness.
In the congregations of all the Buddhas Enlightening beings of supreme knowledge sit, Each hearing the teaching, conceiving joy, Cultivating themselves in every situation for boundless ages.
Having entered the far-reaching vows of the universally good, Each produces the teachings of the Buddhas, In the ocean of Vairocana’s teachings, They practice and master buddhahood.
What the enlightening being Universally Good is awake to All Buddhas alike praise with joy: Having attained the great mystic powers of the Buddhas, He circulates throughout the whole cosmos.
In all lands, as many as atomic particles, He manifests clouds of bodies, filling them all, Radiating light for beings everywhere, Each raining teachings suited to their minds.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dpal pad+mo rnam par lta ba'i rgyal mtshan gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

At that time there was another great enlightening being in the assembly, named King of Lotus Light Wisdom Contemplating All Supreme Truths, who, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

sangs rgyas ye shes shin tu zab/ / dus rnams kun tu de 'byung ste/ / chos dbyings thugs su chud pas na/ / 'jig rten mgon zhes rab tu brjod/ /
yang dag sangs rgyas chos kyi sku/ / 'dres pa med cing gnas pa med/ / sems can thams cad yid bzhin du/ / gzugs kyi skur yang rab tu mthong / /
chos rnams thams cad mngon sangs rgyas/ / chos rnams kun la rab tu zhugs/ / thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs/ / zhing rnams kun na rnam par mdzes/ /
kha dog bsam gyis mi khyab par/ / sems can thams cad yid bzhin du/ / sems can mchog gi 'od rnams dang / / de bzhin sku yi sprin kyang mthong / /
de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dag las/ / mi zad sangs rgyas sprul ba rnams/ / zhing rnams kun tu rab sgrog cing / / chos kyi rgya mtsho shin tu ston/ /
spu rnams re re kun nas kyang / / phyogs bcur 'od zer dra ba dag / sangs rgyas gsung ni rab 'byin cing / / gdul dka' thams cad rnam par 'dul/ /
sangs rgyas 'od zer sgo rnams nas/ / sgra dbyangs zab mo rtag tu 'byung / / sangs rgyas yon tan rgya mtsho ni/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul lo/ /
sangs rgyas chos kyi 'khor lo dag / mtha' dang dbus med rab tu bskor/ / ye shes zab mo zhes bya ba/ / rgya chen phyogs su rab tu ston/ /
'jig rten khams rnams thams cad du/ / rnam par 'phrul pa gzhan dang gzhan/ / chos kyi dbyings rnams kun bkang zhing / / yang dag sangs rgyas ston pa mdzad/ /
sku rnams re re kun las kyang / / zhing rnams kun gyi rdul mnyam pa/ / sangs rgyas sems can mnyam phyung zhing / / rnam par 'phrul ba rab tu ston; ;

The profound knowledge of the Buddha Enters everywhere in the cosmos: Able to operate in accord with all times, It is a clear guide for the world.
The Buddhas have the same reality-body— It depends on nothing, is without distinction; It causes beings to see Buddha in physical form According to their intellects.
Replete with all knowledge, Buddha knows all things: In all lands, Everything is evident.
Buddha’s bodies, lights, and physical forms Are all inconceivable. Sentient beings who believe He causes to see them according to potential.
In one Buddha-body He produces infinite Buddhas, Thunderous sound pervading all lands Expounding the teaching, the deep ocean of thusness.
In each hair pore Are webs of light pervading all quarters, Intoning the sublime voices of Buddha, Taming the hard to tame.
From the Buddha’s light Issues deep and wondrous sound Extolling the Buddha’s ocean of virtues And the practices of enlightening beings.
Buddha turns the wheel of true teaching, Which is infinite and has no bounds; The truth taught is beyond compare: The shallow cannot fathom it.
In all worlds he manifests, Fulfilling true enlightenment, In each displaying miracles Which fill the whole cosmos.
Each of the Buddha’s bodies Manifests Buddhas equal to the number of beings, In every one of the numberless lands Showing spiritual powers.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos rgya mtsho rnam par snang ba'i blo gros kyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
At that time there was another enlightening being in the assembly, called Light of Wisdom of Joy in the Truth; empowered by the Buddha, he looked over the ten directions and said,

chos kyi dbyings rnams kun khyab par/ / sangs rgyas sku ni rnam par mdzes/ / rgya chen gsung ni rang byung ba/ / zhing rnams rgya mtshor shin tu sgrog /
'jig rten thams cad kun 'jug par/ / 'jig rten mgon po shin tu mdzes/ / 'gro ba kun gyi bsam mkhyen cing / / byin gyi rlabs ni rab tu ston/ /
sangs rgyas 'jig rten kun la mngon/ / sems can thams cad bsam pa bzhin/ / thams cad gzigs pas sangs rgyas kyi/ / rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad mthong / /
mtha' yas 'od mnga' sangs rgyas sprin/ / chos rnams rgya mtsho'i 'brug kyang sgrog / ye shes rnam rgyu'i tshul bzhin du/ / rgyal ba'i sras rnams de la 'jug /
'jug pa rnams la 'byung ba med/ / 'byung ba yod par rnam par bstan/ / gang la sangs rgyas bzhugs pa yi/ / chos rnams 'byung ba nam mkha' bzhin/ /
'pho dang gnas pa mi mnga' ste/ / 'on kyang rgyal ba kun na snang / / sangs rgyas chos kyi dbyings las byung / / de phyir sangs rgyas rab tu brjod/ /
yul na bzhugs med rang bzhin med; ; de la 'byung ba mi mnga' ste/ / sku dang mtshan kyang de bzhin med/ / rgyal ba gzugs brnyan 'dra ba'o/ /
'gro ba kun tu chos kyi sprin/ / bsam pa kun la rab tu byung / / yang dag sangs rgyas rnam kun tu/ / sems can rgya mtsho 'dul ba mdzad/ /
'jig rten khams rnams thams cad kyi/ / snying po byang chub kun na snang / / 'khor gyi rgya mtsho thams cad na/ / zhing rnams kun gyis rnam par mdzes/ /
sangs rgyas kun gyi sku dag la/ / yon tan rgya mtsho zad mi shes/ / sangs rgyas yon tan mtha' yas te/ / de dag yon tan zad pa med/ /

Buddha’s body is always apparent, Filling the entire cosmos, Always intoning far-reaching sound Shaking all lands in all quarters.
Buddha manifests bodily everywhere, Entering into all worlds, Revealing occult spiritual power According to the inclinations of beings.
Buddha appears before all beings In accordance with their minds; What the sentient beings see Is the Buddha’s mystic power.
His radiance has no bounds And his teaching too is infinite; Buddha children can enter and observe According to their knowledge.
The Buddha’s body has no birth Yet can appear to be born. The nature of reality is like space: Therein do the Buddhas dwell.
No abiding, yet no departing: Everywhere the Buddha’s seen; His light reaches everywhere, His fame is heard afar.
No substance, no abode, And no origin that can be found; No signs, no form: What appears is like reflections.
Buddha raises clouds of teachings Suited to beings’ minds; With various forms of expedient means He enlightens them and calms them down.
In all worlds is Buddha seen Sitting on the enlightenment site, Surrounded by a great congregation, Illumining all lands.
The bodies of all Buddhas All have infinite forms; Though their manifestations be innumerable, Their forms are never exhausted.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' spos 'od 'phro ba'i rgyan zla ba'i 'od kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
At that time another great enlightening being in the assembly, named Wisdom like Fragrant Flame Light Illumining Everywhere, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

bsam gyis mi khyab sangs rgyas sar/ / byang chub sems dpa' gang bzhugs pa/ / de dang de dag sangs rgyas kyi/ / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul thams cad mthong / /
ye shes lus kyis zhugs pa rnams/ / zhing kun rdul gyi sbubs su yang / / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / / bdag nyid lus kyang der mthong ngo/ /
gzugs brnyan zhing rnams thams cad dang / / sangs rgyas kun gyi spyan sngar 'byung / / kun tu byin gyi rlabs rnams dang / / rnam par 'phrul pa rab tu ston/ /
kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dang / / spyod pa gang gis rnam sbyangs pa/ / de dag zhing rnams thams cad du/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi rnam 'phrul mthong / /
kun tu mnyam pa nyid gyur cing / / kun tu lus kyis rab gnas te/ / ye shes kun gyi rjes song nas/ / sangs rgyas spyod yul zhugs pa'o/ /
sangs rgyas ye shes zhugs pa'i rnams/ / chos kyi dbyings la rnam par mdzes/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi spu dag tu/ / rgya mtsho'i zhing la rab tu 'jug /
sangs rgyas kun gyi zhing dag tu/ / byin gyi rlabs rnams rab bstan pas/ / gzhan dang gzhan gyi lus dag dang / / ming gis kun ni rab tu gnas/ /
byang chub snying por rnam 'phrul dang / / byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing / / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dag / skad cig sems kyis ston pa byed/ /
zhing rnams 'byams klas thams cad dang / / bskal pa bye ba bsam yas dag / byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag rnams/ / skad cig sems kyis rnam par ston/ /
sangs rgyas zhing rnams thams cad na/ / byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa rnams/ / sangs rgyas sku la rnam spyod kyang / / mtha' ma rnyed par mi rung ngo/ /

The enlightening beings in this assembly Enter the Buddha’s inconceivable state, Each able to see All the Buddha’s spiritual powers.
The body of knowledge can enter The atoms of every land, Perceiving bodies therein, Seeing all the Buddhas.
Like reflections appearing in all worlds Where all the Buddhas are, In each and every one They reveal miraculous deeds.
The practice of vows of Universally Good They have developed, clear and pure; They are able to see in all lands Buddha’s miracles everywhere.
They physically dwell in all places, Equanimous in all; With knowledge capable of such action, They enter the Buddha’s realm.
Having realized enlightened knowledge, They illumine the cosmos equally, Fitting into the Buddha’s pores The oceans of all worlds.
In all buddha-lands They manifest mystic powers, Appearing in various bodies, With various names as well.
They can, in an instant’s time, Show miracles everywhere: Truly awakening at the site of enlightenment And turning the wheel of truth.
All lands, wide and vast, Billions of ages, inconceivable, Can be shown in a moment’s span In the enlightening beings’ concentration.
Each and every enlightening being In all the buddha-lands Is in the Buddha-body, Boundless, without limit.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' seng+ge'i 'od zer snang ba'i mthu 'byin pa'i blo gros kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then another great enlightening being in the assembly, named Lion Stretch Wisdom Light, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad kyis/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu 'khor/ / chos dbyings tshul rnams thams cad kyang / / sangs rgyas sprin gyis mngon du yog /
'jig rten khams rnams rgya mtsho dang / / phyogs bcu kun na gang yod pa/ / thams cad kun tu 'khor lo 'khor/ / de ni smon lam rnam 'phrul ba'o/ /
'khor rnams rgya mtsho rgya che ba/ / gzhan dang gzhan gyi ming dag gis/ / zhing rnams gnas pa kun tu yang / / chos kyi 'khor lo kun tu 'khor/ /
rnam par snang mdzad byin rlabs kyis/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun tu yang / / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dag / rjod cing zhing rnams kun tu 'byung / /
zhing kun rdul la sku yi rnams/ / thams cad chos char rab tu 'bebs/ / 'dres pa med cing 'byung ba med/ / 'jig rten dag na rnam par mdzes/ /
bskal pa bye ba grangs med par/ / zhing kun rdul phran sbubs dag tu; ; rnam par snang ba mdzad pa'i gsung / / sngon gyi spyod pa rab tu sgrog /
zhing rnams thams cad rdul snyed kyi/ / 'od zer dra ba phyogs bcu na/ / sangs rgyas 'od zer kun sgo nas/ / byang chub mchog phyir sems can 'dul/ /
kun tu ma 'dres sku dag gis/ / chos dbyings yongs su rab gsal te/ / 'gro rnams 'dul ba ji bzhin du/ / gzugs kyi skur yang rab tu mthong / /
dus gsum zhing rnams thams cad kyi/ / mgon po ji snyed bzhugs pa rnams/ / de dag kun gyi mtshan kyang sgrog / sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul la ltos/ /
da ltar byung dang 'das pa dang / / sangs rgyas gang rnams ma byon pa/ / de dag kun gyi bsam yas pa/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu grag /

Vairocana Buddha Can turn the wheel of truth In all the lands of the cosmos, Filling it like clouds.
In all the great oceans of worlds In all the ten directions Buddha’s power of mind and will Turns the wheel of truth.
In the vast assemblies of beings In all lands His names are not the same; He expounds the truth according to need.
Buddha’s majestic powers Were made by the vows of universal goodness and wisdom; In all lands That wondrous sound reaches everywhere.
Buddha’s bodies are numerous as atoms in lands, Showering the rain of truth everywhere; Unborn, without distinction, Appearing in all worlds.
What he practiced in the past Over countless billions of eons In all lands, many as atoms, That wondrous sound can fully tell.
Nets of lights pervade All the numberless lands; In the lights are Buddhas Teaching all beings everywhere.
The Buddha-body, without distinction, Fills the cosmos, Able to manifest physical forms, Teaching according to potentials.
Different are the various names Of all the guides In all worlds of all times; They are spoken so all may see.
The cycles of sublime teachings Of all the Buddhas Of past and present All gathered here can hear.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi yon tan gyi mdzod mi zad pa'i dpal gyi gzi brjid mar mes sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then another great enlightening being in the assembly, named Treasury of Qualities of Wisdom of the Ocean of Truth, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

gang gis byang chub sems dpa' yi; ; ye shes tshogs 'di kun non cing / / ye shes rtogs pa rnyed pa rnams/ / de dag 'di yi tshul la zhugs/ /
chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa'i dbyangs/ / zhing rnams kun tu rab tu 'byung / / sangs rgyas kun gyi spyod yul te/ / byang chub sems dpa'i ched du brjod/ /
skad cig re re'i sems kun la; / chos kyi dbyings su rnam par rgyu/ / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing brten/ / chos rnams rgya mtsho kun la zhugs/ /
rgyan gyi pha rol phyin pa rnams/ / bskal pa bye ba bsam yas su/ / sangs rgyas thams cad sku dag tu/ / zhing rnams kun na gnas shing spyod/ /
rdul rnams re re'i steng nas kyang / / chos rnams kun ni rab tu 'byung / / zhing rnams kun kyang khyab par byed/ / ye shes chags med spyod yul lo/ /
sangs rgyas thams cad spyod yul du/ / lus pa med par kun bkang zhing / / rnam par 'phrul ba'i rnam spyod pas/ / sangs rgyas spyod yul rnams la zhugs/ /
sangs rgyas kun gyi rjes snyegs dbyangs/ / chos kyi dbyings ni rab sgrog pa; ; chos dbyings rjes su shes pa rnams/ / dbyangs kyi rgya mtsho rnams la spyod/ /

Buddha children in this assembly Cultivate all knowledge and wisdom; These people can enter Such gates of means.
In each and every land They speak the great sound Telling of the Buddha’s sphere Making it heard through all quarters.
In each mental moment They observe all things Abiding in the state of true thusness; They comprehend the ocean of all phenomena.
In every buddha-body For billions of ages, inconceivable, They practiced ways of transcendence And purified all the lands.
In each atom They can witness all things; Thus without obstruction They go to all lands.
To every buddha-field They go without exception; Seeing the Buddhas’ mystic power, They enter the Buddhas’ realm.
The far-reaching sound of the Buddhas Is heard throughout the cosmos; Enlightening beings can understand, And enter the ocean of sound.

bskal pa rgya mtshor ma 'dres par/ / sgra dang dbyangs rnams shin tu sgrog / dus rnams thams cad shes pas gsal/ / dbyangs kyis de dag sa la zhugs/ /
sgra yi shes la rmongs pa med/ / sems can sgra yang spyod yul te/ / thams cad mkhyen pa kun gyi yang / / rnam par 'phrul ba'i dbyangs shes so/ /

Intoning subtle sounds through the eons, Those sounds equal, without distinction,
* * *
Those with knowledge of sounds Can completely comprehend.
sa nas sar yang phyin gyur cing / / stobs kyi sa la rab gnas te/ / bskal pa bye bar spyad pas na/ / chos nyid 'di la rab tu 'jug /
Reaching stage after stage, Dwelling in the stage of power, They diligently worked for eons, And such is their attainment.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' ye shes kyi 'od zer shes rab kun nas sgron ma'i blo gros kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then another great enlightening being in the assembly, named Universal Light of the Lamp of Wisdom, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

gang la sangs rgyas bzhugs pa yi/ / chos rnams de dag mtshan nyid med/ / ye shes sa ni thob pa rnams/ / 'jig rten gtso bo rab tu mthong / /
shes rab snang ba'i kun 'od can/ / byang chub sems dpa' mnyam bzhag rnams/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kun gyi yang / / sku yi rnam par 'phrul la zhugs/ /
chos kyi dbyings la rnam spyad cing / / lus kyi dngos la rab 'jug ste/ / zab mo'i chos rnams rtogs gyur nas/ / smon lam dag gis yang dag byung / /
bsod nams rgya mtshos byung gyur cing / / ye shes sa la rnam par gnas/ / chos la rnam spyod khong du chud/ / spyod pa'i mchog la rab tu spyod/ /
sangs rgyas zhing rnams thams cad kyi/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi drung dag tu/ / chos kyi dbyings la spyad pas na/ / rang bzhin lus ni rab tu mthong / /
zhing rnams 'byams klas thams cad du/ / bskal pa bye ba bsam yas su/ / thams cad gzigs pa'i chos kyi rnams/ / rgya mtsho kun la rab tu spyod/ /
bdag mthong bas ni lus dang rdul/ / gcig tu 'dres par mngon par byas/ / ma skyes mtshan nyid med pa ste/ / zhing rnams kun tu'ang rnam par mdzes/ /
'jig rten kun gyi bsam mthun par/ / sems can kun la mngon sum du/ / lus kyi sprin ni bstan byas shing / / byang chub don du sems can 'dul/ /
sangs rgyas thams cad mthu yis ni/ / byang chub sems dpar brjod pa ste; ; gang gis mgon po mthong ba yi/ / rgyal ba'i byin rlabs shin tu zab/ /
mgon po ji snyed gang bzhugs pa'i/ / byin rlabs mtha' dang dbus med de/ / chos dbyings rab tu gang byas nas/ / byang chub sems dpa' rnam 'tshang rgya/ /

All the Buddhas Are beyond all forms; Who can understand this truth Sees the Guide of the World.
Enlightening beings in meditation, The light of wisdom illumining all, Can know the independent essence Of all the Buddhas.
Seeing the Buddha’s real body, They awake to the profound truth; Observing everywhere the cosmos, They assume bodies at will.
Born from the sea of blessings, Abiding in the stage of wisdom, They investigate all things And cultivate the supreme path.
In all buddha-lands Where all Buddhas are, Thus throughout the cosmos, They see the real true body.
In immense lands in all quarters, For billions of eons diligently practicing, They are able to roam in true knowledge Of the sea of all phenomena.
There is only one indestructible immanent body Seen in all particles: Unborn, signless, It’s manifest in all lands.
According to the mentalities of beings It appears everywhere before them; Showing various means of training, It turns them to the Buddha-way.
By the spiritual power of the Buddha Are enlightening beings born; Sustained by the strength of the Buddha, They see all enlightened ones.
All the guides With boundless spiritual powers Awaken enlightening beings Throughout the entire cosmos.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' me tog kun nas 'od 'phro gtsug phud rab tu 'phyang bas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then there was another great enlightening being in the assembly, named Flower Flame Topknot with Universally Illumining Knowledge, who, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

zhing rnams kun tu sangs rgyas kyi/ / gsung gi dkyil 'khor sgra 'byin te/ / chos kyi dbyings rnams gang byas nas/ / yon tan sprin ni rab tu brjod/ /
yang dag sangs rgyas chos kyi sku/ / rnam dag nam mkha' 'dra ba ste/ / gzugs kyi sku yang rab ston cing / / chos nyid 'di la shin tu 'jug /
dga' dang mos pa'i shugs rnams dang / / sangs rgyas stobs rnams thams cad la/ / rab tu gnas shing de dag ni/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'jug /
shes rab chung ngus chos 'di dag / kun nas shes par mi nus te/ / ye shes mig ni rab sbyangs shing / / 'di yi tshul la 'jug par 'gyur/ /
rab tu gnas dang byin rlabs dang / / chos kun rnam par spyad pa dang / / rab tu 'jug dang ldan pa yi/ / mnyam pa nyid la rab tu zhugs/ /
chos rnams mtha' yas klong gi rnams/ / chos kun mtshan nyid rnams la ste/ / kun mkhyen nyid la rab zhugs shing / / chos kyi rgya mtsho kun la spyod/ /
sangs rgyas zhing na kun 'khod cing / / thams cad kun na rnam par mdzes/ / 'ong ba med cing 'phos pa med/ / sangs rgyas chos nyid de 'dra'o/ /
gzugs brnyan 'dra ba'i sku rnams ni/ / sems can rgya mtsho'i nang na snang / / mos pa ci 'dra yod pa'i rnams/ / de bzhin mgon po kun gyis mthong / /
kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dang / / spyod pa mang po sus sbyangs pa/ / de dag thams cad ba spu la'ang / / rnam 'phrul gzhan dang gzhan dag mthong / /
lus kyi rnams ni re res kyang / / chos kyi dbyings rnams kun tu khyab/ / 'khor lo kun na 'khor ba ste/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bsam mi khyab/ /

In all lands Uttering subtle sounds Extolling Buddha’s virtues, The cosmos is all filled.
Buddha has reality for his body, Pure as space itself; All the physical forms that appear He includes in this reality.
If anyone has deep faith and joy And is accepted by the Buddhas, Know that such a person Can engender knowledge comprehending Buddha.
Those with little knowledge Cannot know these truths; Those whose wisdom eye is pure Alone are able to see.
By the Buddha’s power They examine all phenomena; As they enter, abide, and leave, All they see is clear.
In all things Boundless are the aspects of teaching; Developing omniscience, One enters the deep ocean of reality.
Abiding in the buddha-land Appearing in all places, No coming and no going: All Buddha’s teachings are thus.
In the ocean of sentient beings The buddha-body appears like a reflection; According to the differences in their understandings Thus do they see the Guide.
In each and every hair pore He manifests mystical powers; The pure ones who practice the vow Of universal wisdom can see.
Buddha, with each of his bodies, Teaches in every place, Pervading the whole cosmos, Beyond the reach of thought.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od zer dang / / gzi brjid mi zad pa'i rgyal po blo gros kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then another great enlightening being in the congregation, named Inexhaustible Light of Majestic Wisdom, empowered by the Buddha, surveyed the ten directions and said,

sangs rgyas sku ni thams cad nas/ / 'od zer sprin mang phyogs rnams bcur/ / kha dog mtha' yas 'bar ba'i 'od/ / sems can bsam pa kun la 'phro/ /
sangs rgyas zhing rnams thams cad kyi/ / snying po byang chub kun na bzhugs/ / bdud rnams thams cad rab btul te/ / 'khor gyi nang na rnam par mdzes/ /
thams cad rdul na'ang ma 'dres par/ / 'od zer dkyil 'khor rgyas par 'gengs/ / phyogs rnams gzhan dang gzhan lam du/ / zhing gi rgyud rnams rab tu ston/ /
zhing gi rnams ni rgya mtsho'i klong / / phyogs kyi rnams kyang kun tu gnon/ / zhing rnams thang chen mnyam zhing dag/ in+d+ra nI lar kun nas gnas/ /
spyi'i tshugs dag dang snrel zhi dang / / pad+mo'i dbyibs dang khyad khyud dang / / dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i khyad par du/ / gzugs rnams kun gyis rab tu gnas/ /
chos kyi dbyings rnams gar phyin par/ / thug pa med par gram brdal ba/ / de dag kun gyi 'khor rnams su/ / shin tu bstan pa'i chos 'byung ngo/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dbyings na/ / 'khod pa'i zhing rnams bsam mi khyab/ / de dag kun tu chos nyid 'di/ / 'jig rten mgon po rnams kyang ston/ /
tha dad med pa'i chos kyi dbyings/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu 'khor/ / gcig gi tshul gyi rnam pa yis/ / chos bstan pa ni kun tu 'byung / /
sangs rgyas gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni/ / tshul rnams thams cad rab tu brjod/ / dad pa rgya mtsho'i tshul dag gis/ / mi zad tshul rnams rab tu bstan/ /
sangs rgyas zhing rnams kun na yang / / rgyal ba rnams ni mig yor 'dra/ / snying po byang chub rnams na snang / / 'byung ba dag kyang yod pa min/ /

In each and every buddha-land Sits Buddha on all enlightenment sites, Surrounded by assembled groups, Conquering the armies of demons.
The Buddha’s body radiates light Filling the ten directions; Appearing in accord with need, In forms that are not the same.
Every single atom Is filled with light; It’s seen in all lands in the ten directions, Variously, different in each.
The countless various lands In the oceans of lands of all quarters All are level and pure, Made of royal sapphires.
Some inverted, some sideways, Some like lotus buds, Some round, some square: They are of various forms.
Traveling unimpeded to all lands Throughout the universe, In all groups of beings Buddha always teaches.
The buddha-body is inconceivable; All lands exist therein: In all places there He guides the worlds, teaching truth.
In the subtle teaching he expounds The essence of things is undifferentiated; Based on the one real truth, He expounds various characteristics of things.
Buddha, with a round, complete sound, Exposes the genuine truth; According to differences in understanding, He manifests infinite teachings.
In all lands we see Buddha sitting on the enlightenment site; Buddha’s body appears like reflections: Its birth or death cannot be found.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings su 'od 'phro ba'i rnam par snang ba 'byung ba'i blo gros kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then another great enlightening being in the assembly, named Wisdom Illumining the Universe, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

blta zhing blta zhing sangs rgyas rnams/ / sku gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / dga' ba rgya mtsho kun kyang 'byung / / chos kyi shugs ni rab tu 'phel/ /
mtshan rab kun nas sangs rgyas rnams/ / phyogs bcu kun tu rab tu 'byung / / rdul rnams kun tu 'jug pa yis/ / sangs rgyas sprin kyang de bzhin bstan/ /
skad cig skad cig sems kun la/ / sangs rgyas 'od ni dpal gyis 'bar/ / rnam 'phrul gzhan dang gzhan dag gis/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun na snang / /
byang chub sems dpa' shes rab che/ / rgya mtsho chos las byung ba rnams/ / sangs rgyas kun gyis byin rlabs pa/ / 'di yi yul la rnam par spyod/ /
kun tu bzang po'i smon lam la/ / gang rnams shin tu gnas gyur pa/ / de dang de rnams zhing dag tu/ / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul kun la lta/ /
ye shes zab mo rnam gnon cing / / chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba ni/ / mos pa rgya mtsho shes pa ste/ / smon lam kun gyis byung ba'o/ /
sangs rgyas kun gyi sku dang gsung / / chags pa med la rab tu zhugs/ / spyod pa gzhan dang gzhan dag gis/ / spyod yul kun kyang khong du chud/ /
sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gnas shing / / ye shes spyod yul gyur pa rnams/ / chos kyi dbyings la rab brtson pa/ / rgyal ba rnams kyi sa gnon to/ /
skad cig sems kyis zhing gi rnams/ / sangs rgyas zhing gi rdul mnyam pa/ / de dag chos nyid ji bzhin du/ / rdul gcig steng du rnam par spyod/ /
zhing rnams ji snyed thams cad na; ; zhing gi rnam 'phrul gang yod pa/ / chos nyid 'di la zhugs pa rnams/ / zhing gcig tu ni sdud pa byed/ /

Inconceivable is the form Of the Buddha’s subtle body; Those who see it rejoice, Respecting and believing the teaching.
All the features of the Buddha’s body Each manifest innumerable Buddhas Entering all worlds everywhere, Into each atom therein.
The infinite, boundless Buddhas Of all oceans of lands Each, in every instant, Display their spiritual powers.
Enlightening beings of great knowledge Enter deeply into the ocean of truth; Sustained by the power of the Buddha, They can know his techniques.
If any be already established In the practical vows of universal goodness and wisdom, They see in all those lands The mystic powers of all Buddhas.
If anyone has certain faith As well as great determination, They’ll have profound wisdom And comprehend all things.
Able to observe All the Buddhas’ bodies, Form and sound unhindered, They’ll understand all realms.
Able to abide in the sphere of knowledge Of all buddha bodies, They’ll plunge into buddhahood Embracing the whole cosmos.
As many as atoms in buddha-lands, This many lands They can cause in an instant To appear in every atom.
All lands And deeds of mystic power All appear in a single land: Such is the power of enlightening beings.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' stobs dang / brtson 'grus chags pa med pa'i blo gros kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then another great enlightening being in the assembly, named Unobstructed Wisdom with Vigorous Power, empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

zhing rnams rgya mtsho thams cad du/ / de dag gsung ni zab mo 'byung / / dbyangs kyi yan lag kun rgyas pa/ / chos kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs so/ /
brjod pa rgya mtsho thams cad kyis/ / sems can kun gyi skad dag tu/ / sangs rgyas zhing rnams kun tu yang / / chos rnams bstan pa rab tu 'byung / /
zhing rnams kun tu ma lus par/ / sangs rgyas rnams par 'phrul mthong zhing / / sangs rgyas gsung rnams thos pa dang / / byang chub mchog phyir kun kyang 'jug /
rdul rnams re re'i steng nas kyang / / chos kyi dbyings kyi phyogs tshul gyis/ / sangs rgyas zhing rnams kun bkang zhing / / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul ston pa byed/ /
chos kyi sku ni tha dad min/ / nam mkha' bzhin te chags pa med; ; gzugs kyi skur ni rnam dmigs pa/ / mig yor snang ba'i mtshan nyid do/ /
mig yor yul la mi gnas te/ / nam mkha' bzhin du dngos po med/ / mnyam pa nyid 'di rtogs gyur nas/ / ye shes rgya mtsho mthong bar 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas sku ni ma skyes te/ / gzung ba med cing 'byung ba med/ / nam mkha' mnyam pa nyid dang mtshungs/ / gzung du med las 'di bstan to/ /
zhing rnams kun gyi sangs rgyas rnams/ / de dag spu gcig rtse la tshogs/ / ye shes mig dang ldan pa yis/ / spu rnams kun tu rnam 'phrul mthong / /
rnam par snang mdzad smon lam ste/ / chos kyi dbyings ni kun bkang zhing / / bla med chos kyi 'khor lo dag / zhing rnams kun na rtag tu 'khor/ /
ji ste bskal pa bsam yas par/ / spu rtse gcig tu rnam sprul pa/ / sangs rgyas kun gyis bshad mdzad kyang / / de yi mtha' ni rnyed par dka'; ;

Buddha speaks one subtle sound Heard throughout the cosmos; Containing all sounds, The rain of truth fills everywhere.
With the ocean of all languages, In all sounds according to type, In all buddha-lands, He expounds the pure teaching.
In all lands are seen The miracles of the Buddha; Hearing the Buddha preach the truth, They head for enlightenment.
In each atom Of all lands in the cosmos Buddha, by the power of liberation, Manifests physically therein.
The reality-body is like space; Unobstructed, without differentiation. Physical forms appear like reflections, Manifesting myriad appearances.
Reflections have no location; Like space, they’ve no substantial nature: Those whose wisdom is great Will comprehend their equality.
The buddha-body is ungraspable; Unborn, uncreated, It appears in accord with beings, Equanimous as empty space.
All Buddhas in the ten directions Enter into a single pore, Each showing mystic powers That the eye of wisdom can see.
The power of Vairocana Buddha’s vows Pervades the entire cosmos, In all lands Always expounding the unexcelled teaching.
The miracles shown in a single hair, Even if told of by all the Buddhas For innumerable eons, Could not be completely defined.

ji ltar gling bzhi pa 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par sprul pa'i snying po byang chub tu phyogs bcu nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'dus par gyur pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i gling bzhi pa thams cad kyi gling bzhi pa re rer yang de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par sprul pa'i snying po byang chub dag tu byang chub sems dpa' phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho byed pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kun nas 'dus par gyur to/ / 'di na ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi snying po byang chub de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par sprul pa dag tu kun nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang chos nyid 'di kho na rab tu ston to// //

As in this world, at the site of enlightenment, by virtue of the Buddha’s spiritual power, there were in each of the ten directions as many enlightening beings as atoms in a billion oceans of worlds who came and gathered, so you should know that in each world of all oceans of worlds the same thing took place at all the enlightenment sites.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo; sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i le'u ste/ gnyis pa'o// //
[3. kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par 'phrul pa rab tu 'byung ba'i le'u]
BOOK THREE. The Meditation of the Enlightening Being Universally Good
bam po bdun pa/

de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can de nyid la 'dug ste/ de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i snying po zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin/ chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par btags pa'i tshogs/ nam mkha'i dbyings chags pa med cing rgya che ba khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin/ chos kyi dbyings rgya mtsho'i klong mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song zhing shin tu brdal ba'i tshogs chos thams cad kyi sgo'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor yang dag par 'byung bas rgyas par 'gengs pa/ phyogs thams cad du yang dag par zhugs pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi lus kyis kun nas yog par byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi snying po can/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i ye shes snang ba rgya mtsho'i klong / phyogs thams cad du sgo kun nas tshul rgya mtsho rnam par rig par bya bas mngon du yang dag par ston pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi stobs dang rnam par thar bas byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi lus rgyas par 'gengs pa'i snying po can/ zhing 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus par chos kyi dbyings su 'jug pas rgyas par 'gengs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su grub par byed pa/ bskal pa thams cad du smon lam rgya mtshos rnam par snang bar byed pa'i 'od can/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo ston cing rjod pa'i byin gyi rlabs la mnyam par bzhag par gyur to/ /

THE ENLIGHTENING BEING Universally Good, the great being, sat on a lion throne made of a bank of lotus flowers, and, imbued with the psychic power of the Enlightened One, entered into concentration. This concentration is called the immanent body of the illuminator of thusness, which is in all enlightened ones. It enters everywhere into the equal essence of all enlightened ones, and is capable of manifesting myriad images in the cosmos, vastly and immensely, without obstruction, equal to space. All the whirling oceans of universes flow along into it; it produces all states of concentration, and can contain all worlds in all directions. The oceans of lights of knowledge of all the enlightened ones come from here; it can reveal all the oceans of all conditions everywhere. It contains within it all the powers and liberations of the enlightened ones and the knowledge of the enlightening beings. It can cause the particles of all lands to be universally able to contain boundless universes. It develops the ocean of virtuous qualities of all Buddhas, and reveals the ocean of great vows of these enlightened ones. All the cycles of teaching of the Buddhas flow through it and are guarded and maintained by it, and kept without interruption or end.

ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi drung du byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i snying po zhes bya ba 'di la mnyam par bzhag pa de bzhin du/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa; phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pa/ dus gsum thams cad na yod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byung ba'i khams chos kyi dbyings rgya chen pos non pa'i rigs su gtogs pa; shin tu phra zhing bsgribs pa med pa dang / phyogs rgya chen po rgya mtsho thams cad snang ba 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i ris su gtogs pas rnam par non pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyis rnam par gzigs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi stobs thogs pa med pas chud pa/ chos kyi dbyings dang sangs rgyas kyi sku thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan rab tu snang bas chos kyi dbyings kyi rdul ma lus pa kun tu gtogs pa/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du rgyas par gang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba dang mnyam pa dag tu rdul phra mo re re la'ang zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la rab tu zhugs nas zhing re re zhing yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la rab tu zhugs te/ de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i zhabs kyi drung du yang lus 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i snying po zhes bya ba 'di la mnyam par bzhag go /byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i snying po zhes bya ba de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i rjes la

As in this world the enlightening being Universally Good entered this concentration in the presence of the World Honored One, thus in the same way throughout the realm of space of the cosmos, in all directions and all times, in a subtle, unhindered, vastly expansive light, in all lands visible to the Buddha’s eye, within reach of the Buddha’s power, manifested by the Buddha’s body, and in each atom of all those lands, there were Buddhas as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, and in front of each Buddha were Universally Good enlightening beings numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, each also entering into this concentration in the immanent body of the illuminator of thusness in enlightened ones.

de'i tshe phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byams klas pa thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhal bstan to/ / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis 'di skad ces kyang bka' stsal to/ / rigs kyi bu/ khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i snying po 'di la mnyam par gzhag pa legs so/ / legs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod la phyog [*phyogs?] bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad kyang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad 'di'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / khyod kyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam dang / spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i yang mthus 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho thams cad kyi rnam par dbye ba dang / chos thams cad kyi tshul gyis phyogs rgya mtsho ma lus par snang bar bya ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / chags pa med par 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad yongs su gnon pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad la chags pa med par 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'khor thams cad sgo kun nas rab tu brjod pa dang / chos kyi tshul gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la zhugs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su gzung ba dang / chos kyi snang ba thams cad kyi tshul rnam par blta ba dang / sems can gyi dbang po rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi yan lag rgya mtsho'i dbyangs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir byin gyis rlob pa mdzad do/ /

At that time each of the Universally Good ones saw the Buddhas of the ten directions appearing before them; those Buddhas praised Universally Good in the same voice: “Good! You are able to enter this enlightening beings’ concentration in the immanent body of the illuminator of thusness in all Buddhas; this is fostered in you by all the Buddhas everywhere together, by means of the power of the original vow of the illuminating realized one Vairocana Buddha, and it is also because you cultivate the power of the practices and vows of all Buddhas: that is to say, because you can activate all the cycles of the enlightening teaching, revealing the ocean of knowledge and wisdom of all enlightened ones, universally illumine all the oceans of distinctions everywhere, without exception, cause sentient beings to clear away confusion and affliction and attain purity, universally accept all lands without attachment, deeply enter the sphere of all enlightened ones without impediment, and universally expound the virtues and qualities of all enlightened ones; because you are able to enter into the true character of all things and develop knowledge and wisdom, analyze all the media of the teachings, comprehend the faculties of all living beings, and because you are able to hold the ocean of written teachings of all the Buddhas.”

de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stobs la rab tu 'jug pa'i ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa la rab tu 'jug pa'i ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad yang dag par 'byung ba'i ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad 'jig pa dang 'du ba'i ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / chos kyi dbyings 'byams klas pa mtha' dang dbus med pa'i ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa zab mo tha mi dad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rnam par gnas pa'i ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbang po rgya mtsho la rab tu 'jug pa'i ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / sems can thams cad kyi skad rgya mtsho dang / chos kyi 'khor lo'i nges pa'i tshig gi ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams mang po thams cad kyi rjes su song zhing chos kyi dbyings thams cad du lus yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi yan lag dang sgra dbyangs kyang nye bar bsgrubs so/ /

At that time all the Buddhas of the ten directions then bestowed on the great enlightening being Universally Good the knowledge that enters into the power inherent in omniscience, the knowledge that enters into the infinity of the cosmos, the knowledge that perfects the realization of the sphere of all enlightened ones, the knowledge of the becoming and decay of all oceans of worlds, the knowledge of the full extent of the worlds of all sentient beings, the knowledge that abides in the extremely profound liberation of all enlightened ones and the nondiscriminating knowledge of all meditation states, the knowledge that enters into the ocean of all faculties of enlightening beings, the knowledge of elocution to turn the wheel of the teaching in the ocean of languages of all sentient beings, the knowledge that enters in all ways into the bodies of all oceans of worlds in the cosmos, and the knowledge that comprehends the voices of all Buddhas.

ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi drung na 'dug pa la nye bar bsgrubs pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyas par bkang ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag dang rdul shin tu phra ba'i khongs na lus 'khod pa thams cad la yang nye bar bsgrubs so/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni/ 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyi chos nyid thob pa'i phyir ro/ /

As in this world in the presence of the Buddha the enlightening being Universally Good experienced the Buddhas bestowing such knowledge, so in all oceans of worlds, as well as in each atom of all those worlds, so did all the enlightening beings Universally Good there experience this. Why? Because they had realized that state of mental focus in this way.

de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis phyag g.yas pa mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos rnam par mdzes par brgyan pa/ 'od zer gyi dra ba'i me tog sna tshogs shin tu rgyas pa/ 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa'i sprin 'gyed pa/ rin po che 'od 'phro ba thams cad kyi sprin gyis rnam par gsal bar gyur pa/ phyogs thams cad du spos 'od 'phro ba'i sprin gyi 'od kyis rnam par snang pa; sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung gi yan lag gi dkyil 'khor gyi rjes su sgra 'byin pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba yang dag par ston pa/ byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu snang ba rnam par ston pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i snang ba yang dag par ston pa/ dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba rnams brkyangs te/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyi bor bzhag go /

Then the Buddhas of the ten directions each extended his right hand and patted Universally Good on the head. Their hands were each adorned with the marks of greatness, being finely webbed, emanating light, fragrance, and flames. They also produced the various wondrous tones of all Buddhas. And within it were manifested the phenomena of mystical powers, the ocean of vows of universal goodness of all enlightening beings of past, present, and future, the cycles of pure teachings of all enlightened ones, as well as the images of the Buddhas of past, present, and future.

'dir ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad dang rdul shin tu phra ba'i khongs na yod pa thams cad du yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung dag tu byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyi bo la phyag rgya mtsho'i sprin rnams rab tu bzhag go/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis reg ma thag tu

As in this world Universally Good was patted on the head by all the Buddhas of the ten directions, so in all the oceans of worlds, and in each atom of those worlds, the enlightening beings Universally Good there were patted on the head by the Buddhas of the ten directions.

de nas de'i mod la ting nge 'dzin de las ldang ba'i sgo rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dus gsum thams cad du sems kyi skad cig re re la ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i ye shes ma 'dres pa la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyi sgo chos kyi dbyings dang / dus gsum du mnyam pa'i rdul thams cad kyi sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi sgo dang / sems can ma lus pa'i gnas thams cad dang mnyam zhing sems can thams cad kyi sems rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i sgo dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus dang ming gi 'khor lo las ldang ba'i sgo dang / phyogs mtshams thams cad du chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo dang / rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi sku'i sprin mtha' dang dbus med par 'byams klas pa'i sgo dang / chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad rab tu bstan pa'i sgo dag nas langs par gyur te/

Then the enlightening being Universally Good arose from this concentration; when he did so, he rose from media of oceans of concentrations numerous as atoms in all oceans of worlds. For example, he rose from the medium of concentration of skillful knowledge realizing that the worlds of past, present, and future have no distinction in the succession of instants; he rose from the medium of concentration of knowledge of all the subtlest and most minute constituents of all universes in all times; he rose from the medium of concentration on the manifestation of all buddha-fields of past, present, and future; he rose from the medium of concentration revealing the dwelling places of all living beings; he rose from the medium of concentration of knowledge of various differences in locations of the universes of the ten directions; he rose from the medium of concentration of knowledge of boundlessly vast clouds of buddha-bodies existing in every atom; he rose from the medium of concentration of explanations of the ocean of inner principles in all things.

byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ting nge 'dzin las langs ma thag tu de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang so sor re zhing ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / gzungs rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / so so yang dag par rig pa'i tshul rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / spyod pa rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / chos kyi dbyings kyi phyogs su rnam par snang zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes snang ba'i yon tan gyi snying po can rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / ye shes ma 'dres pa'i tshul rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ba spu'i rtse mo thams cad la zhing gzhan dang gzhan rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' re re zhing dga' ldan gyi gnas nas 'pho ba dang / 'byung ba dang / byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa rgya mtsho'i sprin 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la'ang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ /

When the enlightening being Universally Good rose from such media of concentration, all the enlightening beings each found oceanic clouds of concentrations, numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds, found oceanic clouds of spells, oceanic clouds of techniques to teach everything, oceanic clouds of ways of felicitous expression, oceanic clouds of practices, oceanic clouds of lights from the knowledge of the treasury of virtues of all who realize thusness, oceanic clouds of nondiscriminating techniques of the powers, knowledges, and wisdom of all enlightened ones, oceanic clouds of Buddhas each manifesting myriad lands in each and every pore, oceanic clouds of enlightening beings one by one manifesting descent from the palace of the Tushita heaven to be born on earth and become an enlightened Buddha, turn the wheel of the teaching, and enter into ultimate extinction, all as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds.

'dir ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad na yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor rgya mtsho rnams dang rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad kyi khongs na yod pa kun tu yang byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho rnams rab tu zhugs par gyur te/ sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi chos nyid rab tu thob pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad ma lus par bag langs pa tsam du g.yos te/ rin po che thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan par gnas shing / chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi sgra yang shin tu grag par gyur te; de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho thams cad du yang nor bu'i rgyal po chen po bcu'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab par gyur te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po mtshan dang ldan pa'i gser dpal gyi rgyal mtshan gyi dpal gyi sprin char mngon par bab bo/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po 'od kyis rnam par gsal bar byed pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po phyogs bcur rin po che'i 'khor lo rab tu 'grem pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan rin po che'i snying po'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po sangs rgya thams cad kyi mtshan gyi 'khor lo rab tu sgrog pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo;
