; 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po zhing rnam par snang bar byed cing snying po byang chub tu dpal rab tu 'bar ba'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po phyogs bcur snang ba'i sprul pa 'gyed pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal pa byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yon tan gyi 'khor lo dang mthu rab tu grag par byed pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po nyi ma'i dpal gyi gzi brjid kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po rol mo'i sgra yid du 'ong bas phyogs thams cad khyab par byed pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po'i sprin gyi char bcu po 'di dag mngon par bab par gyur to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ba spu'i sgo thams cad dang / 'od zer gyi sgo thams cad nas kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag byung bar gyur to/ /

As when in this world the enlightening being Universally Good rose from concentration all the hosts of enlightening beings received such blessings, so in all the oceans of worlds, as well as in each atom of each world, the same thing occurred.
At that time, by the spiritual power of all the Buddhas and the power of Universally Good’s concentration, all oceans of worlds in the ten directions trembled. Each world was arrayed with precious elements and gave forth wondrous sound, explaining all things. And on each Buddha, in the ocean of sites of enlightenment where the masses gathered, everywhere there rained ten kinds of clouds of regal jewels: clouds of beautiful gold star jewels, jewels like precious discs descending, shining light jewels, jewels of the treasury manifesting the images of enlightening beings, jewels extolling the names of Buddhas, jewels of brilliant light illuminating the sites of enlightenment in buddha-fields everywhere, jewels whose light reflects the various miracles everywhere, jewels praising the virtues of all enlightening beings, jewels with a light that shines like the sun, jewels whose delightful music is heard everywhere.
After the universal rain of these ten kinds of clouds of jewels, all the Buddhas emitted lights from their pores, and in the light rays spoke verses:

zhing rnams 'byams klas kun na kun tu bzang po de/ / pad+mo yid du 'ong la rab tu 'dug pa mthong / / kun tu rnam 'phrul rnam pa 'di 'dra ston byed pa/ / ting 'dzin yul la 'jug pa mtha' dang dbus med do/ /
lus rnams thams cad nas kyang kun tu bzang po de/ / sprul pa rab tu 'gyed cing chos dbyings rtag par 'gengs/ / ting 'dzin kun gyi tshul dang ming dang rnam 'phrul ba/ / thams cad dbyangs kyis chags pa byed par rgya che sgrog /
ting 'dzin thams cad gzhan dang gzhan gyi rnam 'phrul gyis/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhabs kyi drung dag tu/ / rgyal ba kun gyi spyod yul yangs pa gang byas te/ / zhing rnams kun tu rnam par 'phrul ba mang po ston/ /
zhing kun rgyal ba kun gyi zhabs drung ji bzhin du/ / de ltar zhing kun shin tu phra ba'i rdul phran la/ / ting 'dzin rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad ma lus ston/ / rnam par snang mdzad smon lam dbyings la rab tu zhugs/ /
kun tu bzang po'i lus ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do/ / thams cad zhing la mi gnas de bzhin nyid la gnas/ / lus kyi sprin ni 'gro ba kun dang mnyam par kun bkye zhing / / sems can kun la bsam pa bzhin du de dag ston/ /
sangs rgyas sku rnams kun la zhing rnams gang yod pa/ / mtha' dang dbus med kun la rab tu zhugs pa rnams/ / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gnas pa dag la bstan/ / rnam par 'phrul pa 'di 'dra dam pa tshad kyang med/ /
'khor rnams rgya mtsho rdul bral mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / tshad med thams cad lus kyi nang du kun chub cing / / dbyangs la zhing mang dra bar rnam 'tshang rgya bstod/ / skad cig sems la bskal pa mang po de bzhin ston/ /
zhing rnams thams cad 'byams klas pa na rnam grags shing / / rnam par 'phrul pa dam pa bstan par rab tu snang / / phyogs rnams kun gyi zhing gi dbyings rnams ma lus spyod/ / kun tu bzang po de la rnam lta kun kyang mthong / /
rgyal ba kun gyi yon tan ye shes stobs la zhugs/ / ting 'dzin sa ni tshul rnams kun gyis rab tu mnan/ / chos rnams 'byams klas gzhan dang gzhan la rab tu zhugs/ / rang gi byang chub spyod pa sngon chad spyad pa ston/ /
de ltar zhing rnams kun tu bsam yas rnam 'phrul ba/ / phyogs rnams rgya che kun tu bkang ste rab tu bstan/ / ting nge 'dzin rnams 'jug pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir/ / rgyal ba'i 'od zer sprin las yon tan legs sgra 'byung / /

Universally Good is present in all lands Sitting on a jeweled lotus throne, beheld by all; He manifests all psychic powers And is able to enter infinite meditations.
The Universally Good always fill the universe With various bodies flowing everywhere, With concentration, psychic power, skill and strength, In a universal voice teaching extensively without hindrance.
In every land, in the presence of all the Buddhas, Various states of concentration revealing psychic powers, Each psychic power pervades everywhere In all lands of the ten directions.
As with the Buddhas of all lands, So it is in all the atoms of the lands as well; The phenomena of concentration and mystic powers Are the will power of the illuminator.
Universally Good physically is like space, Abiding by reality, not a land, According to the heart’s desires of all beings Manifesting all kinds of embodiments, equal to all.
Universally Good, abiding at peace in great determination, Thus attained these infinite spiritual powers, In any lands of all buddha bodies Manifesting his form going there.
All the myriad oceans are boundless: He reproduces his body infinitely and dwells there; All lands of his manifestation are purified, And in an instant are seen many eons.
Universally Good lives peacefully in all lands: The spiritual powers he displays are incomparable; The trembling extending everywhere Causes those who look to be able to see.
The knowledge, virtue, and powers of all Buddhas, Their various great qualities, he has all fulfilled; By the medium of techniques of all meditations He shows his past enlightening acts.
Such independence, inconceivable, Is manifest in the lands of the ten directions To reveal the universal entrance of all meditations; In the clouds of buddha light his praises are sung.

de nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor yod pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi mthus thal mo sbyar te byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la lta zhing dbyangs kyi nga rog cig tu de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then all the hosts of enlightening beings turned to Universally Good, joined their palms and gazed respectfully at Universally Good; imbued with the psychic power of the Enlightened, they sang in praise with the same voice,

rgyal ba thams cad chos las skyes pa ste/ / smon lam kun gyis sangs rgyas rab tu 'byung / / de bzhin nyid mnyam nam mkha'i snying po ste/ / chos kyi sku yis rnam par rab tu mdzes/ /
zhing rnams 'byams klas kun la bzhugs med kyang / / kun tu bzang po'i 'khor rnams kun na snang / / phyogs bcu kun tu yon tan grags pas khyab/ / ye shes rgya mtsho rab tu snang ba mnga'/ /
rgyal ba thams cad sku thob phyir spyod pa/ / phyogs bcu'i yon tan rgya mtsho yod pa rnams/ / rdul sbubs kun tu de dag chud byas shing / / zhing rnams kun tu rnam par rab tu mdzes/ /
zhing rnams kun gyi rgyal ba'i zhabs drung na/ / rgyal sras ting nge 'dzin dang spyad pa dang / / chos rnams kun la spyod cing gnas pa rnams/ / rdul dang mnyam pa'i bskal par kun kyang snang / /
chos kyi dbyings rnams lus kyis khyab byas shing / / zhing rnams 'byams klas kun la shin tu bzhugs/ / sems can rgya mtsho'i don du de spyod cing / / rdul phran kun la chos kyi dbyings su zhugs/ /
chos kyi dbyings la de ltar zhugs nas kyang / / rdul phran kun la mi zad tha mi dad/ / nam mkha'i dbyings ni lus kyis gang byas shing / / rgyal ba'i chos rnams yangs pa rab tu ston/ /
yon tan rgya mtsho 'od kun gzhal du med/ / rnam yangs stobs chen 'od zer yon tan sprin/ / 'gro ba rgya mtsho'i don du spyod byed cing / / rgyal ba'i spyod lam gzhal du med pa ston/ /
gang gi don du bskal pa rgya mtsho dag / mtha' yas par ni bzang po'i spyod spyad pa/ / de dag chos kyi dbyings rnams gang byas nas/ / thams cad chos kyi sprin las rab tu brjod/ /
zhing rnams ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / / stobs bcu rnams kyang ji ltar 'byung 'gyur dang / / sems can rgya mtsho ji ltar 'byung 'gyur ba/ / sems can rnams la sgra dbyangs gtong zhing ston/ /
'khor rnams yangs pa 'di dag thams cad kyang / / kun tu gzang po khyod la mngon sum gnas/ / sangs rgyas kun gyis gnang bar gyur pa yi/ / chos kyi 'khor lo de ring khyod kyis bskor/ /

Born from the teachings of the Enlightened, Also originating from the will power of the Buddha, The womb of space, the equality of real thusness: You have purified this body of reality.
In the congregations of all buddha-fields Universally Good is omnipresent there; The light of the oceans of universal virtue and wisdom Equally illumine everywhere, so all are visible.
The immensely vast oceans of virtues of Universally Good Goes everywhere to approach the enlightened; To the lands within all atoms He can travel and clearly appear there.
O Child of Buddha, we always see you Associating with all the enlightened ones, Abiding in the real state of concentration For eons numerous as atoms in all lands.
The child of Buddha, with an all-pervading body, Can go to the lands in all directions, Liberating all the oceans of living beings, Entering into all the parts of the cosmos.
Entering into all particles of the cosmos, The body is endless and undifferentiated; Omnipresent as space, It expounds the great teaching of the realization of thusness.
The light of all virtue, Immense like clouds, power surpassing, Traveling to all oceans of living beings Expounding the incomparable way practiced by all Buddhas.
Cultivating and learning the supreme practice of universal goodness In order to liberate sentient beings for oceans of eons, Expounding all truths, like a great cloud, The voice is tremendous, none do not hear.
How can the land be established? How do the Buddhas appear? And how about beings? Please explain truthfully the truth as it is.
Here is an infinite ocean of beings All are respectful in the honored presence; Turn for us the pure wheel of the sublime teaching, And all the Buddhas will rejoice with us.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par 'phrul pa rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ste/ le'u gsum pa'o// //
[4. 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa'i phyogs gsal bar bya ba yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i le'u]
BOOK FOUR. The Formation of the Worlds

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la rnam par bltas/ sems can gyi khams rgya mtsho la rnam par ltas/ chos kyi dbyings rgya mtsho la rnam par bltas/ sems can gyi khams rgya mtsho la rnam par bltas/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang dbang po rgya mtsho la rnam par bltas/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi rgya mtsho la rnam par bltas/ dus rgya mtsho la rnam par bltas/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yang dag par 'byung ba'i smon lam rgya mtsho la rnam par bltas/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho la

THEN THE GREAT enlightening being Universally Good, by means of the spiritual power of the Buddha, looked over the oceans of all worlds, the oceans of all sentient beings, the oceans of all Buddhas, the oceans of all elemental realms, the oceans of all sentient beings’ actions, the oceans of all sentient beings’ faculties and inclinations, the oceans of all teaching cycles of all Buddhas, the oceans of all time periods, the oceans of all powers of vows of the Buddhas, and the oceans of all the Buddhas’ miracles.

rnam par bltas nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yod pa thams cad la smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'du zhing 'jig pa yongs su dag pa 'byung ba'i ye shes ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can thams cad kyi las 'byung ba rgya mtsho mkhyen pa ni; bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la rnam par gnas pa'i ye shes ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rgya mtsho thams cad mtha' dang dbus med par bstan pa'i ye shes ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtsho rnam par dgod pa'i ye shes ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bsam pa dang / dad pa dang / dbang po rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i ye shes ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs kyi skad cig gcig la dus thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i ye shes ni; bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho yang dag par bstan pa'i ye shes ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ye shes ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam par dgod pa rab tu bstan pa rgya mtsho ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi sku rab tu bstan pa yongs su dag pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yon tan rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pas rnam par snang ba ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su dag pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa mtha' yas pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od zer rgya mtsho kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin rab tu 'gyed pa mdzad pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi dpal rin po che'i 'od 'phro ba rgya mtsho rnam par rgyu ba ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang dbyangs rgya mtsho rab tu 'grub pa ni; bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan pas sems can rgya mtsho yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang / 'dul ba mdzad pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'dul ba rgya mtsho thams cad la brtson pa don yod pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi sa la rab tu bzhugs pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la 'jug pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo; ; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mthu ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam par rgyu ba ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stobs la thub pa med pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi bsnyengs pa zil gyis mi non pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin la tha mi dad par spyod pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mnga' ba chen po'i ye shes rnam par dag pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos mi 'phrog pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab ste/

Having thus observed and examined all these, he declared to all the enlightening beings in the ocean of congregations at all scenes of enlightenment, “Children of Buddha, the Buddhas’ pure knowledge of the formation and disintegration of all oceans of worlds is inconceivable. Their knowledge of the oceans of actions of all sentient beings is inconceivable. Their knowledge of the oceans of structures of all elemental realms is inconceivable. Their knowledge which can tell of the oceans of all inclinations, understandings, and faculties is inconceivable. Their instantaneous knowledge of all the past, present, and future is inconceivable. Their knowledge revealing the boundless ocean of vows of all enlightened ones is inconceivable. Their knowledge demonstrating the oceans of miracles of all Buddhas is inconceivable. Their knowledge operating the cycles of teaching is inconceivable. Their knowledge of how to construct explanations is inconceivable. Their pure buddha-bodies are inconceivable. Their oceans of boundless forms illumining everywhere are inconceivable. Their marks and subsidiary refinements, all pure, are inconceivable. Their ocean of boundless auras, fully pure, is inconceivable. Their ocean of clouds of light of various colors is inconceivable. Their ocean of extraordinary jewel radiance is inconceivable. Their ocean of perfect languages is inconceivable. Their ocean of powers of magical displays to civilize and develop sentient beings is inconceivable. Their oceans of courageous taming of all sentient beings, letting none go to ruin, is inconceivable. Their abode in the state of buddhahood is inconceivable. Their entry into the realm of realization of thusness is inconceivable. Their protective and sustaining power is inconceivable. Their examination of all spheres of enlightened knowledge is inconceivable. Their spheres of power, which none can overcome, are inconceivable. Their quality of fearlessness, which none can surpass, is inconceivable. Their abiding in undifferentiated concentration is inconceivable. Their miraculous displays are inconceivable. Their pure independent knowledge is inconceivable. All the enlightening teachings, which none can destroy, are inconceivable.

de dag thams cad sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs pas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rgya mtsho la gzud pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho la rab tu 'god pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / bskal pa rgya mtsho thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung rjes su bsab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad du chos kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu brjod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dad pa rgya mtsho tha dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu bstan pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po rgya mtsho la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul kun tu snang ba yang dag par bskyed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rgya mtsho'i sgrib pa'i ri thams cad rnam par gzhom pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa rgya mtsho la 'byung ba'i lam rnam par sbyang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rgya mtsho la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir yang dag par bstan par bya'o/ /

“All these things I shall, with the power of the Buddha and of all enlightened ones, fully expound, to cause all sentient beings to enter the ocean of knowledge and wisdom of the Buddha, to cause all enlightening beings to abide securely in the ocean of virtues of the Buddha, to cause all oceans of worlds to be adorned by the freedom of the Buddhas, to cause the lineage of the enlightened ones to continue unbroken throughout all ages, to cause the real true nature of all things to be pointed out in all oceans of worlds, to cause all sentient beings to be taught in accordance with their understandings, to cause the expedient methods according to the ocean of all beings’ faculties to induce them to engender the qualities of buddhahood, to cause the mountains of all obstructions to be smashed, according to the inclinations of all beings, to cause all sentient beings to purify and master the essential ways of emancipation in accordance with their mentalities, and to cause all enlightening beings to abide in the ocean of vows of universal goodness and wisdom.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho rnams de bas kyang shin tu dga' bar bya ba dang / chos la dga' ba'i shugs thams cad rnam par 'phel bar bya ba dang / mos pa'i tshul yangs pa rgya mtsho yang dag par 'byung bar bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang / snying po sgo kun dang ldan pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam rgya mtsho la rab tu dgod par bya ba dang / ye shes kyi mig dus gsum gyi rjes su song ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad kun nas snang bar byed pa'i snying po shes rab chen po'i rgya mtsho rnam par 'phel bar bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo thams cad yongs su gzung ba'i gzungs kyi stobs yang dag par bskyed pa dang / snying po byang chub thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad rab tu brjod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi tshul snang ba'i 'od chos kyi dbyings rgya chen po dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dga' ba'i shugs rgya mtsho rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Now the enlightening being Universally Good, because he wished to gladden the innumerable beings at the site of enlightenment, to increase their appreciation of all truths, to cause them to conceive an ocean of great true faith and resolve, to cause them to purify the all-sided cosmic matrix body, to cause them to establish the ocean of vows of the Universally Good, to cause them to purify the eye of equanimous knowledge, which enters equally into past, present, and future, to cause them to increase the ocean of great wisdom illumining the repository of all worlds, to cause them to develop memory power to hold all the teaching cycles, to cause the whole realm of buddhahood to be manifested in all enlightenment sites, to cause all the Buddha teachings to be brought forth, to increase the nature of vast, profound all-knowledge of the cosmos, he spoke these verses:

yon tan rgya mtsho rnams kyi ye shes zab/ / mtha' dang dbus med des ni zhing rnams khyab/ / sems can bsam la sbyor ba ji bzhin snang / / rnam par snang mdzad chos kyi 'khor lo'o/ /
bsam gyis mi khyab rgya mtsho'i zhing yod pa/ / bskal pa rgya mtshor rgyal bas rnam sbyangs pas/ / sems can rgya mtsho yongs su smin bya'i phyir/ / sems can nang na rgyal ba rnam par mdzes/ /
sems can rgya mtsho 'byung ba bsam mi khyab/ / sangs rgyas yul la 'jug pa shin tu zab/ / srid pa'i gnas cad dad pa chung ba yis/ / sangs rgyas byang chub shes par mi nus so/ /
gzhan du gang rnams shin tu sems brtan cing / / dge ba'i bshes kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / / sangs rgyas kun gyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag / sangs rgyas ye shes 'di la rab tu 'jug /
gang rnams sems dag g.yo med sgyu med cing / / snying rje'i bsam can khong nas byams dga' dang / dad pa che zhing rlabs chen de dag ni/ / 'di dag thos shing dga' ba thob par 'gyur/ /
kun tu bzang po'i smon lam sa dag dang / / chos dbyings nam mkha'i dbyings su khyab pa la/ / gnas shing spyod pa rab tu sus spyod pa/ / de dag rgyal ba'i spyod yul 'di shes so/ /
gang gis rgyal ba'i rnam 'phrul 'di mthong ba'i/ / byang chub sems dpas thob bya legs par thob/ / gzhan gyi yul gyis shes par mi nus te/ / 'di ni kun tu bzang pos rtogs pa'o/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis byin brlabs shing / / 'gro ba mtha' dang dbus med 'di dag na/ / kun tu chos kyi 'khor lo rab 'khor ba/ / rnam par snang mdzad yul dang mthu yin no/ /
bdag gi lus su zhing rnams thams cad kyang / / rab tu zhugs shing de zhugs shing rnams kun/ / de dag spu rtse kun tu blta bar gyis/ / rgyal ba'i spyod yul shin tu bshad par bya/ /
kun tu bzang po'i smon lam spyod pa rnams/ / mtha' dang dbus med mngon par sgrub pa dang / / kun tu mig gi yul dang lus ldan pa/ / de dag mgon po'i spyod yul 'di nyan to/ /

The exceedingly profound ocean of virtues of wisdom Appears in innumerable lands throughout the ten directions, Its light shining everywhere, turning the wheel of the teaching In accord with what the various sentient beings need to see.
The ocean of lands of the ten directions is inconceivable: Buddha has purified them all, over immeasurable eons; In order to edify beings and cause them to mature He appears in all lands.
The Buddha’s realm is most profound, inconceivable; He shows it to all beings, letting them enter: But their minds like the petty and are attached to existents, So they cannot understand what the Buddha has realized.
If any have pure faith and unshakable minds And are always able to associate with good teachers, All the Buddhas will give their power So they can enter enlightened knowledge.
Beyond flattery and deception, hearts pure, Always gladly kind and compassionate, of joyful natures, Determination broad and great, faith profound: Such people, hearing this teaching, are glad.
Dwelling on the ground of universally good vows, Cultivating the pure ways of enlightening beings, Regarding the cosmos like space: These people can know the Buddha’s sphere.
Such enlightening beings gain true benefit Seeing the Buddha’s mystical powers; None who practice other paths can know: Only those of universally good practice can understand.
Sentient beings are infinite Yet Buddha guards them all in his thoughts; Teaching the truth, reaching all: The power of Vairocana’s realm.
All lands are in my body And so are the Buddhas living there; Watch my pores, And I will show you the Buddha’s realm.
The practice and vows of Universally Good are boundless; I have already fully cultivated them. The vast body of the realm of the universal eye Is the Buddha’s sphere: listen clearly.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /bcu po 'di dag ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyis gsungs so/ /gsung ngo/ /gsung bar 'gyur ro/ / bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi rgyu rkyen shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gnas pa shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i dbyibs dang rnam pa shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i lhun shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho yongs su dag par bya ba'i tshul shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag tu sangs rgyas 'byung ba shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i bskal ba'i byin gyi rlabs shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ bskal pa mtha' yas pa'i rgyud rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho tha mi dad pa shin tu bstan pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu po 'di dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyis gsungs so/ /gsung ngo/ /gsung bar 'gyur ro/ /

Then the great enlightening being Universally Good said to the great masses, “O Children of Buddha, there are ten things about the world oceans which the Buddhas of past, present, and future have explained, do explain, and will explain. What are these ten? They are the causes and conditions of the origination of the world oceans, the bases of the world oceans, the forms of the world oceans, the substances and natures of the world oceans, the adornments of the world oceans, the purity of the world oceans, the appearance of Buddhas in the world oceans, the eons of subsistence of the world oceans, the differences in changes over the ages of the world oceans, and the aspects of the world oceans that have no differences. If expressed in brief there are these ten things, but if they are fully expounded, there are as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds, which the Buddhas of past, present, and future have, do, and will explain.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad ni/ rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs pa'i sgo 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed phrag bcus byung ngo/ /byung ngo/ /'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang chos nyid rab tu thob pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las kyi tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par sgrub pa'i chos nyid dang / sems can rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' dag dang / bsod nams kyi rtsa ba skal ba mthun pa bsags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i smon lam gyi khyad par dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pas rnam par bsgrubs pa'i smon lam gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i dbang rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten las 'das pa dang rgyu mthun pas mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba khyu mchog gi mthu dbyung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po rnams kyi smon lam gyis rnam par 'phrul ba'i sgo'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de ltar rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs pa'i sgo bcu po 'di dag la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad byung ngo/ /byung ngo/ /'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /

“Children of Buddha, if explained in brief, there are ten kinds of causes and conditions by which all oceans of worlds have been formed, are formed, and will be formed. What are the ten? They are: because of the Buddhas’ mystical powers, because they must be so by natural law, because of the acts of all sentient beings, because of what is realized by all enlightening beings developing omniscience, because of the roots of goodness accumulated by both enlightening beings and all sentient beings, because of the power of the vows of enlightening beings purifying lands, because enlightening beings have accomplished practical undertakings without regressing, because of the enlightening beings’ freedom of pure resolve, because of the independent power flowing from the roots of goodness of all enlightened ones and the moment of enlightenment of all Buddhas, and because of the independent power of the vows of the Universally Good. This is a summary explanation of ten kinds of causes; if I were to explain in full, there are as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i 'byung ba shin tu bstan pa 'di nyid gsal bar brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Universally Good, in order to reiterate the meaning of what he had said, receiving the power of the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

sangs rgyas ye shes yul ni bsam yas pas/ / byin rlabs rnam 'phrul de dag 'di lta bu/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho bstan pa mtha' dbus med/ / rnam par snang mdzad chos kyis yongs su sbyangs/ /
byang chub sems dpa' kun gyis bsam pa bzhin/ / smon lam rgya mtsho bsam yas rnam sbyangs shing / / sems can las rnams rgya mtsho bsam yas pas/ / phyogs kun shing rnams rgya mtsho thams cad 'byung / /
byang chub sems dpa' kun gyi rnam 'phrul dang / / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa'i sgos/ / smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad mngon bsgrubs shing / / nam mkha'i dbyings la 'byams klas zhing 'byung ngo/ /
spyod pa rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med rnams/ / spyod cing tshad med bde gshegs yul la 'jug / phyogs kyi zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun spyod zhing / / bskal pa mtha' yas zhing rnams re rer spyod/ /
sems can bsam dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i/ / las kyi zhing rnams rgya mtsho thams cad byung / / nyon mongs las kyis de dag nyon mongs bcas/ / mos dang bsam pas rnam pa sna tshogs gzugs/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho rnam dag rgyan can rnams/ / rin chen rgyus byung sna tshogs dri med pa/ / dad pa rgya mtsho rnam par spel ba'i phyir/ / rgyal sras rnams ni phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams sbyong / /
chos dbyings rdul gyi khongs su rgyal sras rnams/ / kun tu bzang po'i spyad pa spyod pa dag / rdul gyi khongs su mtha' yas zhing ston te/ / rnam dag mkha' bzhin mtha' dang dbus kyang med/ /
nam mkha'i dbyings 'dra'i rnam 'phrul 'di 'dra ste/ / snying po byang chub rgyal ba'i zhabs drung na/ / pad+mo'i stan 'khod kha dog mtha' yas kun/ / de dag zhing bcas lus kyi nang na 'khod/ /
skad cig sems kyis dus gsum byung ba yi/ / zhing 'byung tshul dang 'jug pa kun kyang ston/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyi dus gsum zhing bstan pa/ / rnam par snang mdzad rgya mtsho'i zhing mi zad/ /

The boundless ocean of myriad lands explained Vairocana Buddha has all beautifully purified. The World Honored One’s realm is inconceivable; Such are his knowledge, wisdom, and mystic powers.
Enlightening beings cultivate the practice of oceans of vows, Universally adapting to the inclinations of sentient beings. The mentalities of sentient beings are boundless; The enlightening beings’ lands extend throughout all ten directions.
Enlightening beings aim for omniscience, Diligently cultivating various spiritual powers, Generating oceans of infinite vows, Developing vast, expansive lands.
Cultivating oceans of practices, without bound, They enter the realm of buddhahood, also infinite; In order to purify the lands in the ten directions, They spend countless eons in each land.
Sentient beings are muddled by afflictions, Their conceptions and inclinations are not the same; According to their mental states they perform inconceivably many acts, Thereby forming the oceans of all lands.
The treasury of adornments of the lands of Buddha-children Is made of jewels of undefiled light; This depends on a mind of vast resolute faith. Their dwelling places in all quarters are all like this.
Enlightening beings can cultivate the universally good practice, Traveling paths as numerous as atomic particles in the cosmos, In each atom revealing countless lands Pure and vast as space.
They manifest mystic powers equal in extent to space And go to enlightenment sites where the Buddhas are; Upon their lotus seats they reveal many forms, In each and every body containing all lands.
In a single instant they reveal past, present, and future, Where all oceans of lands are formed. Buddha, by appropriate techniques, enters them all: This is what Vairocana has purified.
tshul gyi khyad par mtha' yas sna tshogs pas/ / rdul rnams kun la mtha' yas rgyan gyis rnams/ / sangs rgyas skad cig gcig la byin gyis rlob/ / rgyan gyi rnam pa tshul kun rab tu mkhyen/ /

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la gnas pa shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rgyan thams cad kyi rgya mtsho kun la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi gnas la rab tu gnas so; ; 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog gi mdog la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ sgyu ma lta bu'i las kyis byung pa lha ma yin dang mthu bo che lta bu'i lag na rdo rje rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyi lus kyi gzugs brnyan rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lus rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyis byung ba'i rgyan rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas te/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rab tu gnas ba shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do/ /

Then the enlightening being Universally Good said to the congregation, “O Children of Buddha, each of the oceans of worlds has bases of support as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds. That is to say, they may rest on all adornments, or in space, or on the lights of all jewels, or on the lights of all Buddhas, or on the lights of the colors of all jewels, or on the voices of all Buddhas, or on illusory actions, or on thunderbolt bearers in the form of powerful titans, or on the bodies of all the leaders of the worlds, or on the bodies of all enlightening beings, or on the ocean of all different embellishments produced by the power of the vows of the universally good enlightening beings. The oceans of worlds have such bases as these, as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rab tu gnas pa shin tu bstan pa'i don 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyi sangs rgyas kyi mthus de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, in order to reiterate the meaning of this, Universally Good, receiving the power of the Buddha, surveyed the ten directions and said in verse,

kun kyang zhing rnams rgya mtsho 'di dag rin chen rang bzhin dri med pa/ / rnam dag sna tshogs nor bu kun 'bar 'od zer rgya mtsho'i 'od ldan ltos/ / 'di dag rgyal ba'i byin rlabs rgyu yis dbyibs legs 'khor bar rnam pa snang / / de dag gis ni phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i dbyings rnams gzhi kun rab tu khyab/ /

All the various lands there are Filling space in the ten directions Sustained by Buddha’s mystic power Appear in all places, so all can see.
There are some varieties of lands All made of undefiled jewels, Pure gems, the most exquisite, Radiating everywhere oceans of light.

zhing rnams rgya mtsho la la dri med 'od can nam mkha'i dbyings la gnas/ / snang ba'i snying po 'od can nor bu'i rgya mtsho dag la legs par gnas/ / 'gro ba de dbus rgyal ba 'khor la chos kyi 'khor lo bzang po bskor/ / 'di ni sangs rgyas yul yin sems can rgya chen shin tu mgu byed pa'o/ /

Then there are lands of pure light Which rest in the realm of space; Some are in oceans of jewels, Some rest in mines of light.
Buddha, in the midst of this ocean of groups, Expounds teachings, all skillful and subtle; The realm of the Buddhas is boundlessly vast: Beings who see it are gladdened at heart.

la la me tog sgron ma kun tu rgyas pa'i mu tig nor bus brgyan/ / 'od zer dra ba'i kun nas sprin 'bar spos 'phro sprin gyi 'od can te/ / zhing mang mtha' dang dbus med rgya chen pad+mo'i rgya mtsho dag la gnas/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab brgyan zhing rnams 'byams klas kun kyang rab tu mdzes/ /

Some are embellished with precious stones Shaped like flower lamps in vast arrays, Their clouds of fragrant flame-light blazing with color, Covered with webs of jewel lights.
Some lands have no boundaries; They rest in the deep, immense lotus sea, Broad, pure, unique among worlds, Because they’re adorned by Buddhas’ goodness.

zhing rnams rgya mtsho dkyil 'khor dbyings rnams la la sangs rgyas byin la gnas/ / yangs shing rin chen mang ldan rgya che de dag byang chub sems dpas gang / / lag na rdo rje rgya mtsho mang tshogs lha dbang lus la de bzhin gnas/ / de nas bcom ldan rnam par snang ba mdzad kyi 'khor lo rtag tu 'khor/ /

Some world-oceans revolve, Stabilized by Buddha’s power; Enlightening beings are everywhere there, Always seeing immeasurably vast treasures.
Some rest in thunderbolt hands, Some on celestial leaders’ bodies; The supremely honored Vairocana Is always here actively teaching.

nor bu'i shing dang spos kyi 'od 'phro'i sprin rnams mnyam pa'i dbyings la gnas/ / chu yi phung po dag dang rdo rje rgya mtsho brtan la'ang de bzhin gnas/ / la la gos dang brag dang rgyal mtshan me tog sna tshogs rgya mtsho dag la gnas/ / kun na'ang rnam 'phrul 'di dag rgya chen rnam par snang mdzad ston pa mdzad/ /

Some rest evenly on jewel trees, Or likewise on clouds of fragrant flames; Some rest on great bodies of water, Some in the ocean of indestructible diamond.
Some rest on thunderbolt banners, Some are in flower seas; Vast mystic powers all-pervading, Vairocana here can appear.

zhing rnams ring dang thung dang glang gi gzugs dang rnam pa sna tshogs te; ; sna tshogs rgyan can snying po dri ma bral ba yongs dag dri med snang / / rnam pa sna tshogs de dag smon lam rgya mtsho'i dbyings la rab tu gnas/ / sangs rgyas sprin gyis kun nas yog par rtag tu nam mkha'i dbyings la gnas/ /

Some long, some short, there are innumerable kinds; Different too are the rings they form. Their stores of beautiful adornments are extraordinary: Only the purified and cultivated can see.
Thus each of them are different, But all rest on the ocean of vows. Some lands are always in space, With Buddhas like clouds filling them.

zhing rnams rgya mtsho 'byams klas la la spyi'u tshugs yod dang med la gnas/ / byang chub sems dpa'i cod pa na rin chen 'khor los bzung bas dag par gnas/ / de nas sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul rgya chen thams cad kun nas rab tu snang / / rin chen sangs rgyas gsung rnams kun tu gtong ldan las kyis de dag sprul/ /

Some hang upside-down in space, Sometimes existing, sometimes not; Some lands are extremely pure, Resting in enlightening beings’ precious crowns.
The great spiritual powers of the Buddhas everywhere All are seen herein; The voices of the Buddhas fill them all, Produced by the power of deeds.

chos kyi dbyings mnyam zhing rnams 'byams klas mig yor sgyu ma dang yang 'dra/ / mig 'phrul rnam phye rnams dag dri med sems kyis shin tu bskyed pa ste/ / nam mkha'i dbyings rnams sna tshogs rgyan gyi snying po gnas 'gyur 'di la snang / / las kyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab 'di dag bde bar gshegs pas bstan/ /

Some lands fill the universe, Pure, undefiled, arising from mind, Like reflections, illusions, boundlessly vast, Each different, like in Indra’s net.
Some show stores of various adornments Set up in empty space. Realms of actions are inconceivable: Buddha’s power reveals them for all to see.

skad cig sems kyis zhing rnams 'byams klas 'gro ba kun dang mnyam pa'i rnams/ / zhing rdul kun la kun tu bzang po rtag par rab tu sgrub byed cing / / de na bskal pa rgya mtshor 'gro ba smin par bya phyir spyad pa spyod/ / chos dbyings rgyas par bkang ste de dag kun tu rnam 'phrul rgya che ston/ /

Inside the particles of each land Constantly revealing the Buddha-lands, Their numbers infinite, equal to beings: Such is the action of the Universally Good.
In order to fully develop beings He cultivated practice here for infinite eons, Producing great miraculous displays Extending everywhere through the cosmos.

rdul rnams kun na chos dbyings yangs pa'i zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun kyang gnas/ / sangs rgyas sprin gyis byin gyis brlabs pas kun kyang yog cing yongs su rgyas/ / ji ltar rdul phran gcig la rnam sprul de bzhin 'gro ba kun na'o/ / rnam par snang ba'i sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul rgya chen rab tu ston pa mdzad/ /

In each atom of the lands of the cosmos Rest the vast oceans of worlds; Clouds of Buddhas equally cover them all, Filling every place.
Like the free action in one atom So it is in all atoms; All the great occult powers of Buddhas and enlightening beings Vairocana can cause to appear.

zhing rnams 'byams klas thams cad mig yor lta bu sgyu ma smig rgyu 'dra/ / snang ba med cing 'byung med phyogs bcu dag ni 'gro dang 'ong ba med/ / mkha' la gnas pa de dag rtag par 'byung zhing 'jig par de bzhin 'gyur/ / shin tu yangs pa de dag smon lam rnam sbyangs las kyis yongs su bzung / /

All the vast lands Are like reflections, illusions, or flames: Nowhere is their origin seen, Nor where they go or whence they came.
Disintegration and formation recur in cycles Without pause, in the midst of space; All depends on pure vows Sustained by the vast power of action.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rnams kyi dbyibs ni/ rnam pa sna tshogs te/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ kun nas zlum po'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ kun nas gru bzhi'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni; nam mkha'i rnam pa du mar rnam par phye ba'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ kun nas 'khyil pa'i dbyibs su 'dug go/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ 'od 'phro ba'i ri'i dbyibs su 'dug go /'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ shing sna tshogs kyi lhun gyi dbyibs su 'dug go / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ me tog sna tshogs kyi dbyibs su 'dug go /'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ khyim sna tshogs kyi dbyibs su 'dug go /'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ sems can sna tshogs kyi lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug go /'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni; mtshan sna tshogs kyi dbyibs su 'dug ste/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dbyibs shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do; ;

Then the enlightening being Universally Good said further to the great congregation, “Children of Buddha, the oceans of worlds have various different forms and characteristics. That is to say, some are round, some square, some neither round nor square. There are infinite distinctions. Some are shaped like whirlpools, some like mountains of flames, some like trees, some like flowers, some like palaces, some like living creatures, some like Buddhas. There are as many forms such as these as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i dbyibs kyi tshul rgya mtsho 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to review this point, Universally Good, imbued with the power of the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

rnam pa sna tshogs rgya mtsho'i zhing la ltos/ / rnam phye sna tshogs mtha' yas dbyibs su gnas/ / dbyibs kyis rnam par phye ba sna tshogs te/ / phyogs rnams kun na zhing rnams rgya mtsho snang / /
la la zlum po la la zur gsum ste/ / de dag la la phyogs na gru bzhir gnas/ / nor bu pad+mo 'khor lo yan lag brgyad/ / kun kyang las rnams rgya mtshos rnam par bris/ /
rdul med 'od kyi dbyibs dang tshul 'dzin cing / / gser las grub pa rnam phye sna tshogs te/ / sgo mang mtha' yas pa nas rgyu zhing 'jug / las rnams rgya mtsho bsam pa dag pas gnas/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho sna tshogs snying po can/ / nam mkha' 'di la ji ltar sprin gnas bzhin/ / de dag rin chen mang gzhi rnam par phye/ / de dag kun na sangs rgyas rnam par mdzes/ /
zhing rnams 'di kun sems kyis rnam par brtags/ / sna tshogs rgyan dang snang bas kun na gnas/ / rnam par 'phrul pa gzhan dang gzhan dag gis/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho sangs rgyas ston pa mdzad/ /
bde dang sdug bsngal myong bar gyur pa ni/ / rnam par dag dang nyon mongs tshul bzhin te; ; chos nyid 'di ni rtag tu yod pa yin/ / de ltar las rnams rgya mtsho bsam mi khyab/ /
skra gcig rtse la bsam gyis mi khyab zhing / / thams cad rdul snyed sna tshogs dbyibs su gnas/ / kun na sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs/ / 'khor rnams rgya mtsho chos rnams rab tu ston/ /
rdul gcig rtse la phra dang yangs pa'i rnams; ; thams cad rdul snyed kha dog kun dang ldan/ / kha dog dbyibs rnams kun kyang rnam par brtags/ / de dag kun na rgyal ba'i 'khor lo 'khor/ /
rdul rnams kun la rab tu zhing bstan pa/ / de dag smon lam rnam par sprul pa yin/ / nam mkha'i dbyings su las kyi sprul pa ni/ / sna tshogs sems dang bsam pas rnam par brtags/ /
sems can kun mnyam rdul rnams thams cad la; ; sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul pa sprul pa dag / rnam par snang mdzad chos nyid de yin te/ / rdul phran kun la zhing rnams shin tu gnas/ /

The oceans of lands are variously different: Various adornments, various supports; Different forms, all beautiful, pervade the ten directions: You should together all observe them.
Some are round, some are square, Some triangular, some octagonal; Gemstone-wheel shaped, lotus blossoms, and so on: All are different, according to deeds.
Some have arrays of pure flames, Mixed with gold, most rarely fine, All doors open, with no resistance: This is from deeds broadminded and pure.
The store of boundless differences of the oceans of worlds Is like clouds draped in the sky, Jewel discs spread on the ground in wonderful arrays, The lights of the Buddhas shining therein.
All lands, distinctions of mind, Appear reflected in various lights; In these oceans of worlds Buddhas each manifest mystical powers.
Some lands are dirty, some are pure; Pleasant or painful, each is different. This comes from the inconceivable ocean of acts: Cyclic phenomena are always like this.
Inside a single hair pore, inconceivable lands With various bases, many as atoms: In each of them a universal illuminator Expounds the truth in the midst of the crowd.
In a single atom, great and small lands, Variously different, as numerous as atoms; Level, high and low, each is different: Buddha goes to all to operate the teaching.
The lands manifested in a single atom Are all the occult power of the original vow: According to the various differences in inclination of mind All can be made, in the midst of space.
In all atoms of all lands Buddha enters, each and every one, Producing miracle displays for sentient beings: Such is the way of Vairocana.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i lhun dag ni/ gzhan dang gzhan du shes par bya ste/ 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che gcig las rnam pa sna tshogs su bkod pa'i rgyan gyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ 'od kha dog sna tshogs kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rgyan thams cad kyi mdog gi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni; rdo rje'i gzhi mi shigs pa'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul dang byin gyi rlabs kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni; rin po che'i mtshan nyid kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ nyi ma'i nor bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che shin tu phra ba 'dzin pa'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ snang ba'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ /rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog 'od 'phro ba'i rnam pa'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ /dri dang kha dog sna tshogs kyi spos kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi me tog gi cod pan gyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi 'od kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rgyan thams cad shin tu bstan pa'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ sems kyi rnam par rtog pa skad cig gis dmigs pa thams cad yongs su bstan pa'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi rin po che'i dbyings kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi me tog gi ze ba'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho la la ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung dpyangs rnam par dmigs pa'i lhun can no/ /

Then the enlightening being Universally Good also said to the great assembly, “Children of Buddha, know that the oceans of worlds have various substances. Some have bodies of arrays of all jewels, some are of various ornaments made of all precious substances, some are of lights of all jewels, some are of lights of various colors, some are of lights of various adornments, some are composed of Buddhas’ powers, some are of characteristics of fine gems, some are made of miraculous displays of Buddhas, some are of jewel sun discs, some are of extremely minute, fine jewels, some are made of radiance of all jewels, some are of various fragrances, some are made of crowns of precious flowers, some are of all jewel reflections, some are made of what is manifested by all adornments, some are made of an instant of mind manifesting the whole cosmos, some are made of jewels in the forms of enlightening beings, some are made of jewel flower pistils, some are made of the spoken sounds of the Buddhas.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i lhun shin tu bstan pa rgya mtsho 'di nyid la rab tu gzud par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to repeat this, Universally Good surveyed the ten directions by the Buddha’s power and said,

zhing rnams rgya mtsho la la ni/ / rin chen rang bzhin kun nas gnas/ / rdo rje bzhin du mi shigs sra/ / rin chen pad+mo rnams la gnas/ /
la la 'od zer rang bzhin te/ / dag cing gzung med 'od zer 'byung / / rgyan rnams kun gyi 'od zer gyis/ / sna tshogs mkha' bzhin dri ma med/ /
la la 'od kyi rang bzhin te/ / dag cing 'od gsal zer la gnas/ / 'od kyi sprin can sna tshogs 'od/ / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho la la ni/ / mig yor lta bur gnas pa ste/ / brjod du med cing gzung du med/ / smon lam dbang gis rab tu byung / /
la la nor bu mu tig rgyu; ; snying po thams cad rnam par 'bar/ / mu tig 'khor lo'i gzhi dag la/ / byang chub sems dpas yongs su gang / /
rin chen 'od 'phro byung ba'i zhing / / 'od 'phro'i sprin gyis mngon khebs shing / / rin chen thams cad sna tshogs ldan/ / thams cad las kyis sprul pa yin/ /
la la mtshan las byung ba ste/ / gzhi kun mtshan gyis kun tu bris/ / cod pan rnam pa sna tshogs bkod/ / sangs rgyas kun gyis mngon par sprul/ /
rgya mtsho'i sems las byung ba yi/ / zhing rnams mos pa nyid la gnas/ / yul na mi gnas sgyu ma bzhin/ / yongs su rtog pas yang dag bskyed/ /
sangs rgyas sku yi 'od zer gyi/ / nor bu sna tshogs kun tu gnas/ / sangs rgyas sprin rnams rnam par snang / / sangs rgyas kun gyis rab tu sprul/ /
la la kun tu bzang po yis/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho shin tu sprul/ / nam mkha'i rgyan rnams thams cad dang / / smon lam rnams kyis rnam par bris/ /

There are some oceans of worlds Compounded of jewels, Solid and unbreakable, Resting on precious lotus blossoms.
Some are pure light beams Of unknowable origin; These arrays of all light beams Rest in empty space.
Some are made of pure light And also rest on light rays Embellished with clouds of light Where enlightening beings roam.
There are some oceans of lands Born of the power of vows, Existing like reflections: They can’t be grasped or explained.
Some are made of precious stones Emitting sunlike light; Discs of pearls adorn the ground, And enlightening beings abound.
Some lands are made of jewel flames, Covered with clouds of flames, The radiance of the jewels superb; All comes from results of acts.
Some are born of subtle forms, With various features adorning the ground, Like crowns holding all jewels; These come from the Buddha’s work.
Some are born from the ocean of minds, Existing according to what the minds understand. Like illusions, they have no locus: All are mental constructions.
Some are made of the precious light Of the Buddha’s aura; All the Buddhas appear therein, Each producing miracles.
Some universally good enlightening beings Produce various oceans of lands, Adorned by the power of their vows, All exceptionally sublime.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya ste/ 'di ltar dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyi sprin rab tu 'phros pa'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yon tan gyi 'khor lo rjes su brjod cing rab tu 'byung ba'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi las rnam par smin pa rgya mtsho las rab tu byung ba'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam rgya mtsho'i klong yongs su ston pa'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste; dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan sna tshogs rnam par dmigs pa'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste/ sems kyi skad cig la bskal pa mtha' yas par rnam par 'phrul ba'i yul yongs su ston pa'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste/ rgyan gyi dmigs pa thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi sku rab tu 'byung ba'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste/ rin po che dang / spos thams cad kyi sprin rab tu 'byung ba'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste/ snying po byang chub kyi rgyan dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyis rnam par ston pa'i rgyan dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dang / spyod pa yongs su ston pa'i rgyan dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do/ /

Then the enlightening being Universally Good also said to the great congregation, “Know that the oceans of worlds have various adornments. Some are adorned by all ornaments producing beautiful clouds, some by explanations of the virtues of all enlightening beings, some by explanations of the rewards of actions of all sentient beings, some by revelations of the ocean of vows of all enlightening beings, some by representations of the images of all Buddhas of past, present, and future, some by the spheres of occult powers revealing boundless eons in a single moment, some by production of all buddha-bodies, some by production of fragrant clouds of all jewels, some by radiant lights showing the wonderful things in all enlightenment scenes, some by illustration of the practices and vows of all universally good ones. There are as many such adornments as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to repeat, Universally Good, imbued with the power of the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

zhing rnams rgya mtsho rgya che mtha' yas te/ / rnam dag las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs gnas/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams rgya mtsho rnams kun kyang / / sna tshogs rgyan can yangs par kun nas gnas/ /
kha dog sna tshogs yangs pa'i zhing gi rnams/ / rgya mtsho rtag par phyogs rnams kun tu 'byung / / rgyan dang rin chen 'od 'phro sna tshogs sprin/ / sgra 'byin zhing gi dbyings rnams khebs par byed/ /
byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rgya mtsho rnams/ / de dag kun kyang rgya mtsho'i zhing na grag / sna tshogs rgyan dang smon lam sprin gyi rnams/ / de dag zhing mang rgya mtshor sgra yang 'byin/ /
'gro ba'i las rnams rgya mtsho yangs pa dag / rgyan gyi sprin rnams kun nas sgrar 'byin te/ / sems can de dag rnam smin ji 'dra ba/ / sangs rgyas byin gyis kun nas sgra yang sgrog /
dus gsum 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa yi/ / rnam 'phrul zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun na snang / / dmigs pa re re la yang sangs rgyas kun/ / de 'dra'i zhing mang rgya mtsho'i rgyan la ltos/ /
'das pa'i bskal pa de bzhin ma 'ongs dang / / phyogs bcu'i da ltar byung ba ji snyed pa'i/ / bskal pa de dag rgyan mang yangs pa yang / / zhing rnams rgya mtsho re re dag na snang / /
dmigs pa kun la sangs rgyas sprin gyi rnams/ / 'gro dang mnyam pas 'jig rten kun tu 'gengs/ / rnam par 'phrul zhing sems can rnam par 'dul/ / 'di ni zhing rnams rgya mtsho'i rnam thar to/ /
spos 'od sprin dang de bzhin me tog klong / / rgyan rnams sna tshogs thams cad kun nas kyang / / rtag par kun tu khyab par rab tu 'byung / / 'di ni zhing rnams rgya mtsho'i rnam thar to/ /
phyogs bcu kun gyi snying po byang chub rnams/ / sna tshogs rgyan can kun kyang ma lus par/ / thams cad rgya mtsho'i zhing 'di dbyings dag na/ / nam mkha'i sprin bzhin rnam par ston pa snang / /
rgyal sras kun tu bzang po thams cad kyi/ / zhing rnams mtha' yas 'byams klas rgyan gyi rnams/ / 'gro ba'i grangs snyed bskal pa rgya mtshor rnam sbyangs pa/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun na rab tu snang / /

The vast oceans of lands are boundless; All are made from pure action, With various adornments and various abodes, They fill all ten directions.
Clouds of jewel flames of boundless forms, Vast arrays of adornments, not the same, Always appear in all oceans of lands, Radiating subtle sounds expounding the truth.
Adorned by the various great vows Of the enlightening beings’ boundless sea of virtues, These lands simultaneously produce sublime sounds Shaking the network of the lands of the ten directions.
The ocean of beings’ acts is vast, immeasurable; According to the results they effect, the lands are each different. The adornments in all places Can tell of this, by the Buddha’s powers.
The spiritual powers of Buddhas past, present, and future Appear throughout the oceans of lands; In each phenomenon all the Buddhas appear: Thus do they purify — you should observe.
Past, future, and present eons, All lands in the ten directions, And all the adornments therein, All appear in each land.
In all phenomena are countless Buddhas: As many as beings, filling the world; In order to teach they produce mystic effects Whereby they adorn the oceans of lands.
All the adornments emit beautiful clouds Of various flowers and fragrant flames, With clouds of jewels appearing as well: The oceans of worlds are embellished with these.
All sites of enlightenment in the ten directions Are complete with all kinds of adornment; Flowing lights spread afar, like clouds of color: All are shown in this ocean of lands.
The practice of the vows of the universally good Buddha children have practiced for eons as many as beings; Boundless lands have they all adorned, All appearing in all places.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho yongs su dag par bya ba'i tshul rgya mtsho ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya ste/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la brten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas skal ba mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi bsod nams rgya chen po'i sprin rnam par 'phel bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa'i dkyil 'khor rgya chen po rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rab tu brtan pa'i yul la rnam par spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / yongs su sbyang ba dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad kyi dbyings la rab tu dgod cing gzud pa'i rnam par spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa dang / 'byung ba rgya mtsho la rnam par spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad mngon par sgrub pa rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgya mtsho thams cad mngon par sgrub pa rnam par dag pa la rab tu 'jug pa dang / 'di lta ste; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs kyi tshul yang dag par sgrub pa rnam par dag pa dang / de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho yongs su dag par bya ba'i tshul rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya'o/ /

Then Universally Good also said to the congregation, “Know that in the oceans of worlds there are oceans of purifying techniques as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds. That is to say, the enlightening beings associate with all good teachers to cultivate the same roots of goodness; they cause great clouds of virtues to grow, extending throughout the universe; they clarify all their great beliefs; they contemplate the spheres of all enlightening beings and abide therein; they cultivate all means of transcendence and fulfill them; they contemplate all stages of enlightenment and enter them; they produce the ocean of all pure aspirations; they cultivate all practices essential for emancipation; they enter into the ocean of all adornments; they perfect the power of purifying methods. There are as many of these and others as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho yongs su dag par bya ba'i tshul rgya mtsho 'di nyid rnam par bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to reiterate, Universally Good looked over the ten directions by the power of the Buddha invested in him, and said,

zhing rnams rgya mtsho thams cad sna tshogs rgyan/ / smon lam tshul rnams rgya mtsho kun gyis byung / / kha dog mtha' yas las kyi rgya mtsho dag / zhing rnams rgya mtsho rtag tu 'od mang 'gyed/ /
sngon chad dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur cing / / skal ba mnyam pa'i las dge yongs sbyangs te/ / snying rje byams pas 'gro yangs kun bzang zhing / / zhing rnams rgya mtsho yangs pa 'di kun sbyangs/ /
chos sgo kun tu ting 'dzin sa kun gyis/ / sangs rgyas yon tan rgya mtsho yongs sbyangs te/ / bsam gtan tshul dang rnam thar sa sbyangs shing / / zhing rnams rgya mtsho sna tshogs yangs pa byung / /
mos pa'i dkyil 'khor mtha' yas stobs bskyed cing / / rgyal ba'i mnyam nyid ma nor rtogs byas nas/ / bzod pa rgya mtsho'i tshul rnams yongs sbyangs shing / / rnam dag kha dog mtha' yas zhing rnams byung / /
bsod nams sprin ni nam mkha' mnyam bskyed cing / / 'gro ba kun phan bde don spyod spyad de/ / bsod nams rgya mtsho sems can kun bstan pas/ / 'jig rten khams rnams rgya mtsho kun kyang 'byung / /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho'i rdul snyed tshad med pa'i/ / pha rol phyin pa ma lus kun sbyangs te/ / smon lam mthar phyin mi zad goms byams pas/ / dri med rgya mtsho'i zhing rnams yangs pa 'byung / /
'byung ba'i spyod pa gang yod tshad med dang / / chos rnams thams cad yangs pa yongs sbyangs te/ / sna tshogs thabs sgos sems can sbyangs pas na/ / 'di 'dra'i yid 'ong rgya mtsho'i zhing rnams 'byung / /
rgyan rnams kun gyi tshul dang sa sbyangs shing / / rgyal ba'i yon tan rgya mtsho kun zhugs nas/ / 'gro ba kun gyi sdug bsngal mtsho bskams pas/ / zhing gi mtsho yangs 'di kun dag par 'gyur/ /
stobs rnams rgya mtsho gzhal med yongs sbyangs shing / / 'gro ba 'di 'dra tshad med rnam sbyangs te/ / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho yangs kun bsnyen bkur bas/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho rnam mang rnam par dag /

The adornments of all oceans of worlds Are born from countless techniques, vows, and powers; All the oceans of lands always shine, Produced by the power of countless pure deeds.
Forever associating with good teachers, Together doing good works, all pure, With great compassion extending to all beings, Thereby are world-oceans adorned.
Concentration on all the teachings, Meditation, liberation, and skill in means Are all purified with the Buddha: Thus are the world-oceans born.
Developing boundless certainty, Able to understand like the Buddha, Having purified patience and skill in means, Thus can boundless lands be purified.
Cultivating supreme practices to aid sentient beings, Virtue great and always growing, Like clouds spreading as far as space: Thus are world-oceans perfected.
The transcending means are infinite, many as beings; All have the Buddhas practiced to perfection; Transcendent vow-taking has no end: Pure world-oceans are born from here.
Purely practicing all peerless truths, Developing boundless liberating practices, Edifying beings by various means: Thus are beautified oceans of worlds.
Practicing techniques of adornment, Entering the ocean of teachings of enlightened virtues, Causing all beings to dry up the source of suffering: Thus are vast lands perfected.
The ocean of powers is peerlessly great, Causing all beings to plant roots of good, Making offerings to all the enlightened: Thus are boundless lands all purified.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho re rer sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i tshul rgya mtsho ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya ste/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ sku chung ngur kun tu ston to/ / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad gzugs kyi skus gang bar ston to/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ sku tshe'i tshad mi ring ngo/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ sku tshe'i tshad ring ngo/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni; sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig yongs su dag par byin gyis rlob bo/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su dag par byin gyis rlob bo/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ tshul gcig gis bstan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo byin gyis rlob bo/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ tshul bsam gyis mi khyab par bstan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo byin gyis rlob bo/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ sems can gyi khams nyung ngu rnam par gdul ba byin gyis rlob bo/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba la la ni/ sems can rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa rnam par gdul ba byin gyis rlob ste/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho re rer sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i tshul rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya'o/ /

Then Universally Good addressed the masses again: “Buddha children, know that in each ocean of worlds there are differences in the manifestation of the Buddhas, as many as atomic particles in an ocean of worlds. That is, some manifest small bodies, some large bodies, some manifest short lives, some long lives, some only adorn and purify a single buddha-land, some adorn and purify innumerable buddha-lands, some only reveal one vehicle of teaching, some reveal inconceivably many vehicles of teaching, some appear to tame a few sentient beings, some tame boundless sentient beings. Such differences as these are as many as atomic particles in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i tshul rgya mtsho'i phyogs 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Universally Good, to review, looked over the ten directions by the power he received from the Buddha, and said,

rgyal ba 'byung ba thabs rnams sna tshogs kyi/ / sgo nas zhing rnams rgya mtshor rab tu 'byung / / de dag sems can bsam pa ji bzhin mkhyen/ / sangs rgyas thabs kyi sgo mang rgya mtsho 'o/ /
sangs rgyas chos sku bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / mig yor ma yin mtshan nyid med pa'i gzugs/ / gzugs kyi khyad par 'gro ba 'di dag tu/ / sems can bsam pa'i phyogs bzhin ston la ltos/ /
sku tshe thung bar la la rnam par ston/ / la la bskal pa bsam yas byin gyis rlob; ; chos kyi sku ni phyogs rnams kun gyi sgo/ / rab tu mdzes par 'gro nang 'di na bzhugs/ /
la la zhing rnams rgya mtsho bsam yas dag / sbyong zhing 'byams klas phyogs bcu kun na yang / / la la zhing gcig rnam par sbyong bar mdzad/ / smon lam ma lus kun kyang tshul gcig go /
la la bsam gyis mi khyab theg pa'i rgyan/ / sems can yid bzhin sangs rgyas ston pa mdzad/ / la la theg pa gcig kyang rab ston te/ / rgyal ba'i thabs ni gcig kyang mtha' yas so/ /
rang byung la la byang chub sangs rgyas nas/ / sems can mi mang lam la gzhog pa mdzad/ / la la skad cig gcig gis sems can rnams/ / rgya mtsho bsam yas byang chub don du 'dul/ /
la la spu yi sgo nas bsam yas pa'i/ / sangs rgyas sprul ba'i sprin rnams rab tu 'gyed/ / 'gro ba kun tu de dag mngon bkang zhing / / thabs kyi sgo nas sems can 'dul ba mdzad/ /
la la sangs rgyas gsung gis kun bkang zhing / / zhing du sems can yid bzhin rab tu sgrog / bsam yas bskal par de dag gsung sgrog cing / / sems can rgya mtsho mtha' yas rnam par 'dul/ /
la la zhing rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / 'khor rnams yongs dag kun nas 'khod bcas pas/ / zhing mang rgya mtsho phyogs su gang byas shing / / sangs rgyas mkha' la sprin ltar khyab par bzhugs/ /
de ltar sangs rgyas thabs ni bsam mi khyab/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun tu rgyas bkang zhing / / 'gro ba kun la sangs rgyas mngon sum ste; ; sna tshogs rgyan mang du ma'i tshul dang ldan/ /

Various accommodating methods of the Buddhas Appear in all the oceans of worlds, All adapted to the inclinations of sentient beings: This is the Buddhas’ power of skillful expedients.
The reality-body of the Buddhas is inconceivable: Colorless, formless, beyond any image, Yet able to manifest myriad forms for sentient beings, Causing them to see, according to their inclinations.
Some manifest short lives for beings, Some appear to live for countless eons; The reality-body manifests throughout the ten directions, Appearing in the world according to suitability.
Some there are who beautify and purify all The inconceivable oceans of worlds in all directions; And some only purify one single land, Yet showing all within that one.
Some, according to the mentalities of sentient beings, Reveal inconceivably many various vehicles of liberation; Some only expound one vehicle of teaching, Yet within that one are revealed innumerable methods.
Some there are who, naturally enlightened, Cause a few beings to abide in the Way; Some can in a single instant Awaken countless deluded ones.
Some produce mystical clouds from their pores Which manifest countless, boundless Buddhas Appearing in all worlds, Liberating beings by various means.
Some there are whose spoken sounds pervade everywhere Explaining truth in accord with mental inclinations of beings, Through inconceivably many eons Taming oceans of countless beings.
Some have infinite beautified worlds, Their congregations pure, sitting solemnly, Buddhas like clouds spreading over, Filling the oceans of worlds in the ten directions.
The techniques of the Buddhas are inconceivable, All appearing in accord with beings’ minds, Abiding in various beautified fields, Extending throughout all lands.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i bskal pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi tshul shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya ste/ 'di ltar zhing rgya mtsho la la ni/ bskal pa grangs med par byin gyis brlabs pa'o/ / zhing rgya mtsho la la ni/ bskal pa tshad med par byin gyis brlabs pa'o/ / zhing rgya mtsho la la ni/ bskal pa dpag tu med par byin gyis brlabs pa'o/ / zhing rgya mtsho la la ni/ bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab par byin gyis brlabs pa'o/ / zhing rgya mtsho la la ni; bskal pa mtshungs pa med par byin gyis brlabs pa'o/ / zhing rgya mtsho la la ni/ bskal pa kun nas mtha' yas par byin gyis brlabs pa'o/ / zhing rgya mtsho la la ni/ bskal pa kun nas mu med par byin gyis brlabs pa'o/ / zhing rgya mtsho la la ni/ bskal pa gzhal du med par byin gyis brlabs pa'o/ / zhing rgya mtsho la la ni/ bskal pa brjod du med par byin gyis brlabs pa ste/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i bskal pa byin gyi rlabs kyi tshul shin tu bstan pa rgya mtsho ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do/ /

Then Universally Good again addressed the great assembly: “Buddha-children, know that the oceans of worlds have as many spans of existence as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds. That is, some abide for an incalculable eon, some abide for an infinite eon, some abide for a boundless eon, some abide for an incomparable eon, some abide for an uncountable eon, some abide for an unspeakable eon, some abide for an inconceivable eon, some abide for an immeasurable eon, some abide for an inexplicable eon. There are as many such spans as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i bskal pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi tshul shin tu bstan pa 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to review, Universally Good, looking over the ten directions by the power received from the Buddha, said,

'jig rten rgya mtsho bskal pa tha dad de/ / sna tshogs tshul 'jug rgyan rnams gzhan dang gzhan/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun na snang / / bskal pa'i tshul ni rgya mtsho grangs kyang med/ /
bskal pa mi mthun 'gro ba kun dang mnyam/ / phyogs dbyings 'jig rten rgya mtsho'i khams na snang / / bskal pa mtha' yas la la ring dang thung / / bskal pa sna tshogs rgyal ba'i sgras kyang bsgrags/ /
rgya mtsho'i zhing rnams 'di dag phyogs dbyings snang / / byin rlabs bskal pa zhing rdul snyed dang ldan/ / la la gzhan rnams bskal pa gcig gis 'jug / la la bskal grangs smon lam du mas byung / /
bskal pa la la dri med la la nyon mongs can/ / la la rnam dag la la nyon mongs rnam par gnas/ / bskal pa'i ming ni smon lam rgya mtsho'i tshul gyis byung / / sems can 'du shes rnam pas tha dad tshul la 'jug /
bskal pa zhing gi rdul snyed sngon chad spyod spyad pas/ / 'jig rten khams rnams rgya mtsho shin tu yangs shing dag / de dag kun nas sangs rgyas yul rgyan tshad kyang med/ / 'di dag rgya chen bskal pa'i 'jig rten rgya mtsho'i khams/ /
bskal pa'i 'od dang 'od zer rin chen ming sna tshogs/ / bcom ldan 'das dang 'od mnyam 'od 'phro'i mig snang ba/ / snang dang dri med bzang po bskal pa'i mig la 'jug / bskal pa 'di dag rnam dag bskal pa kun las byung / /
dri med bskal pa la lar sangs rgyas gcig skye'o/ / bskal pa la lar mi yi gtso bo mtha' yas 'byung / / bskal pa'i tshul rnams thams cad sa tshul zad mi shes/ / smon lam stobs mthus bskal pa sna tshogs 'jug par 'gyur/ /
bskal pa la la mtha' yas rnams kyang bskal pa gcig tu 'dus/ / bskal pa la la gcig kyang bskal pa bye ba'i mthu/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho kun kyang sna tshogs sgo nas 'jug / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams kyi nang nas sgra yang 'byin/ /
bskal pa la lar bskal pa kun gyi rkyen kyang 'byung / / ming gi rgyan rnams rnam par dag pa'ang de la yin/ / bskal pa la la sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul mthu yis byung / / bskal pa'i tshul rnams kun gyi 'di ni rgyan yangs yin/ /
zhing dang bskal pa rgya mtsho tshul ni gcig gis dag / zhing gi rdul rnams kun kyang tshad med gzhal du med/ / skad cig yud tsam nyi ma'i grangs kyi bskal par 'gyur/ / 'di dag thams cad sems can 'du shes rnam par 'byung / /

Among the oceans of worlds are various ages, Adorned by vast, extensive technical skills; Observing all the lands in the ten directions, The differences in the measures of their ages become clear.
I see that the eon lengths in the world-oceans of the ten directions Are innumerable, same as sentient beings: Some long, some short, some are without bounds; I now tell of them, by the Buddha’s voice.
I see the oceans of lands in the ten directions: Some abide for eons numerous as atoms, Some for one eon, some for numberless; Each is different, due to the variety of vows.
Some are wholly pure, some wholly defiled; Then again, in some purity and defilement are mixed. The structures of the oceans of vows vary, Abiding in the conceptions of sentient beings.
Having cultivated practices for eons as many as atoms in a land And attained vast and pure oceans of worlds, The Buddhas’ realm is fully adorned, Abiding forever, through boundless eons.
Some eons are called Light of Various Jewels, Some, Mind of Radiant Eyes, or Equal Sound, Undefiled Light, or Eon of Virtue; These pure eons contain all eons.
There are pure eons where one Buddha appears, Or in one eon countless Buddhas may appear. With inexhaustible skill in means and great will power, They enter into all the various ages.
Infinite eons may enter one eon, Or one eon may enter many eons: The various aspects of the ocean of all eons Clearly appear in the lands of the ten directions.
The adornments of all eons May all appear in one eon; Or the adornments of one eon May enter all boundless eons.
From the first moment to the completion of the eon, All is born from the conceptions of beings’ minds. All oceans of lands, their eons boundless, Are purified by one technique.
