kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bskal pa mtha' yas pa'i rgyud kyi tshul rgya mtsho ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya ste/ 'di ltar chos nyid rab tu thob pas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag bskal pas 'jig cing 'du ba la rab tu 'jug par gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtshor gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pas bskal pa mtha' yas pa kun nas gnas pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtshor gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsod nams rgya mtsho rgya chen po gsog pa/ rnam par dag pas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho kun nas nyon mongs la rnam par dag par gnas pa dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' mos pa sna tshogs kyis spyod pa rnams skye bas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rnam par dag la kun nas nyon mongs par gnas pa dang / 'di lta ste/ sems can rgya mtsho rgya chen po byang chub kyi sems la gnas pas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho shin tu dag par gnas pa dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan du 'dong bas bskal pa rgyan tha dad pa'i tshul du gnas pa dang / 'di lta ste/ phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtshor 'dus pas bskal pa mtha' yas pa rgyan shin tu mang por kun nas gnas pa dang / 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag gi rgyan nub par 'gyur ba dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i tshe 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rnams rgyan gyis brgyan par kun nas gnas pa dang / 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par 'phrul bas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i bskal pa mtha' yas pa yongs su dag par gnas pa dang / de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i bskal pa rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa'i rgyud kyi tshul rgya mtsho kun nas gnas pa'i tshul ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya'o/ /

Then Universally Good also said to the masses, “Children of Buddha, you should know that the oceans of worlds have as many differences in changes in the ages as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds. That is, as a consequence of natural law, the oceans of worlds have innumerable changes of the ages, forming and disintegrating; because defiled beings live in them, the oceans of worlds have changes in the ages, becoming defiled; as a result of having sentient beings who cultivate great virtues living in them, the oceans of worlds have changes in the ages coming to have some purity in the midst of their defilements; as a result of enlightening beings with faith and understanding living there, world oceans have changes in the ages, coming to have more purity than defilement; as a result of innumerable beings there conceiving the will for enlightenment, the oceans of worlds have changes in their ages, becoming totally pure; as a result of enlightening beings traveling in the various worlds, the oceans of worlds have changes in the ages, becoming beautified with boundless adornment; as a result of the enlightening beings of all the world-oceans in the ten directions gathering, world-oceans have changes in the ages, becoming beautified with infinite great adornments; because of the Buddhas passing away into nirvana, world oceans have changes in the ages, their adornments dying out; because of Buddhas appearing in the worlds, oceans of worlds have changes in the ages, becoming extensively beautified and purified; because of the mystic powers and edifying miracles of the Buddhas, world-oceans have changes in the ages, becoming pure all over. There are as many such changes as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i bskal pa mtha' yas pa'i tshul rgya mtsho 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to reiterate, the enlightening being Universally Good, looking over the ten directions by the power received from the Buddha, said in verse,

zhing rnams rgya mtsho'i chos nyid 'di dag ltos/ / chos kyis byung ste ji ltar gnas pa ltar; ; de dag 'byung zhing 'jig par 'gyur bar yang / / zhing rnams rgya mtsho thams cad rab tu snang / /
sems can nyon mongs mi bzad ldan pa dang / / las dang nyon mongs ngan pas bsgribs pa'i rnams/ / de dag bsam la zhing gi rgya mtsho rnams/ / kun nas nyon mongs ldan par gyur pa yin/ /
sems can rnam dag bsam pa ldan pa dang / / bsod nams brtan dang rnam dag spyod yul can/ / rnam dag yul la nyon mongs ldan gyur rnams/ / de dag mos pa sna tshogs spyod yul gyi/ /
byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i dus dag na/ / bskal pa de ni rnam par dag par snang / / sems can nyon mongs ldan par gyur pa yang / / de yi chos nyid bsam yas yangs pa yi/ /
byang chub bsam pa ji ltar bskyed pa dang / / de dag bsam pa ji ltar rnam 'phel bas/ / de bzhin bskal pa rgya mtsho mang po dag / bsam gyis mi khyab zhing rgyan yongs su sbyong / /
bye ba mang po mtha' yas mi zad pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa' phyogs bcu kun rgyu yang / / rgyan la rnam pa tha dad yod pa min/ / bskal pa tha dad tshul gyi bye phrag snang / /
rdul rnams re re sbubs su dus kun tu/ / sangs rgyas zhing gi rdul dang mnyam pa yi/ / rgyal sras ji tshul 'dod pa de bzhin du/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho de tshul dag par gyur/ /
gal te rgyal ba rnams ni skye 'gyur na/ / zhing rnams rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan par 'gyur; ; bsam pa yongs dag de bzhin rgyas 'gyur te/ / 'di ni zhing rgyan phun sum tshogs pa'o/ /
gal te rgyal ba mya ngan 'das gyur na/ / de tshe de zhing rgyan rnams 'grib par 'gyur/ / sems can rnams kyang snod du rung ba min/ / zhing gi rgya mtsho de yang nyon mongs ldan/ /
sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul rnam 'phrul yangs pa dag / bsam gyis mi khyab gang tshe ston pa na/ / de tshe zhing rnams rgya mtsho mang po dag / kun kyang rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan par 'gyur/ /

All lands are born According to the power of actions; You all should observe The forms of changes as they are.
Defiled sentient beings are bound By habitual confusions, to be feared; Their minds cause oceans of worlds To all become defiled.
If any have pure hearts And cultivate virtuous deeds, Their minds will cause oceans of worlds To have purity mixed with defilement.
If enlightening beings of faith and understanding Are born in the age, According to what’s in their minds Purity mixed with defilement will show.
When infinite sentient beings Determine on enlightenment, Their minds will cause world-oceans To be pure for that age.
When boundless billions of enlightening beings Travel to all quarters, Adornments, all of them equal, Are variously seen through the age.
When in each and every atom Of Buddha-lands as many as atoms Enlightening beings gather together, All the lands are pure.
If a Buddha appears in the world Everything is marvelous; In accord with the purity of mind, All adornments are complete.
When a Buddha passes away That land’s adornments perish; If no beings are vessels of truth, That land becomes defiled.
The spiritual powers of the Buddhas Are shown in inconceivable numbers; Then the ocean of lands Are all totally pure.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho tha mi dad pa'i tshul ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya ste/ de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs so/ /gsung ngo/ /gsung bar 'gyur ro/ / de ni/ 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag tu sangs rgyas skye zhing 'byung ba tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag gi snying po byang chub thams cad nas chos kyis dbyings kyis phyogs rgyas par 'gengs pa tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag gi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag gi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag tu sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sprul pa'i sprin dang / mtshan gyi 'khor lo tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag tu sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor bskal pa mtha' yas par brjod cing rgyas par bya ba'i byin gyi rlabs tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag tu chos kyi 'khor lo'i tshul tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag tu rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su 'du ba tha mi dad pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho dag tu rdul 'byams klas pa thams cad la dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po ston cing rjod pa tha mi dad pa dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho tha mi dad pa'i tshul 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya'o; ;

Then Universally Good again addressed the assembly: “Children of Buddha, know that there are many ways in which the oceans of worlds are not different, as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds. That is, there is no difference in the number of worlds in each ocean of worlds, being as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds; there is no difference in the powers of the Buddhas appearing in each ocean of worlds; there is no difference in that all enlightenment sites in each ocean of worlds pervade the cosmos in all directions; there is no difference in the assemblies at the enlightenment sites of all the Buddhas in each ocean of worlds; there is no difference in the auras of all the Buddhas in each ocean of worlds pervading the cosmos; there is no difference in the miracles and epithets of all Buddhas in each ocean of worlds; there is no difference in the voices of all the Buddhas in each ocean of worlds pervading the ocean of worlds and abiding forever. There is no difference in the techniques of the teaching cycles in each ocean of worlds; there is no difference in that in each ocean of worlds all oceans of worlds everywhere enter into the individual atom; there is no difference in that in each and every atom of each ocean of worlds are manifest the vast realms of all the Buddhas of the past, present, and future. The aspects of the oceans of worlds which are not different are, briefly stated, thus; if they are fully told, there are as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho tha dad pa'i tshul rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa 'di nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Universally Good, to recapitulate, looked over the ten directions by the power of the Buddha and said in verse,

rdul gcig steng na zhing mang rgya mtsho ste/ / kun na rgyan mang rnam dag kun yod kyang / / gnod pa med cing 'dra ba gang yang med/ / 'jug pa bsam gyis mi khyab 'di la ltos/ /
rdul rnams kun la bsam yas sangs rgyas bzhugs/ / sems can kun gyi bsam pa yid bzhin du; ; zhing rnams rgya mtsho thams cad khyab byas kyang / / de dag thabs la tha dad gang yang med/ /
rdul rnams kun la shing dbang mtha' yas pa/ / sna tshogs rgyan phyung kun nas bres sbyangs te; ; phyogs rnams kun gyi zhing du mngon bkang yang / / de dag tha dad 'gyur ba nam yang med/ /
rdul phran rgya mtsho rdul phran re re la/ / mi yi gtso bo 'khor rnams kun bskor cing / / 'jig rten kun tu bkang ste 'phags bzhugs kyang / / gnod pa dag dang 'dra ba'i nyes pa med/ /
rdul gcig la ni mtha' yas 'od kyi sprin/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams rgya mtsho kun bkang zhing / / bde gshegs rnams kyi byang chub spyod bstan kyang / / rgya mtsho'i zhing rnams tha dad gang yang med/ /
rdul rnams kun la kha dog bsam mi khyab/ / sprul pa'i sprin gyis kun tu gang byas te/ / sangs rgyas sprul pas sems can rnams 'dul yang / / 'byams klas phyogs na tha dad gang yang med/ /
rdul rnams kun la rgya mtsho'i chos brjod do/ / de dag 'khor lo'i tshul bzhin 'khor mdzad cing / / thabs dang mthu yi sgo mo sna tshogs kyis/ / thams cad brjod kyang de la tha dad med/ /
rdul gcig la ni rgyal ba kun gyis gsung / / 'gro ba snod du gyur la de dag brjod byas te/ / rgya mtsho'i zhing du bskal par byin brlabs kyang / / de dag gsung gi yan lag tha mi dad/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho mtha' yas rgyan gyi rnams/ / thams cad rdul sbubs gcig tu rab tu 'dzud/ / rgyal ba rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul mthu la ltos/ / las kyi dngos las de dag skyes pa min/ /
rdul gcig la ni dus gsum rgyal ba dag / ji ltar byung ba de dag thams cad snang / / de dag gshegs dang byon pa gang yang med/ / 'gro ba kun na sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul/ /

In each atom are many oceans of worlds, Their locations each different, all beautifully pure; Thus does infinity enter into one, Yet each unit’s distinct, with no overlap.
Within each atom are inconceivably many Buddhas Appearing everywhere in accord with beings’ minds, Reaching everywhere in all oceans of worlds: This technique of theirs is the same for all.
In each and every atom are enlightenment trees, All draped with various adornments In which all lands alike appear; In this all are no different.
In each atom are congregations numerous as atoms, All surrounding the leader of humanity, Going beyond all, pervading the worlds, Yet with no crowding or confusion.
In each atom are innumerable lights Pervading the lands of the ten directions, All showing the Buddhas’ enlightening practices, The same in all oceans of worlds.
In each atom are infinite bodies Transforming like clouds, circulating everywhere; By mystic buddha-powers they guide all beings, No different in all ten directions’ lands.
In each atom are expounded many teachings; Those teachings are pure and revolve like wheels. The gates of freedom by various means Are all told of, without discrimination.
One atom emanates all Buddhas’ voices, Filling those beings who are receptors of truth; Omnipresent in the oceans of worlds for countless eons, These voices too have no difference.
The countless beautiful adornments of oceans of worlds All enter inside a single atom; Such mystic powers of the Buddhas All arise from the nature of action.
In each atom the Buddhas of all times Appear, according to inclinations; While their essential nature neither comes nor goes, By their vow power they pervade the worlds.

shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa'i phyogs gsal bar bya ba yang dag par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba ste/ le'u bzhi pa'o// //
BOOK FIVE. The Flower Bank World
bam po brgyad pa/
[5. 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho yongs su dag pas snang ba'i le'u]

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gis brgyan gyis brgyan pa 'di bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe bskal pa rgya mtsho'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis yongs su dag par byas te/ bskal pa re re zhing yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi zhabs kyi drung du smon lam rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis yongs su dag par byas so/ /

THEN THE ENLIGHTENING BEING Universally Good again addressed the great assembly, saying, “Children of Buddha, this Flower Bank Array ocean of worlds was adorned and purified by Vairocana Buddha as in the remote past he cultivated enlightening practices for as many eons as atoms in an ocean of worlds, in each eon associating with as many Buddhas as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds, in the presence of each Buddha purely practicing great vows as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa de ni/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis shin tu bzung ba ste/ de la rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi 'og ma ni/ gzhi kun nas rton pa zhes bya ste/ rin po che thams cad kyi 'od 'phro ba 'bar bas brgyan pa'i gzhis rten to; ; de'i steng na rlung gi dkyil 'khor rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyan 'byung ba zhes bya ba yod de/ nor bu'i rgyal po 'od rnam par dag pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi gzhis rton to/ / de'i steng na rlung gyi dkyil 'khor rin po che'i mthu zhes bya ba yod de/ rin po che thams cad kyi dril bu'i gzhis rton to/ / de'i steng na rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'od 'phro ba mnyam par rton pa zhes bya ba yod de/ nor bu'i rgyal po nyi ma snang ba'i rgyal mtshan gyi 'khor lo'i gzhis rton to/ / de'i steng na rlung gi dkyil 'khor rgyan kun nas rnam par bres pa zhes bya ba yod de/ 'od zer gyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi me tog gi gzhis rton to/ / de'i steng na rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhi kun nas dri ma med cing yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba yod de/ me tog thams cad 'od 'phro ba'i seng+ge'i khri'i gzhis rton to/ / de'i steng na rlung gi dkyil 'khor phyogs su sgra sgrog cing kun tu rgyu ba zhes bya ba yod de/ mu tig dang man shel gyi rgyal mtshan sna tshogs kyi gzhis rton to; ; de'i steng na rlung gi dkyil 'khor rin po che thams cad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yod de/ nor bu'i rgyal po'i shing dang me tog sna tshogs kyi glang gi gzhis rton to/ / de'i steng na rlung gi dkyil 'khor kun nas 'dzin pa'i shugs zhes bya ba yod de/ spos kyi nor bu thams cad kyi ri rab kyi sprin gyi gzhis rton to/ / de'i steng na rlung gi dkyil 'khor khyim kun tu rgyu pa zhes bya ba yod de/ rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog dang / spos kyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin gyi gzhis rton to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de dag thams cad kyi steng ma ni/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzi brjid bzang po dpal gyi snying po zhes bya ste/ nor bu kun nas snang ba'i rgyan dang ldan pa'i spos kyi chu rgya mtsho'i gzhis rton to/ / spos kyi chu rgya mtsho nor bu kun nas snang ba'i gzhis brgyan pa'i snying po zhes bya ba de las pad+mo chen po spos kyi rgyal mtshan khyer ba'i 'od zer dang / ze ba sna tshogs zhes bya ba mngon par 'byung ste/ pad+mo chen po de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ kun nas gru bzhir 'dug pa/ rnam par dag pa/ shin tu brtan pa; rdo rje dang nor bu thams cad kyi khor yug gis bskor ba/ rim gyis gzhol bar gnas pa/ shing gi rgyud rgya mtsho sa la rab tu gnas pa 'di 'dug go /

“This Flower Bank Array ocean of worlds is supported by as many atmospheres as there are atoms in the polar mountain. The bottommost atmosphere is called Impartial Abode; it holds arrays of blazing flames of all jewels above it. The next atmosphere is called Producing Various Precious Adornments; it holds diamond banners radiant with pure light above it. The next higher atmosphere is called Precious Power; it holds chimes of all jewels above it. The next higher atmosphere is called Impartial Flavor; it holds diamond orbs of the appearance of sunlight above it. The next higher atmosphere is called Various Universal Adornments; it holds flowers of light discs above it. The next higher atmosphere is called Universal Purity; it holds flaming lion thrones of all flowers above it. The next higher atmosphere is called Sound Pervading the Ten Directions; it holds banners of all regal pearls above it. The next higher atmosphere is called Light of All Jewels; it holds all diamond tree flowers above it. The next higher atmosphere is called High Velocity Universal Support; it holds mountainous clouds of all fragrant gems above it. The next higher atmosphere is called Various Mansions in Motion; it holds clouds of pedestals of all precious colors and fragrances above it. The uppermost of those atmospheres as numerous as atoms in a mountain is called Repository of Supreme Light; it holds an ocean of fragrant water, adorned by radiant diamonds. In this ocean of fragrant water is an enormous lotus blossom, called Banner of Fragrance, with pistils of all kinds of lights; this Flower Bank Array ocean of worlds rests therein. This ocean of worlds is square and level, pure and stable, surrounded by diamond circular mountains. Its lands, seas, and trees each have distinct boundaries.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'di nyid kyi yon tan rgya mtsho yongs su dag pa'i phyogs 'di nyid brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Universally Good, to recapitulate, looked over the ten directions with the power of the Buddha and said in verse,

gzhi rgyan me tog 'jig rten khams kyi rgya mtsho de/ / rin chen kun gyi snying po kha dog sna tshogs te/ / rdul rnams kun dang mnyam pa'i sngon chad sangs rgyas kyi/ / drung du sngon tshe rgya mtshor sbyangs pas dri ma med/ /
rgya chen snying rje'i sprin gyis khams rnams kun bkang zhing / / zhing gi rdul dang mnyam pa'i lus kyang kun btang nas/ / sngon gyi bskal pa rgya mtshor spyod pa spyad pas na/ / 'jig rten rgya mtsho'i khams de yangs shing rnam par dag /
sangs rgyas rnam par snang bas smon lam che mdzad de/ / 'od snang btang ba mkha' yi dkyil na gnas pa ni/ / rlung gi phung pos btab kyang mi bskyod mi g.yo ste/ / nor bu kun brgyan sangs rgyas gzugs brnyan snying po'o/ /
me tog mdzod bkye gtor ba rin chen yid 'ong bzhin/ / sngon gyi smon lam dbang gis mkha' yi dbyings la gnas/ / rgya mtsho'i rgyan rnams thams cad sna tshogs brtan par gnas/ / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun tu 'od kyi sprin kyang gtong / /
nor bu thams cad sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i rnams; ; byung zhing 'od zer sprin 'bar phyogs rnams kun tu 'dong / / 'od zer me tog tshon dang 'od zer 'khor lo'i tshogs/ / phyogs rnams ma lus kun gyi chos dbyings khyab par byed/ /
rin chen kun gyis 'od zer sprin rnams bkye ba ni/ / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun gyi zhing rnams khyab par byed/ / sdug bsngal thams cad bcil zhing byang chub mchog la bgrod/ / 'jig rten rgya mtsho thams cad 'od 'phro rab tu 'bar/ /
'gro ba kun dang mnyam pa'i sprul pa sna tshogs rnams/ / rin chen kun dang spu rnams kun nas rgyal ba 'gyed; ; brgya byin dag dang tshangs pa 'ang 'khor lo sgyur 'dra dang / / 'gro ba kun gyi lus su lus rnams kun kyang gnas/ /
sprul pas 'od bkye chos kyi dbyings kyi tshad mnyam pa/ / 'od zer sgo nas sangs rgyas thams cad mtshan kyang sgrog / 'gro ba ma lus kun gyi bsam pa tshim byas nas/ / tshul rnams sna tshogs sgo nas sems can rnam par 'dul/ /
'jig rten rgya mtsho me tog snying po de nang na/ / rdul phran kun gyi khongs na chos dbyings thams cad kyi/ / rin chen 'od bkye sangs rgyas sprin rnams 'bar bar snang / / rnam par snang mdzad rnam par 'phrul ba'i zhing la ltos/ /
bskal pa rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sangs byas te/ / smon lam yangs pa'i sprin ni chos kyi dbyings mnyam dang / / bzang po'i spyod pa brnyes shing ye shes sa ldan pa'i; ; dgongs pa las ni rgyan mdzes de dag byung ba yin/ /

In the past the Buddha, in all states of being Cultivated pure deeds with Buddhas as many as atoms; Thus he attained the Flower Bank Array ocean of world With all kinds of jewel lights.
His vast clouds of mercy cover all; He has given up his body innumerable times. Because of the power of his past eons of practice, This world now has no defilements.
It emanates great light, which abides throughout space; Held by atmospheric power, it doesn’t tremble or quake. It is adorned everywhere by jewels of Buddha’s treasury; The power of Buddha’s vows has made it pure.
Strewn about are flowers of beautiful mines of jewels, Resting in the sky through the power of ancient vows. Over an ocean of various adornments, stable and strong, Clouds of light spread, filling the ten directions.
In all the jewels are clouds of enlightening beings Traveling to all quarters, blazing with light; Rimmed with glowing flames, beautiful flower ornaments Circulate throughout the universe, reaching everywhere.
From all the jewels emanates pure light Which totally illumines the ocean of all beings; Pervading all lands in the ten directions, It frees them from pain and turns them to enlightenment.
The Buddhas in the jewels are equal in number to all beings; From their hair pores they emanate phantom forms: Celestial beings, world rulers, and so on, Including forms of all beings as well as Buddhas.
Their magical light beams are as many as all things; In the light they intone the names of all Buddhas. By various means they teach and civilize, Accommodating all the various minds everywhere.
In each atom of the Flower Bank world Is seen the universe of the elemental cosmos; Jewel lights display Buddhas like masses of clouds: This is the Buddha’s freedom in his field.
The vast cloud of his vows extends throughout the cosmos, Edifying all beings throughout all time. Having completed the practice of the state of knowledge of universal good, All the adornments there are emerge from here.

shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho yongs su dag pas snang ba zhes bya ba ste/ le'u lnga pa'o// //
[6. 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i khor yug gi rgyan rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa'i le'u]

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i khor yug chen po ni/ nor bu rgyal po pad+mo nyi ma'i gzhi la brten pa ste/ nor bu'i rigs rgya mtsho spos kyi tsan+dan thams cad las grub pa/ nor bu'i rgyal po rgyan gyi yul thams cad kyis lhun shin tu 'phags shing zil gyis gnon pa/ nor bu'i spos zhim po gzi brjid kyi 'khor lo rnam par snang ba'i snying po can/ nor bu'i rgyal po rdo rje sra zhing mi shigs pa ltar shin tu mkhregs shing sra ba/ rin po che'i chu thams cad kun nas 'byung ba/ rin po che'i shing gi nags tshal gyi rgyan thams cad me tog shin tu rgyas pa/ spos kyi rtsi mchog bzang po thams cad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ spos kyi me tog dpal can shin tu bzang bas rnam par brgyan pa/ nor bu'i rgyal po 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi dbyings lta bu'i dra bas kun nas bres pa ste/ de dag la sogs pa rgyan bzang po'i rnam pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis rab tu brgyan pa'o/ /

Then Universally Good again addressed the great congregation: “Children of Buddha, the surrounding mountains of this Flower Bank Array ocean of worlds rest on lotus blossoms of sun-pearls. Their mass is made of sandalwood crystals, their peaks of majestic diamonds. Their curves are made of precious stones of exquisite fragrance. They are composed of fiery diamonds. Rivers of all perfumes flow between them. Their forests are made of all kinds of jewels. They are covered with beautiful flowers and fragrant herbs, and studded with bright pearls. Nets of precious stones are draped all around. There are as many such beautiful adornments as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'khor yug gi rgyan dang / yon tan yongs su dag pa 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to recapitulate, Universally Good, the enlightening being, receiving spiritual power from the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said in verse,

'jig rten gyi khams rnams rgya mtsho gang yod pa/ / mtha' dang dbus med sna tshogs rnam pa can/ / nor bu mang pos rnam dag mtha' yas mdog/ / de dag sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul pas byung / /
dri med khor yug rgyan gyis brgyan pa ni/ / nor bu mang po de bzhin spos mang dang / / mu tig gsal ba'i tshogs la rab tu gnas/ / kha dog mtha' yas rin chen rnams kyis brtan/ /
snying po nor bu'i sprin can sna tshogs sra/ / 'dzam bu chu klung 'od 'phro snying po'i tshogs/ / 'od 'phro dam pa phyogs su snang zhing 'tsher/ / khor yug dri ma med pa rnams par mdzes/ /
nor bu rdo rjes shing tu sra shing brtan/ / mtshams rnams mi phyed nor bu sna tshogs 'brul/ / mtshan ldan nor bu rin chen rnam bkod pa/ / rgyan rnams kun gyis yongs su dag par snang / /
spos chu'i sprin gyis kha dog mtha' yas te/ / rin chen tsan+dan me tog kun tu bkram/ / pad+mo sna tshogs gos kyis kun nas yog / rin chen rtsi mchog dri zhim rnams dang ldan/ /
sna tshogs shing gi sprin gyis kun nas brgyan/ / nor bzang kun gyis kun nas gzi brjid 'bar/ / 'od zer sprin gyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can/ / gos kyi mdzod kyis shin tu 'bar bar gnas/ /
spos kyi 'od 'phro bdug pa'i gdugs 'chang ba'i/ / byang chub sems dpa' mang pos chos dbyings gang / / sgra dbyangs mang po rgya mtsho thams cad 'byin/ / 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad chos 'khor lo/ /
rin chen mdzes pa de dag thams cad dang / / nor bu dag dang kun nas 'od 'phro'i shing / / kun la rnam par snang mdzad sku gsal ba/ / gzugs brnyan tshul du nang na yod pa snang / /
thams cad gzugs su sku rnams mtha' yas te/ / sangs rgyas sprul mang kha dog mu med pa/ / thams cad phyogs dang chos kyi dbyings bkang zhing / / sems can mang po tshad med rnam par 'dul/ /
thams cad rgyan las sgra dbyangs kun 'byung ste/ / rnam par snang mdzad smon lam 'khor lo yis/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho yongs su dag byas pa/ / de kun de las rnam par 'phrul zhing grag /

The great ocean of worlds has no bounds; Its circumference of jewels is pure and multicolored. All the adornments it has are of rare beauty; This comes from the spiritual power of the Buddha.
Rings of jewels, rings of exquisite incense, As well as rings of pearls and lamp flames— Various beautiful treasures adorn it, Whereon rest a pure ring of mountains.
Their mines are of solid jewels, They’re decorated with rose gold, Their light blazes throughout the ten directions; Inside and out they shine, all pure and clear.
Made of masses of diamonds, Also raining beautiful jewels, Their jewel atmospheres are unique and different, Radiating pure light beautifying everywhere.
The fragrant rivers divide into streams of infinite hues, Scattering flower-jewels and sandalwood, With lotuses thickly blooming, like clothing spread, And rare plants abundantly growing, all of them aromatic.
Countless jewel trees adorn everywhere, The colors of their blooming flowers radiantly bright; Various kinds of fine raiment are placed thereon, With clouds of light shining everywhere, all round and full.
Countless, boundless great enlightening beings Holding canopies, burning incense, fill the universe, Each producing all wonderful voices Everywhere expounding the Buddhas’ true teaching.
The trees of precious elements have branches of jewels, Each jewel branch emitting light; Vairocana’s pure body Enters therein, causing all to see.
In all the adornments are manifest buddha-bodies Of boundless forms and countless numbers, All going to all quarters, reaching everywhere, The beings they teach also being limitless.
All the adornments emit sublime sounds Expounding the circle of the Buddha’s original vows— Buddha’s independent power causes them to pervade All the pure oceans of lands there are.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las; 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i khor yug gi rgyan rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ste/ le'u drug pa'o// //
[7. 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i sa gzhi'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa'i le'u]

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la khor yug chen po de'i nang ni 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i sa chen po'i gzhi ni/ nor bu mang po'i brgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ rdo rje ltar shin tu mkhregs shing sra la brtan pa/ rin po che'i rigs thams cad las grub pa/ rgya mtshos rnam par phye ba mi shigs pa'i snying po can/ mi mtho ba mi dma' ba'i thang mnyam zhing rnam par dag pa/ nor bu rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog dang 'od thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi lus kyi dbyibs lta bu'i nor bu'i gzugs sna tshogs kyis rab tu bsgrubs pa/ rin po che'i tshon thams cad kyi brgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che yid du 'ong ba'i pad+mo thams cad kyis gzhi byas pa/ dmigs pa thams cad du sna tshogs su gyur pa'i sprin gyis kun nas yog pa/ nor bu'i rgyal po spos kyi mdzod thams cad kyis sa gzhi mnyam par bdal ba/ nor bu'i rgyal po dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing gi rgyan gyis sprin gyi dra ba rnam par bres pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul gyi 'od dang / nor bu'i dra ba mig 'phrul lta bu rnam par phye ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dag la sogs pa sa'i dkyil 'khor de'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu dra ba snyed do/ /

Then Universally Good also said, “The land within the surrounding mountains of this ocean of worlds is all made of diamond. Its stable, strong adornments cannot be broken. It is clean and level. It is fringed by precious stones and contains repositories of jewels. It is arrayed at intervals with all kinds of gems in the various forms of all sentient beings. It is strewn with jewel dust and spread with lotus blossoms, with jewels from fragrant mines placed among them. The various adornments fill everywhere, like clouds. It is decorated with all the embellishments of all the buddha-lands of past, present, and future. It is webbed with beautiful precious stones, which reflect the states of all the Buddhas like the net of Indra, emperor of the heavens, hanging there. The ground of this ocean of worlds has adornments such as these, as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i gzhi'i rgyan rgya mtsho 'di nyid yongs su brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to recapitulate, Universally Good, receiving spiritual power from the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,
sa yi dkyil 'khor gzhi ni rnam par dag mnyam/ / 'khor lo'i dra bas bsgrubs pa mi shigs sra/ / rin chen sna tshogs mnyam pa'i gzhir gnas shing / / rin chen sna tshogs kun gyis kun tu gang / /
That ground is level and utterly pure, Firmly abiding, indestructible; It is adorned with jewels everywhere, With various gemstones interspersed.

yid 'ong sa ni rdo rje gser gyi gzhi/ / rin chen chu bo ri bo'i 'khor los bsgrubs/ /
* * *
pad+mo'i dkyil 'khor gzhi yin me tog sa/ / tsan+dan phye ma rin chen kun tu bkram/ /

The diamond earth is most delightful, Embellished with jewel rings and nets, Spread with lotus blossoms in full bloom, With exquisite raiment covering all.
Enlightening beings’ celestial crowns and jewel necklaces Are spread all over the ground as decorations; Sandalwood-scented jewels are strewn about, All radiating pure, exquisite light.

'od zer sna tshogs rin chen me tog rnams/ / 'od 'phro 'gyed pas phyogs su sprin kyang 'bar/ / sangs rgyas 'od snang nor bu rnam par bkram/ / sa kun me tog yid du 'ong bas yog /
thams cad sprin ni phyogs na stug lding bas/ / mi zad yangs pa kun nas khebs par 'dug / zhing rnams thams cad phyogs rnams kun bkang zhing / / sangs rgyas chos ni snyan par rab tu sgrog /
rin chen nang snang sangs rgyas smon lam kun/ / shin tu dus ring rtag tu kun tu ston/ / sngon chad spyod pa ji 'dra spyod pa dag / kun kyang nor bu'i 'bru las gsal bar snang / /
de yi rgya mtsho nor bu sna tshogs gting / / de yi nang na sangs rgyas spyod yul snang / / sangs rgyas spyod yul de dag zhing gi rnams/ / rgya mtsho kun gyi rdul phran re rer snang / /
me tog snying po tshon gyi 'khor los bsgrubs/ / der ni byang chub sems dpa' rtag 'dong zhing / / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam kun kyang sgrog / snying po byang chub 'khor du rnam 'phrul lo/ /
rin chen 'od zer 'od dang ldan pa dag / sa yi nor bu rgyan las rab tu 'byung / / sangs rgyas chos nyid 'di yang rtag tu ston/ / chos dbyings nam mkha' lta bu kun tu 'gengs/ /
sangs rgyas kun yul ye shes rgya chen dang / / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam sus shes pa/ / de dag phyogs rnams rgya mtsho kun tu yang / / zhing rnams rgya mtsho dbyings kyi 'phrul la 'jug /

Jewel flowers flame, producing subtle light; Flames of light, like clouds, illuminate all. These flowers, and myriad jewels, Are strewn over the ground for adornment.
Dense clouds rise and fill the ten directions With tremendous rays of light that have no end, Reaching all lands in the ten directions Expounding the Buddha’s vivifying teaching.
All the Buddha’s vows are in the jewels Revealing boundless, vast eons; What the Supreme Knower did in days gone by Is all seen within these jewels.
Into all the jewels of this ground Come and enter all the Buddha-fields— And into each atom of those buddha-fields Also enter all lands.
In the Flower Bank world, adorned with wondrous jewels Enlightening beings travel throughout the ten directions, Expounding the universal vows of the Great Hero: This is their power of freedom in enlightenment sites.
The ground arrayed with beautiful precious stones Radiates pure light replete with all adornments Filling the cosmos, equal to space; Buddha’s power naturally manifests like this.
Those who master the vows of universal good, Those of great knowledge who enter the Buddha’s realm, Can know, in this ocean of lands, All such mystic transformations as these.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i sa gzhi'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ste/ le'u bdun pa'o// //
[8. zhing gi rgyud kyi gnas shin tu bstan pa'i le'u]

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i gzhi sa'i dkyil 'khor de la spos chu'i rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod de/ de dag kun kyang gzhi rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o/ / nor bu'i rgyal po dang spos thams cad kyis klung rab tu bsgrubs pa'o/ / nor bu'i rgyal po bzang zhing yid du 'ong ba'i 'od rnam par snang ba'i dra bas kun nas bres pa'o/ / rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog dang mchog tu snang ba'i spos kyi chus yongs su rgyas pa'o/ / rin po che thams cad kyi me tog sna tshogs klong du 'khyil pa'o/ / tsan+dan gyi phye ma dang 'dres pa'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung gi dkyil 'khor dang / smon lam rgya mtsho'i sgra 'byin pa'o/ / rin po che thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin rnam par snang ba'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi sprin me tog sna tshogs kyi kha dog lta bur rab tu 'gyed pa'o/ / kha dog dang dbyibs mtha' yas pa'i gdugs kyis khebs par rnam par 'phrul pas brgyan pa'o/ / dmigs pa thams cad la 'jig rten gyi khams mang po rgya chen po thams cad snang ba'o/ / phyogs kun nas rin po che'i them skas kyi phreng ba bcur rab tu bkye ba'o/ / mu tig rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog lta bu'i mu khyud kyis kun nas bskor ba'o; ; rin po che shel gyi rgyal mtshan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa bcus kun nas brgyan pa'o/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu dang / me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa chu klung gang+gA'i klung gi bye ma snyed kha dog mtha' yas pa bcus kun nas bskor ba'o/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu thams cad kyi pad+mo yid du 'ong ba'i grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcus kun nas bskor ba'o/ / 'di lta ste/ nor bu rdo rje shin tu sra ba'i gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis rab tu bsgrubs pa'o/ / rin po che thams cad kyi me tog puN+Da rI ka dang / spos kyi chu yongs su rgyas pas kun nas bskor ba'o/ / 'di lta ste/ rin po che'i shing gi phreng ba rin po che 'bar zhing kun nas 'phyang ba'i nor bu'i dra ba can gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis kun nas bskor ba'o/ / tsan+dan dang / spos dang / nor bu mang po sgra thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi phyag gis rnam par snang bar byas pa/ chu klung gang+gA'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis 'gram shin tu brgyan pa'o/ / 'di lta ste/ rin po che dang / gos dang / rgyal mtshan dang / dril bu mang po thams cad kyi sgra 'byung bas rgyan shin tu rgyas pa'o/ / rin po che yid du 'ong ba'i nor bu thams cad kyi ra ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pas kun nas bskor ba'o/ /

Then Universally Good also said to the assembly, “In the land masses of this ocean of worlds are seas of fragrant waters, as numerous as atoms in unspeakably many buddha-fields. All beautiful jewels adorn the floors of those seas; gems of exquisite fragrances adorn their shores. They are meshed with luminous diamonds. Their fragrant waters shine with the colors of all jewels. Flowers of all kinds of gems swirl on their surfaces. Sandalwood powder settles on the bottom of the seas. They emanate the sounds of Buddhas’ speech. They radiate jewellike light. Boundless enlightening beings, holding various canopies, manifest mystic powers causing the adornments of all worlds to appear therein. Stairways of ten kinds of precious substances are set out in rows, with balustrades of ten kinds of jewels surrounding them. White lotuses ornamented with jewels, as many as atoms in four continents, are spread over the waters, in full bloom. There are unspeakable hundreds of thousands of billions of trillions of banners of ten precious elements, banners of belled gauze of raiments of all jewels, as many as sand grains in the Ganges river, jewel flower palaces of boundless forms, as many as sand grains in the Ganges river, a hundred thousand billion trillion lotus castles of ten precious substances, forests of jewel trees as many as atoms in four continents, networks of flaming jewels, as many sandalwood perfumes as grains of sand in the Ganges, and jewels of blazing radiance emitting the sounds of Buddhas’ speech; unspeakable hundreds of thousands of billions of trillions of walls made of all jewels surround all of them, adorning everywhere.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang spos chu rgya mtsho'i rgyan 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to reiterate, Universally Good, spiritually empowered by the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

sa steng de na spos kyi chu bo yis/ / rgya mtsho nor bus brgyan pa rnam brjod de/ / gzhi rnams rin chen gos kyis kun bting ba/ / mi shigs rdo rje lta bu sra zhing mdzes/ /
spos dang nor bu'i rgyal po mang po dang / / nyi ma'i nor bu 'od 'phro stug sprin dang / / pad+mo rin chen phreng ba'ang kun nas bres/ / gzhi rnams dri med yid du 'ong ba'o; /
spos kyi chu yis yongs su rgyas pa ste/ / rin chen 'od zer sna tshogs me tog klong / / sgra dbyangs rab tu gtong ba'i dbyangs kyis kyang / / sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul ba rab tu sgrog /
them skas phreng ba yid du 'ong dang ldan/ / gzhi ni rin chen nor bu mang pos brgyan/ / stegs bu kun bkod rin chen pad+mo yi/ / sprin stug dra ba rnam par bres pa ste/ /
rin chen nor bu'i shing gi phreng ba dag / rin chen gser gyi kha dog yid 'ong 'bar/ / 'od kyi tshogs dang rol mo'i sgra dag kyang / / rnam par 'phrul mang dbyangs su rab tu sgrog /
spos chus yongs gang rin chen bsgrubs pa ste/ / me tog puN+Da rI kas kun nas bskor/ / spos dang 'od dang bdug spos 'od zer 'gyed/ / de dag 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par yangs/ /
rin chen rgyal mtshan mu tig 'bar ba can/ / gos dang nor bu sna tshogs kun 'phyang zhing / / rin chen nor bu'i dril bu dra ba dag / thams cad mkhyen par 'jug pa'i sgra yang sgrog /
pad+mo'i grong khyer rnams kyis kun nas bskor/ / kha dog mtha' yas nor bus rnam par brgyan/ / phyogs rnams kun nas mu tig sprin bkye zhing / / grong khyer rgya mtshos de dag rab tu brgyan/ /
dra ba bzang pos kun nas bskor ba ste/ / rin chen byas pa'i gzugs bzang khyab kyi bar/ / rnam pa du mar 'bar zhing yid 'ong ba'i/ / rgya mtshos bzang zhing mdzes par rab tu brgyan/ /
sngon chad sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad kyis/ / sna tshogs rgya mtsho'i zhing rnams yongs sbyangs pa/ / shin tu rgya che mtha' dang dbus med pa'ang / / de dag kun na rnam par 'phrul pa byed/ /

On the land masses of these worlds Are seas of fragrant water, adorned by jewels; Pure beautiful gems line the sea floors, Resting on diamond, indestructible.
Heaps of jewels of fragrant mines form the shores, Orbs of sun-flame pearls are spread like clouds; Garlands of lotuses and exquisite jewels Adorn everywhere, pure, without taint.
The fragrant waters are clear and contain all colors; Precious flowers swirl, radiating light. Sounds that cause all to quake are heard far and near, Expounding the subtle truth by the Buddha’s mystic powers.
The arrays of stairways contain all jewels And are studded at intervals with pearls; The surrounding balustrades are all made of jewels With nets of lotuses and pearls draped like clouds.
Gemstone trees stand in rows, Flower buds blossom, their luster bright; Various music is always playing: Buddha’s mystic power makes it so.
White lotuses of various superb jewels Are spread in arrays on the fragrant water seas. Rays of fragrant flames never cease: Their vast auras fill everywhere.
Banners of bright pearls, ever radiant, Drapes of fine clothing ornamenting, Nets of crystal bells intone the sound of truth, Causing hearers to head for buddha-knowledge.
Lotuses of jewels form castles Adorned with multicolored gems, While clouds of pearls shade the four corners, Thus adorning the seas of fragrant waters.
Walls surround everything With facing towers arrayed on them. Countless lights are always shining, Variously adorning the pure clear seas.
Vairocana, in ancient times, Beautified and purified various oceans of lands Like this, vast, broad, without bounds: All is the Buddha’s sovereign power.

spos chu rgya mtsho de dag re re zhing yang spos chu'i chu klung g.yas phyogs su 'khor zhing 'bab pa/ gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis 'khor bar byas pa ste/ spos chu'i chu klung de dag thams cad kyang 'khor kun nas rdo rje'i pad+mo kha dog dang dri mtha' yas pas bsgrubs pa'o/ / nor bu'i 'khor lo dang; nor bu'i 'od rnam par dag pa sna tshogs kyis mtha' kun nas dkris pa'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog lta bus rnam par snang bar byas pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin dang ldan pa'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi sgra dbyangs sgrog pa'i dril bu'i dra ba rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog tu 'dug pas kun nas khebs pa'o; ; spyod pa'i 'od kyi klong sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mtshan gyi dbyibs lta bu rab tu 'byung ba'o/ / nor bu'i rgyal po rgyan thams cad nang na snang zhing 'od shin tu 'bar ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho lta bur snang ba thams cad kyis shin tu yog par byas pa'o/ / nor bu'i rgyal po phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rnam par snang pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i snying po'i me tog shin tu rgyas pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ / dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan gyi 'khor lo dbyangs su sgrog pa'o/ / spos kyi chu dang rin po che 'od 'phro ba thams cad kyi 'od dang / 'od zer gyi sprin rab tu 'byung ba ste/ chu klung de dag re re zhing yang rgyan shin tu bstan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do/ /

Then Universally Good went on to say to the great congregation, “Each one of the fragrant seas has as many rivers of fragrant waters as there are atoms in four continents, circling them to the right. All of them have diamond banks adorned with crystals of pure light, always manifesting clouds of jewel color lights of the Buddhas, as well as the speech sounds of all sentient beings. The causal practices cultivated by the Buddhas, their various forms and characteristics, all emerge from the swirls in the rivers. There are networks of crystals and chimes of many jewels, wherein appear the adornments of all the oceans of worlds. Clouds of jewels cover them above: those clouds show all the phantom Buddhas emanated in the ten directions by Vairocana of the Flower Bank world, as well as the deeds of psychic power of all Buddhas; they also produce miraculous sounds extolling the names of the enlightened and enlightening beings of past, present, and future. From those fragrant waters constantly emerge clouds of light with the radiance of all jewels, continuing uninterrupted. If the full story be told, each river has as many adornments as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang spos chu'i chu klung gi rgyan dang / yon tan rgya mtsho 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to reiterate, Universally Good, with the psychic power he received from the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

chu klung dri ma med pa'i chus rgyas shing / / gzhi ni nor bu'i rdo rje pad+mos byas/ / rin chen mang po sil bus gzhi bkram zhing / / kun nas brgyan pa sna tshogs yid du 'ong / /
them skas phreng bas de dag kun nas bskor/ / pad+mo'i phyang ba'i mu khyud 'khor can te/ / me tog brgyan pa'i mu tig phreng ba dang / / me tog lda ldis sna tshogs kun nas bres/ /
nor bu'i chu bo spos chu 'byung ba ni/ / rin chen kun gyi kha dog mdog ltar 'bab/ / rin chen nor bu me tog mdzes par bkod/ / sil snyan sgra ni sangs rgyas gsung skad brjod/ /
de dag rnyog pa nor bu zla ba ste/ / rin chen sna tshogs thams cad dba' klong ngo/ / phyogs rnams bcu po kun tu rtag par yang / / spos dang bdug pa 'od 'phro'i rgyan 'byung ngo/ /
chu bo rnams las rin chen thams cad kyi/ / 'od zer 'phro ba kun tu rab tu 'byung / / me tog nor bu'i phung po gdugs rnams kyang / / rin chen kun gyi gzer du rab tu 'bar/ /
phyogs bcu'i zhing gi gzugs brnyan mang po dang / / sangs rgyas gzugs brnyan rin chen rnams las snang / / rin chen 'khor lo'i gzhi rten yid 'ong las/ / spos chus rgyas pa'i chu klung rnams kyang 'bab/ /
rin chen gser gyi dril bu'i dra ba yis/ / yog cing sangs rgyas gsung du sgra sgrog 'bab/ / rgyal ba kun gyi byang chub spyod pa dang / / kun tu bzang po'i spyod mchog rab tu 'dzud/ /
sangs rgyas smon lam sgra dbyangs rnam pa dang / / sangs rgyas thams cad sngon gyi sbyor ba dag / rnam dag nor bu'i ngos dang ngogs kun nas/ / sgra rnams sgrog pa kun na rab tu snang / /
chu bo thams cad dba' klong dag las kyang / / byang chub sems dpa'i sprin chen 'bar bdag / chos kyi dbyings rnams rab tu rgyas byed pa/ / 'byams klas phyogs rnams kun na rab tu snang / /
chu klung de dag thams cad dri med cing / / nor bu'i rgyal po sprin gyis kun khyab pa/ / mdzod spu'i dpal dang sangs rgyas gzi brjid 'bar/ / nor bu'i rgyal po sangs rgyas gzugs brnyan snang / /

Currents of pure fragrance fill the great rivers, Beautiful diamonds form their banks. Rings of jewel dust are spread on the ground; The various ornaments are all rare and fine.
Jewel stairways arrayed in rows, beautifully adorned, Balustrades surrounding, all extremely fine, Flower decorations, with stores of pearls, And various garlands draped all around.
The fragrant waters’ jewellike luster is pure, Always spewing crystals in rushing currents; The flowers undulate with the ripples, All producing music intoning sublime truths.
The mud is made of sandalwood powder, All splendid jewels swirl together; Aromas of stores of scent spread therein, Emitting flames circulating fragrance everywhere.
In the rivers are produced wonderful jewels, All emitting lights of blazing color; The lights cast reflections forming terrace seats Complete with canopies and garlands of pearls.
In the diamonds appear bodies of Buddhas, Their lights illumining the ten directions’ lands; Circles of them decorate the river beds, Always full of fragrant water, clear.
Crystal nets, bells of gold, Cover the rivers, broadcasting Buddha’s voice, Preaching all ways to enlightenment And the sublime practice of universal good.
The crystals of the jewel banks are extremely pure, And always produce the tones of the Buddhas’ original vows, Telling of and showing The past deeds of all Buddhas.
From the whirls of those rivers enlightening beings Constantly emerge, like clouds, All traveling in the vast, extensive lands, Till all the universe is filled.
Pure pearls are spread like clouds Covering all the fragrant rivers; Those pearls are as many as the appearances from Buddha’s brow, Clearly showing the images of all enlightened ones.

spos chu'i chu klung de dag gi bar dag kyang sa sna tshogs la rin po che thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa ste/ chu klung gi bar de dag re re zhing yang rin po che'i me tog puN+Da rI ka'i phreng ba gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis kun nas bskor ba'o/ / chu klung gi bar de dag re re zhing yang rin po che'i shing gi phreng ba gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis rnam par phye ba'o/ / shing gi gseb thams cad nas kyang rgyan thams cad kyi sprin rtag par rab tu 'byung ste/ nor bu'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa'i dpal 'byung ba'i sprin dang / 'od rnams kyang rab tu 'byung ngo/ / shing gi bar de dag thams cad kyang 'od shin tu 'bar ba ste/ spos dang / me tog sna tshogs kyis rab tu gang ba'o/ / nor bu'i rgyal po sangs rgyas thams cad kyis smon lam bskal pa thams cad du byin gyis rlob pa'i sgra sgrog pa'i sprin gyis yongs su gang ba'o/ / spos 'od 'phro ba'i sprin gyi 'od zer gyis rnam par snang bar byed pa'i sprin gyis mngon par khyab pa'o/ / spos kyi rgyal po yid du 'ong ba sna tshogs kyis rnam par rgyas pa'o; ; nor bu'i rgyal po rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i kha dog yang dag par ston pas mnyam pa nyid du mngon par gang ba'o/ / gos kyi tshogs sna tshogs sprin lta bus mngon par yog pa'o/ / nor bu'i rgyal po phyogs bcur 'od zer gyi dra ba'i sprin gyis yog par byed pas rnam par rgyas pa'o/ / nor bu'i rgyal po sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i 'od kyis mngon par gang ba'o/ / nor bu'i rgyal po sems can thams cad kyi las rnam par smin pa rgya mtsho'i gzugs brnyan shin tu ston pas rgyas pa ste/ de dag la sogs pa chu klung gi bar de dag re re zhing yang rgyan shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do/ /

Then Universally Good also said to the great assembly, “The land in between these rivers of fragrant waters is all variously adorned with beautiful jewels. Each land space has as many white lotuses decorated with jewels as there are atoms in four continents, surrounding and filling everywhere. Each has as many forests of jewel trees as atoms in four continents, standing in orderly rows, with each tree constantly producing clouds of all ornaments, diamonds shining within them. The fragrances of all kinds of flowers fill everywhere. Those trees also produce subtle sounds, speaking of the great vows practiced by all the Buddhas in all ages. They also scatter various kinds of diamonds all over the ground: diamonds with lotus auras, fragrant flame light cloud diamonds, variously embellished diamonds, diamonds reflecting the colors of inconceivably many adornments, diamonds like stores of raiment of sunlight, diamonds draping clouds of webs of light throughout the ten directions, diamonds reflecting the spiritual metamorphoses of all Buddhas, diamonds reflecting the ocean of consequences of actions of all sentient beings. There are as many of such as these as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds. The lands in between the fragrant rivers all have such adornments.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang spos chu'i chu klung gi bar gyi rgyan yongs su dag pa rgya mtsho 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so; ;
Then, to reiterate, Universally Good, receiving spiritual power from the Buddha, looked over the ten directions and said,

chu klung bar rnams shin tu rnam par dag / rin chen rgyan can gser gyis rnam par bres/ / yal ga me tog sprin rnams 'phyang lding ba'i/ / shing gi phreng bas kun nas mngon par khyab/ /
shing gi yal ga'i dkyil 'khor sgo dag nas/ / rin chen mang po'i sprin rnams kun kyang 'byung / / me tog 'od mang rin chen snying po can/ / phyogs rnams kun sgor 'gro ba khyab par byed/ /
gzhi rnams nor bu mngon par bkram pa ste/ / me tog rnam bres rin chen 'bru dang ldan/ / kun nas rin chen sprin gyis khyab pa ste/ / rgyan dang sems can thams cad gzugs brnyan snang / /
sangs rgyas 'od kyi nor bu'i rgyal po yis/ / sa rnams thams cad kun nas rnam par gang / / phyogs rnams thams cad 'bar zhing snang ba'i sprin/ / rdul phran kun la gzugs brnyan gyur bar snang / /
nor bu'i rgyan gyis shin tu rnam par rgyas/ / mu tig gsal ba'i dra bas rnam par phye/ / nor bu'i 'khor lo kun nas rab tu bkod/ / kun na rgyal ba rnam par 'phrul ba snang / /
'byams klas 'od zer ldan pa'i rin chen gyis/ / sangs rgyas sprul pa bkye ba kun na snang / / sangs rgyas mang pos phyogs rnams kun khyab cing / / stobs bcu mnga' ba'i chos nyid rab tu sgrog /
rin chen sna tshogs puN+Da rI ka yis/ / chu rnams kun rgyas po nor bu spos/ / de las mi zad 'od zer rgya mtsho'i rnams/ / rab tu 'byung ba'i pad+mo sna tshogs 'byung / /
dus rnams gsum po'i rgyan rnams thams cad kyang / / nor bu de dag 'bru yi nang na ste/ / 'byung ba med cing gzung du'ang yod pa min/ / de ni sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul ba'i mthu/ /
rgyal ba rnam par snang mdzad thams cad du/ / rgyan dang sprul pa thams cad rab tu 'gyed/ / sngon chad sangs rgyas smon lam mthu dag gis/ / de dag 'gro zhing 'ong bar snang ba med; ;
rdul rnams rgya mtsho thams cad dag la yang / / rgyal sras thams cad spyad pa rab spyod de/ / rang gi zhing dang lung bstan sa yi rnams/ / bsam pa rnam dag tshul bzhin de dag mthong / /

The land is level and thoroughly pure, Garnished with gold and jewels. Trees in rows shade the land, With soaring trunks hung with branches and flowers like clouds.
The twigs and stems are adorned with gems, The glow of their flowers make auras illumining all around; Their fruits, of crystal, hang like clouds, Making all in the ten directions visible.
Diamonds are spread over the ground, Adorning together with jewel pollen from the flowers. There are also crystal palaces, Showing the reflected images of all beings.
Diamonds reflecting the images of Buddhas Are scattered all over the ground; Their luster pervades the ten directions, Revealing Buddhas in each and every atom.
Arrays of exquisite jewels are distributed well, Interspersed with networks of pearl lamps. Everywhere are crystal orbs Each showing the Buddhas’ powers.
The arrays of jewels radiate light In which appear the phantom buddhas, Each one traveling everywhere And teaching with the ten powers.
White lotuses of jewels Fill all the waters, Their blooms all various, Each shining endless light.
All adornments of all ages Appear in the crystal fruits; Their essential nature, unborn, cannot be grasped: This is the sovereign power of Buddha.
All the adornments on this ground Manifest the vast body of Buddha: It neither comes nor goes, But causes all to see by the power of Buddha’s ancient vows.
In each atom of this ground All Buddha-children cultivate the Way; All see the lands predicted for their futures, All of them pure according to their wishes.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i dmigs pa dag la'ang dmigs pa re re zhing yongs su dag pa'i yon tan dang / rgyan shin tu bstan pa rgya mtsho ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya'o/ /

Then Universally Good went on to declare, “The adornments of the ocean of worlds of the Buddha are inconceivable. Why? Each object in this Flower Bank Array ocean of worlds is adorned by as many pure qualities as there are atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho yongs su dag cing / yon tan mtha' dang dbus med pas yon tan rnam par dag pa'i rgyan shin tu bstan pa rgya mtsho 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to reiterate this point, Universally Good, imbued with spiritual power from the Buddha, surveyed the ten directions and said,

zhing gi rgya mtsho 'di rnams thams cad kyang / / rin chen rgyan can 'od zer gnas pa ste/ / stug cing gsal ba'i sprin gyis kun nas yog / rin chen thams cad 'od kyang rnam par 'bar/ /
mu tig nor bu'i sprin mang zad mi shes/ / sangs rgyas gzugs brnyan phyogs su rnam par snang / / zhing na yod pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rnams/ / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu ston pa byed/ /
sangs rgyas gsung gi sprin ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / nor bu'i rgyal po thams cad snyan par sgrog / rnam par snang mdzad sngon gyi spyod pa rnams/ / rin chen rnams la rtag par snang zhing grags/ /
sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad dri med 'od/ / rgyan rnams thams cad nang na rnam par snang / / 'khor rnams gzugs brnyan mtshan nyid 'chang ba dang / / sprul pa rnams kyi zhing gi rgya mtsho gang / /

Every place in this ocean of lands Is embellished with myriad jewels, Their flames leaping into the sky, spreading like clouds, Their light penetrating, always covering all.
Jewels spew clouds without end Wherein appear images of all Buddhas; Their mystic powers and metamorphoses never stop, And all enlightening beings come and gather.
All the jewels broadcast Buddha’s voice, The sound exquisite, inconceivable; What Vairocana did in the past Is always heard and seen within these jewels.
The universal illuminators with pure auras All show their forms reflected in the ornaments; Transforming, distributing their bodies, surrounded by congregations, They reach throughout all oceans of lands.

sangs rgyas sprul pa rnams ni sgyu ma 'dra/ / de dag la ni byon pa gang yang med/ / sangs rgyas yul rnams byin gyis brlabs pa yi/ / zhing rnams kun nas sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul/ /
zhing rnams 'byams klas par ni rnam 'phrul zhing / / ji snyed zhing du de dag kun rgyu ba/ / de dag nor bu kun la rab tu snang / / de ltar zhing rnams rgya mtsho rnam par sbyangs/ /

Buddha’s independent deeds of spiritual powers
* * *
All pervade the lands of the ten directions; Thereby are the oceans of lands purely adorned: All of this is seen within the jewels.

sprul pa rnams ni mig yor 'dra ba ste/ / thams cad dag na chos nyid 'di yang snang / / 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad spyod yul te/ / smon lam rnam par 'phrul las byung ba'o/ /
bzang po'i spyod pas gang rnams byung gyur pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa' shes mchog rgya mtsho can/ / de dag rdul phran kun la rang rang gis/ / rang gi zhing rnams rgya mtsho dag par byed/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi zham ring du/ / bskal pa bye ba rgya chen bsam yas su/ / de dag spyod yul thams cad mthong bas na/ / skad cig sems la de dag thams cad ston/ /
zhing rnams mnyam med 'byung ba med pa ste/ / de dag mtha' 'dra mnyam zhing mtshan nyid med/ / smon lam stobs kyis kun tu gnas pa ste/ / sems can rnams la phan phyir rab tu sbyangs/ /

The mystic displays in the ten directions Are all like images in a mirror; They just come from the spiritual will power Exercised by the Buddha in the past.
If any can practice the deeds of universal goodness And enter the enlightening beings’ ocean of supreme knowledge, They can, in a single atom, Manifest their bodies everywhere and purify many lands.
For inconceivable billions of eons Having associated with all the Buddhas, Everything they practice Can be shown in a single instant.
The Buddhas’ lands are like space, Peerless, unborn, without any signs— To aid living beings, they beautify and purify lands, Dwelling therein by the power of their original vows.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dgod pa shin tu bstan pa gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams spos chu'i rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu gnas te/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud de dag re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa de dag thams cad kyang gzhan dang gzhan la gnas pa/ dbyibs gzhan dang gzhan du 'dug pa/ phyogs gzhan dang gzhan la lta ba/ rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis 'jug pa/ rgyan gzhan dang gzhan yod pa/ gzhan dang gzhan gyis rgyas par 'gengs pa/ gzhan dang gzhan du 'du ba rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du ma 'dres pa/ rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byin gyi rlabs gzhan dang gzhan yod pa dag ste;

Then Universally Good went on to say, “What worlds are there herein? I’ll tell you. In these seas of fragrant waters, numerous as atoms in unspeakably many buddha-fields, rest an equal number of world systems. Each world system also contains an equal number of worlds. Those world systems in the ocean of worlds have various resting places, various shapes and forms, various substances and essences, various locations, various entryways, various adornments, various boundaries, various alignments, various similarities, and various powers of maintenance.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ pad+mo'i rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni; rin po che kha dog mtha' yas pa'i me tog rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ rin po che'i phreng ba mu tig gi 'bru'i snying po can gyi rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ spos chu'i rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni; me tog thams cad kyi rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ nor bu rin po che'i dra ba'i rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ 'od zer gyi rgya mtsho klong du gyur pa'i chu bo la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i nor bu'i cod pan sna tshogs kyi rgyan la rab tu gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ sems can gyi lus sna tshogs rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas so; ; 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung nor bu'i rgyal po la rab tu gnas so/ / de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa'i gnas shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do/ /

“Some of these world systems rest on seas of gigantic lotuses, some rest on seas of jewel flowers of boundless forms, some rest on seas of ornaments of treasures from repositories of all pearls, some rest on seas of perfume, some rest on seas of all flowers, some rest on seas of crystal webs, some rest on seas of swirling light, some rest on seas of enlightening beings’ jewelled crowns, some rest on seas of the bodies of all the various living beings, some rest on diamonds emanating the sounds of the voices of all Buddhas. There are as many of these, if fully expounded, as atoms in an ocean of worlds.

'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad kyang dbyibs gzhan dang gzhan du 'dug pa sha stag ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa la la ni/ ri rab kyi dbyings lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ chu klung gi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ kun tu 'khor ba'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ kun nas 'khyil ba'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ 'khor ba'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ mig mang ris kyi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ shing gi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ rdo'i rgyal mtshan gyi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ phyogs 'byams klas pa'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ khang pa'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ pad+mo'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ rta babs kyi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ sems can gyi lus kyi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ sprin gyi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ sangs rgyas kyi mtshan gyi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ dra ba sna tshogs bkye ba'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ sgo kun nas yog pa'i dbyibs lta bu'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la ni/ dmigs pa thams cad kyi dbyibs lta bu ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa'i dbyibs rnam par phye ba shin tu bstan pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed do/ /

“Some of these world systems are shaped like high mountains, some like rivers, some like whorls, some like whirlpools, some like wheel rims, some like altars, some like forests, some like palaces, some like mountain banners, some like all geometric figures, some like wombs, some like lotus blossoms, some like baskets, some like bodies of sentient beings, some like clouds, some like the distinguishing features of Buddhas, some like spheres of light, some like webs of various pearls, some like all doors, some like various ornaments. Their shapes, if fully told of, number as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i tshul de dag ni/ lhun gzhan dang gzhan du bstan pa ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ phyogs thams cad kyi nor bu'i sprin gyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ 'od kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ rin po che dang spos 'od 'phro ba thams cad kyi lhun can no; ; 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi me tog kha sprod las bsgrubs pa'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gzugs brnyan gyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni; rin po che'i 'od kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sangs rgyas kyi kha dog gi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog gi 'od kyi lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams rgya mtsho yang dag par 'byung ba'i sgra'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtsho yang dag par 'byung ba'i sgra'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa'i sgra'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam gyi rgya mtsho'i sgra'i lhun can no; ; 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sangs rgyas kyi tshul thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i sgra'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ zhing gi rgyan thams cad 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i sgra'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang dbyangs mtha' dang dbus med pa'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i sgra'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sems can thams cad kyi dge ba 'byung ba'i sgra'i lhun can no/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshul la la ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rgya mtsho yongs su dag pa'i sgra'i lhun can no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'byams klas pa'i tshul gyis lus ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya'o/ /

“As for the substances of these world systems, some are made of clouds of jewels of all quarters, some of multicolored flames, some of light beams, some of flames of precious scents, some of cotton flowers adorned by all jewels, some of images of enlightening beings, some of auras of Buddhas, some of physical forms of Buddhas, some of the light of one precious element, some of the lights of many precious elements, some of the sounds of the sea of blessings and virtues of all living beings, some of the sounds of the sea of actions of all living beings, some of the pure sounds of the sphere of all Buddhas, some of the sounds of the sea of great vows of all enlightening beings, some of the sounds of the formation and disintegration of the adornments of all lands, some of the sounds of the methods and techniques of all Buddhas, some of the sounds of the voices of boundless Buddhas, some of the voices of goodness of all sentient beings, some of the sounds of the mystical demonstrations of all Buddhas, some of the pure sounds of the ocean of virtue of all Buddhas. If fully told, there as many of these as atoms in an ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'byams klas pa'i tshul gyis lus rnam par dgod pa shin tu bstan pa 'di nyid gsal bar brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te; de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Universally Good, to reiterate what he meant, looked over the ten directions by the power bestowed on him by the Buddha and said in verse,

The stable, marvelous adornments of the systems of worlds, Vast, pure treasuries of light, Rest on seas of lotus blossom jewels Or on perfume seas, and so on.
Shaped like mountains, cities, trees, altars, The world systems extend in all directions, Their various adornments and shapes different, Each set out in arrays.
Pure light is the substance of some; Some, flower banks, and some, clouds of jewels; Some world systems are made of flames, Resting in indestructible mines of jewels.
Clouds of lamps, colored lights of flames, and more: Various, boundless forms, all pure; Some are composed of sound, Of the inconceivable teachings of Buddha.
Some are sound produced by the power of vows, Some of sounds of miraculous displays, Some are those of beings’ virtues, Or the sounds of Buddhas’ qualities.
The individual different aspects of the world systems Are inconceivable, without end. The ten directions are filled with them, Their vast adornments manifesting spiritual powers.
All the immense lands of the ten directions Enter into this system of worlds; Though we see all in the ten directions enter, Really there is no coming and no entry.
One world system enters all, And all completely enter one; Their substances and characteristics remain as before, no different: Incomparable, immeasurable, they all pervade everywhere.
In the atoms of all lands Are seen Buddhas existing there; The voices of their oceans of vows are like thunder, Subduing all sentient beings.
The Buddha’s body pervades all lands, Which are also filled by countless enlightening beings; The Buddha’s freedom has no equal, Edifying all conscious creatures.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ zhing gi rgyud kyi gnas shin tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ste/ le'u brgyad pa'o// //
bam po dgu pa/
[9. 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rnam par dgod pa shin tu bstan pa'i le'u]

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gang chen mtsho'i dbyings de na spos chu'i rgya mtsho mig 'phrul gyi rnam pas rnam par phye ba gzhi kun la rab tu gnas pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la gang chen mtsho'i dbyings kyi spos chu'i rgya mtsho'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi nang na spos chu'i rgya mtsho dbus ma ni/ ze ba yid du 'ong zhing 'od zer mtha' yas pa zhes bya ste/ de'i nang nas nor bu'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lus rnam par dmigs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rgyal mtshan gyi pad+mo chen po gzhi spos dang / nor bu'i rgyal po thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i rgyan can zhes bya ba mngon par byung ste/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud phyogs kun nas rin po che 'bar ba'i 'od rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba/ dmigs pa thams cad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i lhun can rab tu gnas te/ de dag las thams cad kyi 'og ma ni/ dpal 'byung ba'i 'od zer rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams te/ de ni/ rdo rje thams cad kyi rgyun dang / 'od kyi 'khor lo'i sa mtshams nor bu rin po che'i ze ba mang po la rab tu gnas pa/ nor bu'i 'khor thams cad dang / rin po che'i me tog gi rgyan thams cad kyis rab tu yog par gyur pa ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams de dag kyang gzhan dang gzhan la gnas pa/ rgyan gzhan dang gzhan can dag ste/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa tshul rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa'i mar me zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ /

Then Universally Good said, “These seas of fragrant waters, numerous as atoms in unspeakably many buddha-fields, are in the Flower Bank Array ocean of worlds, spread out like the net of Indra, king of the gods. The sea of fragrant water in the very center is called Boundless Light of Beautiful Flowers. Its floor is made of diamond banners reflecting the forms of all enlightening beings. It produces huge lotuses called Diamond Adornments of All Scents. There is a system of worlds resting on it called Blazing Light Illuming the Ten Directions; composed of all ornaments, it contains as many worlds as atoms in unspeakably many buddha-fields, arrayed therein. In the nadir is a world called Supreme Light Shining Everywhere, adorned by all kinds of diamonds, bounded by a circle of light, resting on flowers of many jewels, shaped like a crystal, covered with clouds of arrays of flowers of all gems, surrounded by worlds as numerous as atoms in a buddha-field, with various structures and various adornments. The Buddha of this world is called Undefiled Lamp of the Eye of Purity.

de'i steng 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams spos sna tshogs kyi pad+mo dpal gyi rgyan ces bya ba rgyan thams cad kyi sa mtshams can/ rin po che'i pad+mo shin tu mang ba la rab tu gnas pa/ seng+ge'i khri'i dbyibs ltar 'dug pa/ mu tig gi 'bru rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog lta bu'i bla re'i sprin gyis kun nas yog pa/ kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gnyis kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa seng+ge'i 'od zer mchog gi 'od ces bya ba bzhugs so/ /

“Above this, past worlds as numerous as atoms in a buddha-field, is a world called Beautiful Array of Lotus Flowers of Various Scents, bounded by all kinds of ornaments, resting on a network of jewel lotus blossoms, shaped like a lion throne, covered with nets of pearls of the colors of all jewels, surrounded by as many worlds as atoms in two buddha-fields. The Buddha is called Supreme Radiance of Lion Light.

de'i steng sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba spos kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sa mtshams can/ rin po che'i me tog gi phreng ba sna tshogs la rab tu gnas pa nor bu'i 'khor lo gzi brjid bzang po'i nyi ma'i sprin gyis kun nas yog pa/ yan lag brgyad du dma' ba'i dbyibs can/ 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gsum gyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba/ rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi dpal zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ /
