chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho yid du 'ong bar gram bu'i nor bu mu tig rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud dbyangs kyis kun tu sgrog pa'i nga ro la dga' ba zhes bya ba rab tu gnas te/

“Beyond the sea of fragrant water Jewel Array is a sea of fragrant water called Treasury of Light Supporting the Polar Mountain, with a world system called Producing Immense Clouds. Next to that is a sea of fragrant water called Variously Adorned Realm of Great Power, with a world system called Adornments of Unobstructed Purity. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Thickly Spread Jewel Lotus Blossoms, with a world system called Supreme Lamp Array. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Resting on Adornments of All Jewels, with a world system called Treasury of Sunlight Webs. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Manifold Beatification, with a world system called Resting Place of Jewel Flowers. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Exercise of Extremely Brilliant Intellect, with a world system called Array of Superlative Forms. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Mountain Peak Holding Beautiful Precious Stones, with a world system called Universally Pure Treasury of Space. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Great Light Illumining Everywhere, with a world system called Sapphire Torch Light. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Filled with Delightful Jewels Illuminating Everywhere, with a world system called Ubiquitous Roar.

de dag la sogs pa spos chu'i rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi phyi rol khor yug gi mtshams na spos chu'i rgya mtsho in+d+ra nI la rab tu 'gyed pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud phyogs kun tu snang zhing tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos yang dag par 'byung bar nga ro sgrog pa'i lhun can rab tu gnas te/ de thams cad kyi 'og na 'jig rten gyi khams dge ba dam pa'i snying po zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba/ gcig tu dag pa yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan mchog gi blo gros dam pa zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ / de'i steng na 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud kyi dbus gzhi mnyam pa yod pa de na 'jig rten gyi khams yang dag par gnas pa'i rgyan ces bya ba yod de; de na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od lhag par 'phags pas rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ / de'i steng na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba gzhi mnyam pa yod pa de na 'jig rten gyi khams baiDUr+yas bsgrubs pa kun nas 'khor lo zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab mar me zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ / de'i steng na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud kyi thog ma la 'jig rten gyi khams me tog gi rgya mtsho rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba/ gcig tu dag pa yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa sprul pa mi zad pa'i sprin gyi mnga' bdag ces bya ba bzhugs so/ /

“There are as many such seas as atoms in unspeakably many buddha-fields. The one closest to the surrounding mountains is called Producing Sapphires, with a world system called Everywhere Undifferentiated composed of the booming voices of all enlightening beings. At the bottom of this system is a world called Exquisite Treasury, with a Buddha called Supremely Virtuous Mind. Above this, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-fields, parallel to the world Diamond Banner, is a world called Embellishments, with a Buddha called Great Transcendental Light. Above this, parallel to the world Endurance, is a world called Everywhere Adorned with Lapis Lazuli Globes, with a Buddha called Polar Mountain Lamp. At the top of this world system is a world called Flower Banner Sea, with a Buddha called Cloud of Sublime Wisdom Capable of Endless Transmutations and Productions.

spos chu'i rgya mtsho sgra rdo rje ltar shin tu brtan pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rin po che'i shing thags kyis bskor ba/ shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rin po che'i rgyal mtshan shin tu 'greng ba zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho me tog gi rgyal mtshan gyis rab tu brgyan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud snang ba thams cad shin tu ston pa zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rin po che'i sprin dam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yod do; de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud gzhi rin po che thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ 'od rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rin po che'i shing gi ze ba'i kha dog gi rgyan ces bya ba yod de/ de na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud dge ba'i tshogs kyi gzi brjid phal po che zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rin po che'i gos dam pas shin tu brgyan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rgya mtsho'i 'od ces bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rin po che'i shing gi yal ga brtsegs pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rin po che'i 'od 'phro ba'i sprin la shin tu brten pa zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho gzhi yid du 'ong bar snang ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud chags pa med pa'i rdo rje kun tu rgyu ba zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho kun nas pad+mos brgyan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rgya mtsho'i ngogs mtha' yas pa'i klong zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so; ; de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rin po che'i yan lag dam pas rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud zhing gi gzhi rnam par dmigs pa zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ /

“Beyond the sea of fragrant water Mass of Diamonds is another sea of fragrant water, called Reverently Adorned Jewel Parapets, with a world system called Outstanding Jewel Banner. Next to that is a sea of fragrant water called Array of Jewel Banners, with a world system called Manifesting All Lights. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Cloud of Sublime Jewels, with a world system called Universally Shining Light. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Adorned with Jewel Tree Blossoms, with a world system called Decorated with Beautiful Flowers. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Array of Raiment of Wonderful Jewels, with a world system called Ocean of Light. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Jewel Tree Peak, with a world system called Jewel Flame Cloud. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Displaying Light, with a world system called Entering Diamond with No Resistance. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Lotuses Adorning Everywhere, with a world system called Oceanic Abyss with Boundless Shores. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Array of Beautiful Jewels, with a world system called Treasury Displaying All Lands.

de dag la sogs pa spos chu'i rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi phyi rol khor yug gi mtshams na spos chu'i rgya mtsho mi phyed par brtan pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ / de na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud pad+mo'i dkyil 'khor shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba sangs rgyas thams cad kyi stobs la 'jug pa shin tu sgrog pa'i lhun can rab tu gnas te/ de thams cad kyi 'og na 'jig rten gyi khams spos shin tu zhim pa'i rgya mtsho zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dang sprul pa tshad med pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud de'i dbus na 'jig rten gyi khams rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba gzhi mnyam pa yod pa de na 'jig rten gyi khams rgyan dang tshul gyi sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes tshad med pa'i tshangs pa zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ / de'i steng na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba gzhi mnyam pa yod pa de na 'jig rten gyi khams snang ba'i phyogs me tog gi snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa seng+ge'i spyan 'od 'phro ba'i sprin ces bya ba bzhugs so/ / de'i steng na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud kyi thog ma la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i dbyangs zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa chu'i lha 'od 'phro ba'i sgo zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ /

“Such seas are as numerous as atoms in unspeakably many buddha-fields. The one nearest to the surrounding mountains is called Indestructible Sea, with a world system called Lotus Blossom Setting Decorated With Beautiful Discs composed of the sounds produced by all the powers of Buddhas. At the bottom of this system is a world called Most Sublime Fragrance, with a Buddha called Producing Innumerable Light Beams. Above this, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-fields, parallel to the world Diamond Banner, is a world called Ornamental Gates of Inconceivably Many Distinctions, with a Buddha called Immeasurable Knowledge. Above this, parallel to the world Endurance, is a world called Beautiful Flower Treasury of the Light of the Ten Directions, with a Buddha called Lion Eye Light Flame Cloud. At the top of this world system is a world called Ocean Sound, with a Buddha called Gate of Light Flames of the Heaven of Waters.

spos chu'i rgya mtsho lha'i grong khyer dang / nor bu'i shing thags kyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho snang ba'i 'khor los rnam par gsal ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud brjod du med pa'i phyogs kyis gnas kyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rin po che'i tshon gyi srang rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba yod de/ de na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud brgyud pa du mas 'jug pa zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rgyan thams cad kyis kun tu gang ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rin po che rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rin po che'i dra ba rnam par phye ba kun tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud tshul gyi mtshams sbyor ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rgyal mtshan dam pa'i rgyan ces bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dmigs pa rgya mtsho'i sgra zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho nyi ma'i gnas yongs su sbyong ba'i 'od ces bya ba yod de; de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud mig 'phrul gyis rgyas par 'jug pa zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho sil snyan thams cad kyi sgra dbyangs yid du 'ong ba brjod pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud klong thams cad kyi gting du rab tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ / de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho rgyan dam pas bsgrubs pa rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'od dri ma med pa'i sprin stug po 'bar ba zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ /
de dang 'dabs chags su spos chu'i rgya mtsho mar me 'od 'phro bas kun tu rgyas pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud sangs rgyas kyi smon lam gyi dbyibs tha dad par byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba rab tu gnas so/ /

“Beyond the sea of fragrant water Jewel Ramparts of Celestial Cities is another sea of fragrant water, called Brilliant Light of a Wheel of Flames, with a world system called Unspeakably Many Adornments of All Kinds. Next to that is a sea of fragrant water called Jewel Dust Road, with a world system called Everywhere Entering Infinite Spirals. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Containing All Ornaments, with a world system called Jewel Light Shining Everywhere. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Spreading Jewel Nets, with a world system called Arrayed Deep and Thick. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Beautiful Jewel Array Banners, with a world system called Sound of Clear Understanding of the Ocean of Worlds. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Pure Reflection of the Palace of the Sun, with a world system called Entering Everywhere in Indra’s Net. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Beautiful Sound of Music of All Drums, with a world system called Round and Full, Level and Straight. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Various Beautiful Adornments, with a world system called Cloud of Flames of Pure Intense Light. Next is a sea of fragrant water called Lamp With All-Pervasive Jewel Flames, with a world system called Various Forms According to the Original Vows of the Buddha.

de dag la sogs pa spos chu'i rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi phyi rol khor yug gi mtshams na spos chu'i rgya mtsho phreng ba dang gos kyis shin tu bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de las 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud kun nas snang ba'i gos bzang po shin tu sprul pa zhes bya ba; sangs rgyas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shin tu sgrog pa'i lhun can mngon par byung ngo/ / de thams cad kyi 'og na spos chu'i rgya mtsho dbang po'i me tog ze ba 'khyil ba'i snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na 'jig rten gyi khams rab tu grol bas dga' ba byed pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba/ gcig tu dag pa yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i ye shes kyis pham pa med pa zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ / de'i steng na 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud kyi dbus na 'jig rten gyi khams rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba gzhi mnyam pa yod pa de na 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i 'bru'i dra bas brgyan pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba/ gcig tu dag pa yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa snang ba tshad med pas dgyes pa zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ / de'i steng 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba gzhi mnyam pa yod pa de na 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i gdan pad+mo dang / seng+ge zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa shugs dri ma med cing mnyan na don yod pa zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ / de'i steng 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bdun gyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud kyi steng na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud klu'i rin po che'i kha dog gi 'od ces bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyi shu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba; gcig tu dag pa yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings yongs su gsal bar rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba bzhugs te/

“Such seas of fragrant waters are as numerous as atoms in unspeakably many buddha-fields. The one nearest to the surrounding mountains is called Raiment of Assembled Ornaments; its world system, called Magically Produced Beautiful Raiment, is composed of the sound of the voices of all the Buddhas of past, present, and future. At the bottom of this system is a sea of fragrant water called Indra Flower Treasury, with a world called Producing Joy, surrounded by as many worlds as atoms in a buddha-field, all uniformly pure. The Buddha is called Stable Enlightened Knowledge. Above this, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-fields, parallel to the world Diamond Banner, is a world called Adorned with Jewel Nets, surrounded by as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-fields, all uniformly pure. The Buddha is called Light of Infinite Joy. Above this, past as many worlds as atoms in three buddha-fields, parallel to the world Endurance, is a world called Jewel Lotus Lion Throne, surrounded by as many worlds as atoms in thirteen buddha-fields. The Buddha is called Most Pure Unwasteful Learning. Above this, past as many worlds as atoms in seven buddha-fields, at the top of this world system is a world called Jewel Lotus Dragon Light, surrounded by as many worlds as atoms in twenty buddha-fields, uniformly pure. The Buddha there is called All-Illumining Light Pervading the Cosmos.

kye de ltar rgyal ba'i sras dag /spos chu'i rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu gnas te/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud de dag thams cad kyang spos chu'i rgya mtsho de dag la nor bu'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa'i lus rnam par dmigs pa'i mig yor gyi rgyal mtshan gyis rab tu brgyan pa dang ldan pa'i pad+mo la rab tu gnas pa sha stag go /'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rgyan gzhan dang gzhan can mang po dang mtshams 'dabs chags su gnas pa sha stag go /'od rin po che gzhan dang gzhan gyi kha dog tu 'gyed pa sha stag go/ 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin gzhan dang gzhan gyis kun nas yog pa sha stag go /rgyan rnam par bres pa'i 'od gzhan dang gzhan can sha stag go /bskal pa'i grangs gzhan dang gzhan du bstan pa sha stag go /sangs rgyas gzhan dang gzhan skye zhing gshegs pa sha stag go /chos rgya mtsho'i sgra gzhan dang gzhan rab tu bsgrags pa sha stag go /sems can gyi lus gzhan dang gzhan gyis kun tu yog pa sha stag go /phyogs gzhan dang gzhan la 'jug pa ma 'dres pa sha stag go /sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs gzhan dang gzhan can sha stag go /'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud de dag re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtshams nas rab tu byung ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dra ba rgyan sna tshogs la rab tu gnas pa thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa sna tshogs kyi tshul du 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang / snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba 'di thams cad yongs su gang ngo/ / ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi rgyud nas byung ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sa mtshams dang / sgo rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rgyan la gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dra ba sna tshogs thams cad las byung ba kun gyis kyang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang / snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'di thams cad yongs su gang ngo/ /

“In these seas of fragrant water, as many as atomic particles in ten unspeakably large numbers of buddha-fields, are an equal number of world systems, all resting on lotus blossoms adorned with diamond banners in the forms of all enlightening beings, each with unbroken boundaries of ornaments, each radiating lights of jewel colors, each covered by clouds of lights, each with their particular adornments, particular time period differences, particular Buddhas appearing, particular oceans of teachings being expounded, particular beings filling their particular entries in the ten directions, particular supports by the spiritual powers of all Buddhas. All of the worlds in each of these systems rest on various adornments, connecting with each other, forming a network of worlds, set up, with various differences, throughout the Flower Bank Array ocean of worlds.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud mtha' dang / dbus med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa'i tshul shin tu bstan pa 'di nyid gsal bar brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to recapitulate, the enlightening being Universally Good, receiving power from the Buddha, said in verse,

'jig rten khams ni rgya mtsho rnams/ / yangs dang mi yangs sna tshogs pa/ / nam mkha' dag gi dbyings la gnas/ / chos kyi dbyings ni tha mi dad/ /
'jig rten khams 'di rgya mtsho na/ / zhing gi rgyud ni bsam mi khyab/ / tha dad min par rnam par gnas/ / rnam 'phrul gzhan dang gzhan dag go /
rnam phye sna tshogs shin tu gnas/ / kha dog tha dad rab tu 'dug / zhing gi rgyud dag rnam phye ba/ / 'jig rten khams kyi gang chen mtsho/ /
lhun dang dbyangs rnams tha dad de/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi rnam 'phrul ba/ / zhing gi rgyud rnams rab tu snang / / las kyis de dag shin tu bris/ /
ri rab rgya mtsho'i dra ba dang / / 'khor lo klong gi dkyil 'khor dang / / pad+mo'i dbyibs 'dra 'byams klas pa/ / de dag de yis kun nas bskor/ /
rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan brtsegs pa dang / / rdo rje kun nas 'khor gnas pa/ / 'byams klas bsam gyis mi khyab pas/ / de dag rgyud ni kun nas bskor/ /
'od kyi dra ba bsam mi khyab/ / mu tig mdog kyang rgya mtsho ste/ / zhing gi rgyu rnams kun kyang 'bar/ / pad+mo la yang kun gnas so/ /
re re dag gi rgyud las kyang / / 'od zer dra ba bsam mi khyab/ / 'od zer dag gi zhing gyur cing / / rgya mtsho phyogs rnams kun tu 'gengs/ /
zhing gi rgyud rnams thams cad kyis/ / dmigs pa kun gyi sgo nas kyang / / thams cad tshul la 'jug pa yis/ / mi zad tshul rnams rab tu snang / /
zhing gi rnams ni bsam mi khyab/ / rgyud rnams mi zad shin tu 'byung / / rgyan rnams bstan pa tha dad de/ / drang srong chen po'i byin rlabs so/ /

The Flower Bank ocean of worlds Is equal to the universe. Its adornments are extremely pure, Resting peacefully in space.
In this ocean of worlds Are inconceivably many world systems; Each one independent, They are not all mixed up.
In the Flower Bank world-ocean The world systems are well arrayed With different shapes and adornments Varying in appearance.
The sounds of Buddhas’ displays Are the substance of various systems; Seeing according to the power of acts, The world systems are finely adorned.
Polar Mountain city networks, Circular shapes of whirlpools, Immense lotus flowers blooming, They circle one another.
Mountain banner palace shapes, Whirling diamond shapes: Like this are the inconceivable Vast systems of worlds.
Flames of pearls from the ocean, Inconceivable nets of light: The world systems like this All rest on lotus blossoms.
The webs of light of each system Cannot be fully described: In the lights appear all the lands Throughout the seas in ten directions.
Into the ornaments adorning All the systems of worlds Enter all the lands, Making all visible everywhere.
The world systems are inconceivable, The worlds are boundless; Their various fine embellishments Derive from the Great Sage’s power.

zhing gi rgyud rnams de dag na/ / 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab khams/ / kun nas 'du zhing rnam par 'jig / 'byung zhing 'jig par de bzhin 'gyur/ /
ji ltar shing la lo ma rnams/ / 'byung zhing ltung bar 'gyur ba ltar/ / de bzhin zhing gi rgyud rnams na/ / 'jig rten khams rnams 'byung ba yin/ /
ji ltar shing gi skye gnas nas/ / shing tog sna tshogs 'byung ba ltar/ / de bzhin zhing gi rgyud rnams na/ / sems can sna tshogs 'byung ba yin/ /
ji ltar sa bon khyad par gyis/ / 'bras bu sna tshogs snang ba ltar/ / de bzhin las kyi khyad par gyis/ / sems can rnams dang zhing byung ngo/ /
yid bzhin rin chen rgyal po rnams/ / kha dog kun tu snang ba ltar/ / sems can bsam pa rnam dag pas/ / de bzhin zhing rnams rab tu snang / /
klu yi rgyal po'i sprin gyi rnams/ / nam mkha'i dbyings la ston pa ltar/ / de bzhin sangs rgyas smon lam gyis/ / zhing gi rnams ni 'byung ba yin/ /
sgyu ma'i mkhan po sngags dag gis/ / sgo rnams sna tshogs ston pa ltar/ / de bzhin sems can las rnams kyis/ / bsam gyis mi khyab zhing 'byung ngo/ /
ji ltar ri mo'i gzugs kyi rnams/ / ri mo'i las kyis bris pa ltar/ / de bzhin zhing rnams 'di dag kun/ / sems kyis ri mor bris pa yin/ /
sems can lus kyis rnam par dag / ji ltar sems kyis brtags pa ltar/ / de bzhin du ni zhing gi mtshams/ / thams cad las kyis rnam par bris/ /
ji ltar gzhan dang gzhan gzugs su/ / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa bzhin/ / mgon po rnams ni snang ba ltar/ / de bzhin zhing rnams snang ba'o/ /

In each of the systems of worlds The worlds are inconceivably many; Some forming, some decaying, Some have already crumbled away.
Like leaves in a forest, Some growing and some falling, So too in these systems thus Do worlds form and decay.
Like according to the forest The various fruits are different, In these world systems too Do various beings live.
Just as when seeds are different So are the fruits they produce, Because of differences in the force of acts Living beings’ lands are not the same.
Just as the mind-king jewel Appears in different colors to different minds, When beings’ minds are pure They can see pure lands.
Like great dragon kings Creating clouds filling the sky, So does the power of Buddhas’ vows Produce the various lands.
Just as the magicians’ arts Can make various things appear, Due to the force of beings’ acts The number of realms is inconceivable.
Just like pictures Drawn by an artist, So are all worlds Made by the painter-mind.
Beings’ bodies’ differences Arise from the mind’s discriminations; Thus are the lands varied All depending on acts.
Just as the Guide is seen In various different forms, So do beings see the lands According to their mental patterns.

pad+mo'i dra ba'i phyi rol gyis/ / sems can zhing gi mtshams dag na/ / dbyibs dang kha dog gzhan dang gzhan/ / dri ma med pa sna tshogs snang / /
pad+mo'i dra ba de dag la/ / zhing gi dra ba rab tu gnas/ / rgyan dang bstan pa sna tshogs te/ / sems can sna tshogs mang po'i gnas/ /
zhing gi dbyings rnams la la ni/ / kun nas nyon mongs rnam par gnas/ / sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs las/ / chos nyid de dag nang na snang / /
kun nas nyon mongs rnam dag tu/ / zhing gi rgyud ni bsam mi khyab/ / sems can bsam pas rab tu byung / / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang 'khod/ /
la la rnam dag nyon mongs can/ / zhing gi dbyings ni rnam par mang / / byang chub sems dpas rnam par sprul/ / rgya mtsho'i las las byung ba yin/ /
zhing rnams la la'i 'od btang ba/ / rin chen rang bzhin dri ma med/ / rnam pa sna tshogs dri med dag / sangs rgyas rnams kyis yongs su sbyangs/ /
zhing gi rgyud rnams la la na/ / bskal pa'i me ni bsam mi khyab/ / kun nas nyon mongs rnams la ston; ; zhing gi dkyil 'khor shin tu sra/ /
klung gi phung po smon lam dang / / chu yi phung la rab tu gnas/ / zhing gi rnam pa shin tu mang / / sems can las kyis bsags pa yin/ /
zhing na gzhan dang gzhan dag gi / zhing gi chos nyid snang la ltos/ / de dag 'byung ba gang yang med/ / de dag la ni 'jig pa'ang med/ /
skad cig skad cig sems kun la/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyi byin rlabs kyis/ / zhing rnams rab tu 'byung ba rnams/ / shin tu dri med dag la ltos/ /

The borders of all the worlds Are draped with lotus nets; Their various features different, Their adornments are all pure.
In those lotus nets Rest networks of lands With various adornments, Inhabited by various beings.
Some lands Are dangerous and uneven; Because of beings’ afflictions They see them in this way.
Innumerable kinds of worlds, Defiled as well as pure, Develop according to beings’ minds, Maintained by enlightening beings’ power.
In some lands Is purity as well as defilement; This arises from the force of deeds Under the influence of enlightening beings.
Some lands are made of pure jewels Radiating light, With various fine adornments Purified by the Buddhas.
In each system of lands Are eonic fires, inconceivable; While it appears disastrous, The places always remain secure.
By the force of beings’ acts Are many lands produced, Supported by wind atmospheres, Or resting on water spheres.
The phenomena of the worlds Are thus variously seen; Yet they really have no origination And also no disintegration.
In each moment of mind Are infinite lands produced; By the Buddha’s spiritual power All are seen as pure.

zhing rnams la la sa yi dngos/ / sra bar de dag byung gyur cing / / snang ba med cing 'od kyang med/ / sdig pa'i las kyi gnas yin no/ /
zhing rnams la la rdo rje'i dngos/ / kun nas nyon mongs 'jigs pa che/ / bde ba chung zhing sdug bsngal mang / / bsod nams chung ba'i gnas kyang yin/ /
zhing rnams la la lcags kyi dngos/ / la la zangs kyi dngos su gnas/ / sdig pa'i las kyis kun na gang / / ri dang brag gis mnyam pa med/ /
'jig rten de na dmyal ba yi/ / sems can sdug bsngal skyabs med pa/ / mun pa rjes su rnyed gyur cing / / me lce rgya mtsho'i nang na 'bar/ /
'on kyang byol song skye gnas su/ / lus ni mngon par 'byung 'gyur te/ / bdag gi las kyi nyes pa yis/ / sdug bsngal tshor ba rab tu myong / /
gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams na'ang snang / / skom dang bkres pas rab tu mnar/ / me yi ri yis gdungs pa yis/ / sdug bsngal tshor ba'ang myong bar 'gyur/ /
la la rin chen bdun las byung / / la la sna tshogs gzugs su gnas/ / dge ba'i las kyis byung ba ste/ / sna tshogs khyim gyis rab tu brgyan/ /
mi dang lha rnams la la ni/ / mtho ris dag gi 'jig rten na/ / dge ba'i bsod nams 'bras bur ldan/ / dga' bde myong ba de dag ltos/ /
spu yi rtse mo gcig la yang / / zhing rnams bye ba bsam mi khyab/ / sna tshogs dbyibs kyang tha dad de; ; de dag 'dres pa gang yang med/ /
rang rang so so'i las kyis na/ / sems can khams rnams bsam mi khyab/ / 'du shes sna tshogs 'dzin pa rnams/ / bde dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong / /

Some lands are made of dirt, Their substance very hard; Dark, with no light shining, They’re inhabited by evildoers.
Some lands are made of thunderbolts, Mixed up and terrifying, With much misery and little happiness, The abodes of those of scant virtue.
Some are made of iron, Some of ruddy copper, With stone mountains, steep and fearsome, Full of animals.
Among the lands are hells Where beings cannot be saved from pain: Always in the dark, Burnt by seas of flame.
Some, again, have animals Of various wretched forms; Because of their own evil deeds They always suffer affliction.
Some see a nether-world, Oppressed by hunger and thirst; Climbing great mountains of fire, They suffer extreme pain.
There are also some lands Composed of precious elements, With various kinds of mansions; These are realized by pure deeds.
You should observe these worlds, The humans and celestials therein: Developed by results of pure deeds, They feel happiness all the time.
In each and every pore Are unthinkable billions of lands, Adorned in various ways, With never any cramp.
By the individual acts of beings These worlds are infinite in kind: Therein are born attachments And differences of misery and happiness.

zhing rnams la la mtha' yas 'od/ / sems can mang don kun nas gnas/ / yongs byung rdo rje ut+pal/ / sna tshogs rnam dag dri ma med/ /
zhing rnams la la 'od zer dngos/ / 'od kyi 'khor la kun nas gnas/ / tsan+dan gser las yongs su byung / / 'od 'phro sprin gyi mdog dang mnyam/ /
zhing rnams la la nyi zla'i dngos/ / spos kyi gos kyis kun nas g.yogs/ / la la pad+mo gcig la ste/ / byang chub sems dpa' yongs su rgyas/ /
la la mtshan gyi mdog dang 'od/ / zhing rnams rin chen dri ma med/ / mig 'phrul 'od kyang rab tu 'gyed/ / 'od zer dra bas snang bar byas/ /
zhing rnams la la rdo rje dang / / pad+mo'i dngos su spos la gnas/ / la la nor bu'i 'od kyang yin/ / zhing rnams yongs su dag la ltos/ /
me tog klong las la la byung / / bsam gyis mi khyab zhing la ltos/ / sangs rgyas sprul pas kun tu khyab/ / byang chub sems dpa'i 'od dang mnyam/ /
la la me tog shing rnams dang / / lo ma'i dkyil 'khor sna tshogs te/ / nor bu'i sprin gyis kun tu khyab/ / zhing gi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag /
zhing rnams la la pad+mo'i dngos/ / snang ba bzang pos rnam par mdzes/ / sangs rgyas sprul pa'i gsung yang yin/ / zhing gi dra ba bsam mi khyab/ /
rin chen cod pan sna tshogs dang / / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan rnams dang / / gdan las de bzhin la la byung / / 'od dang sprul pa'ang rab tu 'gyed/ /
tsan+dan phye ma sna tshogs dang / / mdzod spu rnam par snang ba'i 'od/ / sangs rgyas sprin gyi 'od zer rnams/ / zhing rnams 'byung ba rab tu brjod/ /

Some lands are made of jewels Always radiating boundless light; Diamond lotus flowers Adorn them, totally pure.
Some lands are made of light Resting too on spheres of light: Golden, with sandalwood scent, Flaming clouds illumining all.
Some lands are made of lunar discs, Draped with fragrant robes, In a lotus blossom, Filled with enlightening beings.
Some lands are made of many jewels, Their colors without impurities, Like the imperial net of Indra, Always shining with light.
Some lands are made of fragrance, Some are diamond flowers; Their forms of crystal light Are most pure when looked into.
There are also inconceivably many lands Made of flower wreaths, Filled with phantom Buddhas And radiance of enlightening beings.
There are some pure lands All of flowering trees, Beautiful boughs spread over sanctuaries, Shaded by crystal clouds.
Some lands are made Of diamond flowers with pure light; Some are sounds of Buddhas teaching, Forming boundless networks of arrays.
Some lands are like the jeweled crowns Of enlightening beings; Some are shaped like thrones Issuing from magical light.
Some are sandalwood powder, Some like emanated light, Some the sounds in Buddha’s aura Formed into a wondrous land.

la la rgyan dang 'od gcig par/ / zhing rnams dri ma med par snang / / la la rkyen rnams thams cad kyis/ / rnam pa sna tshogs rab tu brgyan/ /
la la zhing rnams bcu dag gi / rgyan gyis mngon par rab tu brgyan; ; la la zhing rnams stong dag kyang / / rnam par brgyan cing rab tu gnas/ /
zhing gi rgyan mang bye ba yis/ / zhing rnams la la rnam par bris/ / rgyan dang tshul rnams tha dad par/ / sna tshogs mig yor lta bur snang / /
brjod du med pa'i zhing gi rnams/ / rgyan gcig la yang rab tu snang / / 'od ni gzhan dang gzhan bkye ba/ / sangs rgyas smon lam mthu las byung / /
smon lam rgya mtsho rnam mang bas/ / zhing rnams la la rnam par sbyangs/ / de dag rgyan mang thams cad du/ / zhing gi rgya mtsho shin tu snang / /
kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyis/ / zhing rnams yongs su gang sbyangs pa/ / de dag kun la dus gsum gyi/ / zhing gi rgyan rnams kun kyang snang / /
zhing gi rgyud kyi rnam sprul pa/ / kye ma rgyal sras khyed ni ltos/ / ma 'ongs pa yi zhing rnams kyang / / rmi lam bzhin du de dag snang / /
ji snyed phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi/ / 'das pa'i zhing rnams rgya mtsho yang / / zhing gcig nang na thams cad snang / / mig yor bzhin du sprul pa yin/ /
dus gsum sangs rgyas thams cad kyi/ / rnam sprul zhing rnams gang yod pa/ / zhing gi rgyud ni 'di la snang / / kun kyang nang na yod par gnas/ /
zhing gi rdul gyi rtsa mo la; ; sangs rgyas thams cad rnam 'phrul pa/ / shong bar de dag kun na snang / / mig yor mtshan nyid med pa'o/ /

Some see pure lands Adorned with a single light; Some see many ornaments, All variously superb.
Some have for adornments The marvelous things of ten lands; Some are adorned with everything In a thousand lands.
Sometimes one land is embellished With the things of a billion lands, Their various features unalike, All appearing as reflected images.
The things of unspeakably many lands Adorn a single land, Each radiating light, Produced by the Buddhas’ vows.
There are some lands Purified by the power of vows; In each of their adornments Are seen all oceans of worlds.
The pure lands realized by those Who practice the vows of universal good Manifest within themselves the adornments Of past, present, and future lands.
You should observe, O Children of Buddha, The spiritual power in the systems of worlds: The worlds of the future, all They’ll show you, like in a dream.
The worlds of the ten directions, The oceans of lands of the past, All within a single land Show their forms, like phantoms.
All Buddhas of past, present, and future, As well as their lands, Can all be observed In a single world system.
The spiritual power of all Buddhas Shows many lands in an atom: Of various kinds, all clearly seen, Like reflections, they have no true reality.

la la rgya mtsho'i dbyings su 'dug / zhing brgya mang po de dag ltos/ / ri rab ri yi dbyibs 'dra dang / / 'jig rten khams ni bsam mi khyab/ /
zhing rnams la la rnam par bris/ / mig yor dbyibs su gnas pa ste/ / sna tshogs shing gi dbyibs su gnas/ / sangs rgyas kyis kyang kun tu khyab/ /
zhing rnams nor bu'i 'khor lo'i dbyibs/ / la la pad+mo'i dbyibs su gnas/ / yan lag brgyad pa sna tshogs mang / / sna tshogs kha dog dri ma med; ;
la la khri yi dbyibs lta bu/ / gra yi dbyibs dang khyad khyud de/ / la la grong khyer dbyibs su 'dug / tshangs pa'i lus su rab tu gnas/ /
lha yi dbang po'i gtsug phud dbyibs/ / zla ba kham ltar la la gnas/ / nor bu'i ri yi dbyibs su 'khod/ / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbyibs kyang 'dra/ /
spos chu'i rgya mtsho'i klong lta bur/ / 'jig rten khams rnams rab tu gnas/ / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dbyibs 'dra ba/ / sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis sbyangs/ /
'khor lo bkra shis dbyibs lta bu/ / 'jig rten la la dkyil 'khor te/ / mdzod spu'i spyi gtsug dbyibs lta bu; ; la la mig gi tshul yang 'dra/ /
sangs rgyas phyag gi dbyibs lta bu/ / la la rdo rje'i dbyibs su 'dug / 'od 'phro ri yi dbyibs kyang 'dra/ / byang chub sems dpas kun tu gang / /
zhing rnams la la seng+ge'i dbyibs/ / nor bu'i go char mngon bsgrubs pa/ / gzugs dang dbyibs ni du ma ste/ / gzugs rnams kun gyis rab tu gnas/ /
zhing gi rgyud ni gcig la yang / / zhing gi dbyibs rnams mi zad pa/ / rab tu gnas pa byin rlabs dang / / sangs rgyas smon lam rnams kyis byung / /

There are many lands Whose forms are like oceans; And lands like polar mountains Are inconceivable in number.
Some lands are well disposed, Formed like Indra’s net; Some are shaped like forests, With Buddhas filling them.
Some are shaped like jewel discs, Some like lotus blossoms, Or octagonal, with all decorations; They’re various, and all pure.
Some are shaped like seats, Some again are triangular; Some are like pure jewels, Castle walls, or celestial bodies.
Some are like gods’ topknots, Some like the half-moon; Some are like crystal mountains, Some like the solar orb.
The shape of some of the worlds Is like whirlpools in a fragrant sea; Some are spheres of light, Purified by Buddhas past.
Some are shaped like wheel rims, Some are altar-shaped; Some are like Buddha’s hair curl, His flesh topknot, or large long eyes.
Some are like Buddha’s hand, Some like thunderbolts, Some are like mountains of flames; Enlightening beings fill them all.
Some are shaped like lions, Some like seashells; Of infinite colors and forms, Their substances are each distinct.
In one system of worlds Are endless forms of lands; All depend on Buddhas’ vow power For protection and stability.

zhing rnams la la bskal pa tsam/ / la la bskal pa bcu pa ste/ / zhing rnams la la rdul mnyam pa'i/ / bskal pa bye bar brjod pa yin/ /
la la bskal pa gcig la yang / / zhing rnams mang po 'byung bar snang / / tshad med grangs kyang med pa yi/ / 'jig pa de bzhin bsam mi khyab/ /
zhing rnams la la sangs rgyas med/ / zhing rnams la la sangs rgyas bcas/ / la la'i zhing na sangs rgyas gcig / la la sangs rgyas mang po'o/ /
sangs rgyas med pa'i zhing rnams dang / / 'jig rten gzhan gyi khams su yang / / sangs rgyas sprul pa gshegs mdzad cing / / rnam par 'phrul pa rab tu ston/ /
'pho dang 'byung dang sku tshe dang / / byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya dang / / bdud kyi sde dag 'dul ba dang / / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ston/ /
sems can bsam pa ji bzhin du/ / gzugs rnams sna tshogs kun kyang ston/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rab bskor ba/ / 'jig rten kun na tha mi dad/ /
sangs rgyas zhing rnams re re yang / / rgyal ba gcig ni skyed 'gyur te/ / lo grangs bye ba phrag stong du/ / chos kyi dam pa rab tu ston/ /
sems can snod du ma gyur la/ / sangs rgyas ston pa mi mdzad do/ / sangs rgyas bsam dang ldan pas ni/ / de nyid gcig kyang kun tu mthong / /
sangs rgyas mang po'i zhing gi rnams/ / zhing rnams re re dag tu yang / / sangs rgyas bye ba bsam mi khyab/ / rgyal ba rnams ni rab tu skye/ /
rgyal ba so so de dag na/ / sprul pa mang po rab 'gyed cing / / chos kyi dbyings ni khyab mdzad nas/ / sems can rgya mtsho 'dul ba mdzad/ /

Some lands last an eon, Some exist for ten eons, Or for more eons than atoms In a hundred thousand lands.
In a single eon Lands are seen to dissolve; Measureless or countless, Or inconceivably many of them.
Some lands have a Buddha, And some lands do not; Some have just one Buddha, And some have countless Buddhas.
If a land has no Buddha, Then a Buddha from another world Will mystically appear there To manifest the works of Buddhas—
Dying in heaven and descending in spirit, Residing in a womb and being born, Vanquishing demons and becoming enlightened, Turning the wheel of the unexcelled teaching;
According to the inclinations of beings’ minds Buddha manifests various forms, Teaching them the sublime truth In accord with each of their faculties.
In each buddha-field A Buddha appears in the world, Spending billions of years Expounding unexcelled truths.
If beings are not vessels of truth, They cannot see the Buddhas; If any have the will, They see Buddha everywhere.
In each individual buddha-field Is a Buddha appearing in the world; The Buddhas in all lands Are inconceivable in number.
Herein each and every Buddha Shows countless mystic transformations, Pervading the entire universe, Taming the ocean of beings.

zhing rnams la la 'od med de/ / mun pa 'jigs pa shin tu che/ / reg na sdug bsngal spu gri 'dra/ / blta na mi bzad skyi yang g.ya'/ /
zhing rnams la la lha 'od can/ / la la khyim gyi 'od can te/ / la la nyi zla'i 'od dang ldan/ / zhing gi dra ba bsam mi khyab/ /
zhing rnams la la rang gi 'od/ / shing gi 'od can dri ma med/ / gang du sdug bsngal mi mthong ba/ / de dag sems can dag las byung / /
la la ri yi 'od can te/ / zhing rnams la la nor bu'i 'od/ / la la mar me'i 'od can te/ / sems can rnams kyi las kyis byung / /
zhing rnams la la sangs rgyas 'od/ / byang chub sems dpas kun tu gang / / zhing rnams la la pad+mo'i 'od/ / 'od 'phro 'od can rab tu mdzes/ /
zhing rnams la la me tog 'od/ / spos chu'i 'od dang ldan pa'ang yod/ / spos dang gdug pa'i 'od 'phro can/ / smon lam dbang gis rnam par sbyangs/ /
zhing rnams la la sprin 'od can/ / nor bu'i go cha'i 'od kyis gsal/ / sangs rgyas byin gyis brlabs kyis snang / / yid du 'ong ba'i sgra dbyangs ldan/ /
rin chen cod pan 'od dang ldan/ / rdo rje gser gyi 'od kyis snang / / yongs su dag pa'i sgra dbyangs can/ / de dag na ni sdug bsngal med/ /
thams cad rgyan gyi 'od can dang / / zhing rnams la la nor bu'i 'od/ / la la snying po byang chub 'od/ / 'khor rnams kun tu rab tu snang / /
sangs rgyas sprul pa'i snang ba can/ / sangs rgyas sprin gyis mngon par yog / kun tu 'od kyis rab tu snang / / chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa'i 'od/ /

Some lands have no light; They’re dark and full of fear, With pains like knives and swords: Those who see them suffer by themselves.
Some have heavenly lights; Some, lights of palaces; Some have sun and moon lights: Inconceivable are the networks of lands.
Some lands are inherently luminous, In some the trees emit pure light; There has never been suffering there, Due to the power of beings’ virtue.
Some have lights of mountains, Some have crystal lights, Some are lit by lamps: All the force of beings’ deeds.
Some have Buddhas’ auras, Filled with enlightening beings; Some are lotus blossom lights With magnificent blazing colors.
Some lands are lit by flower lights, Some by the sheen of fragrant waters, Or by perfumes and burning incense; All comes from the force of pure vows.
Some are lit by cloud lights, Some by jewel oysters’ lights; The light of Buddhas’ mystic power Can intone gladdening sounds.
Some are lit by jewel lights, Some by diamond flames. Their pure sounds can shake far-off realms; Wherever they reach there are no pains.
Some have crystal lights Or lights from ornaments Or from enlightenment scenes Shining in the crowds.
Buddha emanates a great light Filled with phantom Buddhas; That light touches all with its glow, Pervading the whole cosmos.

zhing rnams la la 'jigs sgra can/ / mi bzad 'jigs pa'i nga ro can; ; rtsub cing brlang ba'i sgra rnams dang / / yid myong 'jigs pa chen po sgrog /
dmyal ba byol song skye gnas dang / / gshin rje'i 'jig rten sdug bsngal rnams/ / mya ngan rgya mtsho'i zhing gi rnams/ / nyon mongs ldan pa'i sgra yang 'byung / /
la la dag na yid 'ong sgra/ / dga' bar byed cing ston 'doms pa/ / dge ba'i las dang 'bras bu'i dbyangs/ / zhing gi 'khor na rab tu sgrog /
la la brgya byin lha dbang dbyangs/ / gzhan dag tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs te/ / 'jig rten kun gyi dbyangs su yang / / la la'i zhing na rab tu grags/ /
zhing rnams la la sprin gyi sgra/ / rin chen rgya mtsho'i 'od zer dang / / nor bu'i shing gi gzugs sgra dang / / rol mo'i sgra yis kun tu khyab/ /
'od zer glong gi sgra rnams dang / / sangs rgyas sprul pa mi zad dang / / byang chub sems dpa'i sgra dag dang / / 'od zer sgra ni snyan pa 'byung / /
chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra rnams dang / / kha cig zhing na bsam yas pa'i/ / smon lam rgya mtsho'i nga ro dang / / spyod pa'i sgra yang snyan pa 'byung / /
dus gsum gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi/ / mtshan gyi dkyil 'khor mang po dang / / de dag zhing rnams 'byung ba'i sgra; ; zad pa med pa'i dbyangs su sgrog /
sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs sgra dang / / tshad med sa dang pha rol phyin/ / chos kyi rang bzhin sgra dag kyang / / kha cig zhing na rab tu grag /
kun tu bzang po smon lam gyi/ / sgra ni zhing rnams bye ba 'byin/ / bskal bar gnas shing rab tu sgrog / sgra dbyangs 'byin pa zad mi shes/ /
zhing gi dbyings rnams la la na/ / sangs rgyas rnam par sprul pa yi/ / sgra yis chos kyi dbyings bkang ba/ / de dag kun na rab tu grags/ /

Some lands are terrifying, With great howls of pain, Those voices most bitter and harsh, Frightening all who hear.
The realms of hells and beasts As well as the nether worlds: These are polluted, evil worlds, From which always come cries of pain and distress.
There are some lands That always produce enjoyable sounds, Pleasing, in accord with the teaching; This is attained by pure deeds.
In some lands are always heard Heavenly sounds of various gods, Pure sounds of celestial realms, Or the voices of leaders of the worlds.
There are some lands That produce wonderful sounds from clouds; They’re filled with jewel seas, Crystal trees, and music.
In the auras of the Buddhas Are endless magical voices And those of enlightening beings Heard throughout all lands:
The voices expounding the teaching In inconceivably many lands, The voices produced by the ocean of vows, The wondrous tales of practical action.
The Buddhas of past, present, and future, Are born in the various worlds, Fulfilling all their epithets, Their voices without any end;
In some lands is heard The voice of all Buddhas’ powers; The stages, the transcendent ways, and such Teachings are all expounded.
The power of the vows of universal good Intones wondrous sayings in billions of worlds, That sound like thunder shaking, Remaining for endless ages.
The Buddhas in pure lands Manifest independent speech Heard by one and all Throughout the cosmos, everywhere.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ /sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rnam par dgod pa shin tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ste/ le'u dgu pa'o// //
